content:
Posted: October 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								Note: Summary at the bottom of the review.Your colony ship just hit something in orbit, just as you arrived at your destination. Your lifeboat pod has crashed down, and the only other human occupant is injured and need medical attention. You have no weapons, barely any food, and your only tool is a simple knife. Welcome to Planet Explorers.Luckily, the above is not a huge problem, because this game lets you craft all of the above, and not just craft it, you can actually build your own guns and transport, chosing exactly how they should look by adding base parts (a gun has to have at least one muzzle and a grip) and then building the shape of your gun piece by piece from there. This is an Alpha game, and like all games still in early access, that means that things are not optimized. You will experience lag. You will find bugs (both the kind that tries to eat you, and the kind that just annoys you). And the grass...is awful. I recommend turning it off. Look beyond that though, and you find an exellent sandbox game that gives you a lot of freedom as to how you play and what you do. It is, even in its current "rough" state, a better game than many similar games that are considered a finished product. In short, it is a FUN game, that hopefully has a bright future!Pro:*A huge sandbox game with deformable terrain.*A very good (if a bit complex) crafting system.*An interesting setting.Con (these may be fixed before launch):*The grass is simply awful, but can be turned off.*Lag is not uncommon, especially if you've built a lot.*Still needs polish and optimization.Summary:If you are in the market for a 3D survival Sci-Fi Sandbox game, this is a solid choice that shows a lot of promise, even in its current unfinished state. If the developers sticks to it, this could easily become THE survival sandbox game to play. Even "as is" there is a lot to explore and do, and you'll likely have fun doing it! 6/10 -Recommended.For more recomendations and reviews: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/strandedkerbonaut#curation

Early Access Review
								A building game currently under development. Storyline is nice.  Multiplayer needs some help, but it has great potential.I love the fact that you can build your own stuff and use it, i however wish you could take those items before you build them and "try" them for free in a training ground area, something like what Arma did. another thing is that you can build your own stuff but there are so many restrictions to doing so.  for instance, why can't i have a heavy armoured vehicle with 12 wheels? <which would be a tank, "heavy armoured vehicle">  more so why can't i build a gun with more that 3 barrels or one with 2 grips... the creations system leaves alot to be desired.  All that aside, if you love to explore, killing, gathering, and create with only what you have gathered this is your game. Multiplayer requires less of that, more of getting to a minable, profitable, ore quickly without dying with the trader being 'at will' you can sell everything you mine and get all the good gear in no time at all.  the biggest thing i have an issue with on multiplayer is that player to player interactives.  ie.  i can't use ladders from other players, i load under someone's builing after being fast traveled there,  and so on...  There is also no damn clock on the mutiplayer side.  and it seems you get more weather effects during the day time which makes lighting a must.All and all at this moment of the dev. of this game, it still is fun to play and challenging enough to want to keep playing.

content:
Posted: March 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is addicting. It is very similar to Minecraft (just to throw a reference point out there), but is so much more than that.The crafting system is simple enough, but the building system (for making your own things) can be quite complex and difficult.It does not hold your hand, in fact it kind of throws you into it. It does have a questline that help explain things and give you guides on how to do things, but you can run into things you are not prepared for at all.The graphics are a little low-end, even when running on the "Fantatsic" setting. I hope they get revamped before final release, but it doesn't harm the gameplay any.Monsters can get out of your league real quick. (If it's bigger than a dog, be careful)The music is slightly annoying with how much it repeats, but my attention is usually elsewhere.Overall I give this game an 8/10.

content:
Posted: March 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								I have been looking for a Voxel game like this for a long long time. There is much much more in this game then you see in the pictures and videos above.Let me tell you about this game from start to finish of my entire experience. I only bought this game this morning so this should be short right? Its only been like 17 hours right?... Oh wait, I have around 17 hours play time!I logged out just a few moments ago for the first time... but I am getting way ahead of myself.I had been browsing Steam and other various places to buy games that sell games like Planet Explorers, as I have been testing out many of these early access type games. I have been working on many different things in many different games in order to find a game to suit my craving for the ultimate gaming experience.I decided to test out this game this weekend as I had a little extra money this weekend and it has been a game that I have been doing my home work on over the past few weeks.After getting into the game and checking out some of the basic things and getting addicted, my friend logs in and I talk to him about the game and he decides to get it.  Now logging out of the Story mode single player (awesome single player story line btw I Highly recommend playing through it, although I have not done the entire story line I have several hours into it and it is pretty neat) and starting up our own server hosted on my buddies computer. His brother gets online as well and buys the game as we tell him its awesome and the 3 of us romp around for several hours till one of them has to work. I have to day off so I get swept away into Planet Explorers and can't stop playing it... its now 3am and I have been online playing this game since around the time I bought it at like 11am... I have to work, but first I have to sleep. I can't wait to learn more about this awesome game and update this further, but already I am sure that this is an awesome game indeed!********************************************************NOTE TO DEVS************************************************If any Devs happen to read this, here are some suggestions that would more then likely make this game one of the all time greatest games. Here are just a few things that I personally think if added (if possible) would blow this game further into awesomeness!**Main Update**- Add Space!!!! This is Planet Explorers, we should be able to explore other planets. Give us the ability to build vehicles that have the ability to get into orbit and then give us visability of other planets that we can fly too.         **Inside Main Space Update**                   -Different Planets- mean diffrenet content, with what you already have now I am sure coming up with 5-10 differnt planet combinations would take a lot of work but would also be do able.... I think...!                    -Space Travel- I don't want to build some machine that puts me onto another planet, I want to be able to physically launch off of the current planet and go find another one.                   -Different Level Planets- Different types of monsters, elements, ratio of gravity, rarity of resources, hazard terrain, and much much much more. The possibilities are endless with how many different planets you could create!                   -Help with thought and design- You know you have an awesome game here, so lets give access to those who want to help. Let people help you by allowing us to design our own content! Give Devs and programmers what they need to make modifications that you can install to the main game. I mean you are still in Early Access right? What if you released a prebeta version that had the above and below modifications?**Quick Updates**(Bugs) -Combat is a little off scale and glitchy (Content)- Could you give us some more building materials? Or give us more creative ability? We can do a lot already, but the more we have access to the more ideas we will come up with. Not complaining about what we already have but here are a few ideas of what I would like to see.More EnginesJetsSpace Rocket MaterialsRocket Materials (BIG ONES!)Solar Energy Capabilities (I mean we should have this I think if we have the ability to travel to other planets)Space TravelVoxel Space (Make space FUN!)Aliens! (The UFO currently in game is kinda cool but also kinda boring, could beef it up with little aliens that jump out of it or something haha who knows.)Planes! We can build helicopters but no planes :( We have no jet engines.Astroids, we have a thermosphere so we don't have astroids slamming into our cities very often but... on other planets... who knows what might happen? Maybe have some with new minerals, or ores...?Crash Landings-Who knows who else is out there, or if they are even human! Obviously we are not alone as their are plenty of other alien creatures on this one single planet already.... Would be cool to have random things hit planets you are on.Multiple PlanetsAstroids in SpaceStarsMoonsPlanet Moons/Astroid Belts/RingsMore Ocean, well anything.... just more Ocean stuff. There isn't anything there atm.There is so much this game could be yet so much that it already is.Thank you devs if you read this, and hope to hear from you soon.********************************************************************************Other then what I have already said this game is super awesome and everything I expected and then more times 100. If you are looking for endless fun pick up this game while it is in Early Access as $25 is absolutely work it in every way.-Lifemaul

content:
Posted: April 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								Likely the best voxel sandbox game to come out to date, Planet Explorers gives the player unprecidented freedom to design weapons, vehicles, and buildings; voxel by voxel. Lush environments, a great story line, active ecology, and the ability to harvest from almost anything you can see on screen make this the most compelling sandbox game currently available. As of this writing; there are a few technical issues, none of which are show stoppers (indeed I have only had one crash ever) and most of the bugs are cosmetic in nature. Not bad for a game in early alpha. This title shows great promise as a freeform Adventure RPG and creative sandbox experience. I'm hooked and impatiently awaiting a0.76!

content:
Posted: May 18, 2014
Early Access Review
								A true Indie gem, I got on the Planet Explorer boat back when the game first showed on Kickstarter. Since then many updates have come to the game. They have delivered so far most of thier kickstarter promises and intend to furfill, in the future upcoming updates, more material that seperates PE from other sandbox games.+Frequent updates+Quick bug fixes+3D sandbox with unlimited potential+Amazing artistic creativity in NPC (wildlife) and a flowing envirement.+In game creation system ( A tool which will allow you to design your own weapons, vehicles, aircraft, and boats)+Inexpensive You cannot go wrong with the price for a sandbox - Sound (basically simple animal sounds and player noises.) In order to better encompass the player in the game a more diverse array of sounds would be great. - AI is almost aweful, with all the NPC's in this game upgrading the AI is peramount to having a fluid game. Too often are NPC followers  stuck in a ditch or animals frozen with utter stupidity.- Camara, this has been updated recently however it seems to still be an issue with me while I am mining/tunneling. Above all, PE is a well-rounded game that deserves more attention. It has a refreshing atmosphere that indeed implores you to explore. I would recommend!

content:
Posted: March 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								(First off I appologize for my poor grammer im not very smart)...(30+hours before steam release)..The key aspect of this is Early acess. We all know what it is. A game thats not quite finished but the devs are selling it at its current state to have more money to improve, and/or speed up the devolopment process. That being said planet explorers is completley playable, and enjoyable in its current state. The most appealing aspect is the sandbox gameplay, being able to mine resourses and dynamicly build almost anything you can imagine ( buildings, swords, guns, land and air vehicles. How well you build it will determine how well it works). the terrain deformation is incredibal, I always get a little giddy when digging a tunnel underground. the randomly generated worlds are beautifull, and almost every part of it can be gathered as resources. all in all it is an awsome game. yes a little buggy (early acess) but well worth playing.

content:
Posted: May 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								Keep in mind that this review is based on the alpha version of the game. Alright to start I can say that at this moment Planet Explorers is not finished at all, however it is still entertaining to play...in single player mode. Single player is by far the most developed, and has an interesting story mode coupled with some voxel building and resource mining which are the current focuses. You can build your own home base, your own vehicles, weapons, and prop with a voxel manipulation program they have. Though if that's not really your cup of tea you do have the option of exploration, and the map is HUGE and has a very alien feeling. I don't want to say too much out of fear of spoilers, but you do get some interesting developments with the story mode on this planet. Multi player is too underdeveloped to really get into. Right now it's generally confined to exploration with your friends or co-op builds. I would recommend this game, but I would suggest waiting till beta is well underway before purchasing.

content:
Posted: October 17, 2014
Early Access Review
								Very well made game, especially for alpha. There are still a few bugs, but from my experience (20 hours on record as of this writing) none have been game breaking. So the good and the bad:Good: Good sandbox with a story lineDecent graphics and well textured "alien fauna and flora"Powerful item maker (although somewhat limited) allows for creation of your own weapons/vehiclesVast amounts of resources that can be combined into other parts etc making for a rich and rewarding crafting systemSeemingly active Dev teamNeutral:Ok voice acting, not the best but still not badSometimes NPC's can be annoying or in your way other times very helpfullack of ability to make your own armor types (in creative mode)Adventure mode (the free roam survival) is somewhat lacking in depth Build mode devoid of NPC's and animalsStill in AlphaBad:Can be somewhat glitchy (rubberbanding NPCs, sometimes textures disappear from ground)Adventure/Build mode procedural generation distance appears to be fairly close so lots of stuff "popping" in including the landscapeConclusion: Excellent for an alpha/early access with lots of features implemented and working well. Shows extreme amounts of promise/potential as long as devs keep working hard at it. Worth the $15 I dropped on it while it was on sale for sure, try the demo on the dev website and if crafting/sandbox/survival games are your thing this is DEFINITELY a game for you.

								I've played this game for about 5 hours and the only thing keeping me from playing it more is writing this review. Adventure mode is fun as hell, and I can't wait to play this in multiplayer with my friends. I bought this game while it was on sale on 10/14/14 for 15 dollars and I don't regret it what so ever. I'll re-review this when it finishes, but for now I'll give it a 7/10

content:
Posted: March 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								Personally, and professionally, I'd wait till this game is no longer Early Access. Don't get me wrong, it's a great game and shows a ton of potential. Using Voxels beyond what Minecraft has done is AWESOME, and the graphics, gameplay, combat, feel natural.With that said however, it needs a bit more polish, it's a tad glitchy, even if most of the game stoppers have been killed. There's the little bugs, the annoying, 'I was in a cave digging rock and poof! I'm outside!' or 'why is that ten ton beast on top of a tree 1/5 his size?' minor grammer bugs need work, dialog voices need better volume as you can't hear them... at all. More things need added, ect ect ect.Again, whats there is great, what can be is better, but right now... wait to buy. This will be my official review (FOR NOW), it's a great concept, and great game play, but it needs a wee bit more time for some polish. If you can ignore the 'minor issues', however, buy this game right away. Otherwise, wait, trust me, add this to your wish list, in 6 to 8 months, buy it then, it'll be worth the wait.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								Planet Explorers has come a long way from its Kickstarter days. Comparing it to Minecraft, as is inevitable with a voxel-based sandbox game, Planet Explorers offers a far greater range of user-created content from weapons to structures, and it actually has a story! If you're looking for a survival experience without all the usual horror aspects, and don't mind a Nintendo-hard difficulty spike midway through the current story, Planet Explorers is a wonderful sci-fi-fantasy romp that can only be stopped by Firebears. Seriously... Fire. Bears.

content:
Posted: August 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								I put almost 100 hours on this game in the course of a few of weeks.  If you like 3D modeling and being able to make and immediately be able to play with your creations in game and share them with others then you will get hooked.You can host or play  persistant worlds where players can come and go exploring randomly generated terrain and unique wildlife.   The game is alpha still but VERY playable and few bugs.  I've played for hours at a time without a glitch or crash, though currently the game may run out of memory after some hours until the 64-bit version is ready.There is a little bit of story in single player, but I enjoy hopping on multiplayer servers and meeting others in game.UPDATE: over 650 hours in and it's still my favorite game despite whatever bugs come and go through its early development. Pathea is doing a great job listening to players and making things right for us!This game has excellent support for the Linux community.  There is a native linux client and a headless server that is very easy on resources, even when run on a small VPS.

								In it's current state this game is recommended with some caution,The game play itself is amazing you can design and build basically anything you've ever dreamed of, But doing it with friends is difficult because connectivity and available servers or working servers are next to non existent to play on.There is next to no multiplayer, a total of 50 people playing this game at one time, all in individual games playing aloneAnd if you manage to get into the same game as someone else, Anything you build any base object can simply be taken by other people while your offline or online, so you want to build a base? content:
Posted: October 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								"Planet Explorers" is a voxel based game, often compared to Minecraft or Terarria. However, it is an entirely different game with a different focus and mood. It has an exstensive crafting system where YOU plan EVERY block to your liking, which is a real breath of fresh air and adds some creativity to the mix. Please note this game is early access, so it has flaws. A major flaw is the stiff combat. It is DEFINATELY a work in progress. However, it has the potential to turn in Monster Hunter combat, which if you haven't played is a game about hunting monsters(duh) with very fluid and energetic combat. Although I haven't personally played it much and it is early access, I can definitely reccomend it, at least for now.

Posted: March 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								With 20hrs under the belt I can safely say that this game is fantastic.  There is so much to do and so much life to the game.  I will break it down by features.Graphics:The graphics are great.  There isn't as much control over what features pertaining to graphics are used but enough to make sure your system can run it properly.  At full quality it looks stunning.  Light permeating through tree leaves, a nice not-over-done bloom effect, AA, it all works great and runs smooth.  Very pleasing to the eyes.  The voxel engine handles very well and even with an older video card, the game handles it all very well and even displays very far into the distance (im using a nvidia 560ti).    The weather is handled very nice and looks good.  Night time is actual night time.  You can hardly see at pitch black and need a torch or light.  Characters:It is great that they allow you to create your own custom character like sims or elderscrolls games.  The NPCs are active but not to the extent of say skyrim where they have jobs.  They sort of just stand around and walk here and there. You can talk to them and get a lot of story background which is great.  You can even enlist some of them to fight beside you and you can equip them with armor and weapons and whatnot.  The mercenaries have their own set of special skills too.  Some are great with swords and others with guns and so on.  Adds nicely to who you choose to follow you.  I like that the mercenaries reappear beside you when you get too far from them.Story:Great story line.  Makes you want to learn more and more about what is going on.  This coming from a guy that usually is not interested in story.  I found myself wanting to know what happened.  That doesn't happen often at all.  Sound/music: The sound was good.  The music adjusted appropriately depending on where you were and whether or not you were in the area of a hostile enemy. It was a little glitchy but I've read they are fixing that.  Sound effects fit weapons and whatnot.  It could use more attention to vehicles and sounds but overall still good.Quests:The quests are your run of the mill quests.  They are good and add to the the story.  They don't always feel quite at all like a grind.  Some can be, but that is normal it seems.  Other quests are more detailed.  I will say there are some bad bugs with some of the quests that require a npc to follow you.  That npc is prone to get stuck at a tree or rock and unlike the mercs that you hire, the quest npcs don't reappear at your side if you move too far away.  I have found that if you have a quest npc with you, if you bring out a vehicle and get in it, the npc will rellocate to your vehicle which is an unintended fix.  This leads to problems early game especially when you are travelling long distances.  When you have quest npcs with you, you can't fast travel.  If they get unexpectedly stuck in a tree you have to travel all the way back to retreive them.  This can be frustrating. There are some quests that you receive early in the game that won't be completed until later.  Many have had problems with this.  I imagine it will be fixed in later versions given this game is only early access.  SOme quests are a little buggy but that is mostly due to the fact that npcs end up getting stuck in random places.  There was one quest involving two npcs and I couldn't complete the quest because one of the npcs randomly got stuck in a mountain side and I couldn't get him down until I dug out the mountain side.Building:The game contains a lot of building which is great.  Kind of like minecraft.  You can make your own weapons and vehicles and whatnot.  You require schematics to build things and sometimes require to build one thing in order to build another.  It doesn't get overly complicated though.  The difficulty of the build is often representative of the usefulness of what you are building.  For instance, you can't just easily build a helicopter.  It requires you build a cockpick, rotors, engines, energy cells, etc.  It is a very intuitive building system that takes a little time to get use to but once you are it is very easy to use.  There is a lot of fun to be had.  A lot of creativity that can be used.  I will say the game could do better at helping you understand the proper needs of a vehicle.  I made a dune-buggy type car and I had all the pieces but in game I got this red text at the bottom that told me the car is overpowered or something.  It never really told me why it was overpowered or how to fix it.  The car still worked fine as it was.  Enemies: There are a lot of animals and enemies in the game.  Many of the animals are docile until you attack them which is nice.  Some of the animals are hostile from the start and it is fun and interesting to see which animals will attack on site and which animals will run right beside you.  The enemies are dangerous too.  Some prefer to sit back and snipe you.  Others will come slinging swords and whatnot.  Some will even mount turrets and will sling rockets and bullets at your face.  The animals and enemies come in all shapes and sizes and the size of the mob usually indicates how dangerous they are.  There are a few points where you fight some extremely large enemies and they can prove quite hard to defeat.  I will say the ranged mobs seem a lot more easy to conquer given they can be dodged easily.  Overall: Wonderful game with a ton of potential.  It already has a great deal built into and most of what will probably come from later versions is just more content.  I hope they fix some of the not-so-obvious bugs mentioned above (I am sure they will).  Creating your own camp and playing tower defense was really fun.  Being able to craft cars and helicopters and then drive them around was extremely fun.  The game does a great job easing you into the features and concepts of the game.  Very fun and leaves you wanting more (it is in alpha so that is to be expected).  I look forward to future updates and highly recommend you buying this game now if you enjoy rpg and open world sandbox games like terraria and minecraft.  There is a lot of replayability built into the game and right now about 20hrs worth of straight story line with some random quests thrown in.  It is a very balanced game.

Early Access Review
								(Early Access Review) Already a really fun game, and will be even better upon release. Very similar UI/ feel of an old MMO like "asherons call" but huge, singleplayer (multi fully does exist, I have not tried), with mining, crafting, hunting, and a great building system for vehicles and equipment. It even has a colony building and management system! Visually not bad at all, not amazing, but it is always improving and sometimes when the light catches trees or a vista correctly I still catch myself amazed by the world and its beauty. All of this is the foundation on a fun and interesting world, with decent missions and NPC writing, and a very imaginative and diverse ecosystem of wacky alien flora and fauna.

content:
Posted: October 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								Note: Summary at the bottom of the review.Your colony ship just hit something in orbit, just as you arrived at your destination. Your lifeboat pod has crashed down, and the only other human occupant is injured and need medical attention. You have no weapons, barely any food, and your only tool is a simple knife. Welcome to Planet Explorers.Luckily, the above is not a huge problem, because this game lets you craft all of the above, and not just craft it, you can actually build your own guns and transport, chosing exactly how they should look by adding base parts (a gun has to have at least one muzzle and a grip) and then building the shape of your gun piece by piece from there. This is an Alpha game, and like all games still in early access, that means that things are not optimized. You will experience lag. You will find bugs (both the kind that tries to eat you, and the kind that just annoys you). And the grass...is awful. I recommend turning it off. Look beyond that though, and you find an exellent sandbox game that gives you a lot of freedom as to how you play and what you do. It is, even in its current "rough" state, a better game than many similar games that are considered a finished product. In short, it is a FUN game, that hopefully has a bright future!Pro:*A huge sandbox game with deformable terrain.*A very good (if a bit complex) crafting system.*An interesting setting.Con (these may be fixed before launch):*The grass is simply awful, but can be turned off.*Lag is not uncommon, especially if you've built a lot.*Still needs polish and optimization.Summary:If you are in the market for a 3D survival Sci-Fi Sandbox game, this is a solid choice that shows a lot of promise, even in its current unfinished state. If the developers sticks to it, this could easily become THE survival sandbox game to play. Even "as is" there is a lot to explore and do, and you'll likely have fun doing it! 6/10 -Recommended.For more recomendations and reviews: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/strandedkerbonaut#curation

Early Access Review
								A building game currently under development. Storyline is nice.  Multiplayer needs some help, but it has great potential.I love the fact that you can build your own stuff and use it, i however wish you could take those items before you build them and "try" them for free in a training ground area, something like what Arma did. another thing is that you can build your own stuff but there are so many restrictions to doing so.  for instance, why can't i have a heavy armoured vehicle with 12 wheels? <which would be a tank, "heavy armoured vehicle">  more so why can't i build a gun with more that 3 barrels or one with 2 grips... the creations system leaves alot to be desired.  All that aside, if you love to explore, killing, gathering, and create with only what you have gathered this is your game. Multiplayer requires less of that, more of getting to a minable, profitable, ore quickly without dying with the trader being 'at will' you can sell everything you mine and get all the good gear in no time at all.  the biggest thing i have an issue with on multiplayer is that player to player interactives.  ie.  i can't use ladders from other players, i load under someone's builing after being fast traveled there,  and so on...  There is also no damn clock on the mutiplayer side.  and it seems you get more weather effects during the day time which makes lighting a must.All and all at this moment of the dev. of this game, it still is fun to play and challenging enough to want to keep playing.

content:
Posted: February 23, 2015
												To whomever cares to read.Got this game more than a year ago, Before ARK and all these survival craziness games popped up. It had a brilliant idea and the gameplay was very good. To create and share ANY ISO (weapon, vehicle, etc) it’s astonishing. It’s a game with mods build into its heart.HOWEVER.... in my opinion. The devs made a big mistake trying to update the Unity (forgot witch number). Game was close to a finish date, and due to this new Coding, the setback was ...Huge...The updates were delayed, because they were working on the core of the game again and the momentum was lost.As it is, the game is very much playable. Not finished, but by far well more polished the ARK and some other survival games. (it’s not a "survival game" apologies for using ARK as example so much)Multi player it’s quite fun, even though some computer savvy might be needed. Simple player it’s very entertaining. If you have the patience to create this game has the tools to make some majestic creations.About the price drop... Inevitable. Like I mention, after years and development and all this new trend to build/survival games, this game needs an active community, creating, trading ISOs to be enjoyable. so better to drop the price and get more people to join then let the game die after finally "finished". Devs kept us updated all the way, and even though i disagree with some decisions made, they were very responding and reliable to finish a game that had great potential and could had been forgotten after their initial success on sales. I recommend this game, and I will keep an eye for future projects.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								To say this game is pretty incredible would be an understatement, but that comes with some major caveats. I am very happy that i paid to support this early access project and i cannot wait for the final product, but i am not sure i am going to allow myself to play further till they expand the content. What I mean by content is not how much the game has to offer but, the way in which the progression takes place. I basically do not want to ruin the experience of this title before it is ready to be enjoyed. While understanding that this game is in alpha right now, in story mode it took less than 3 hours to progress directly from wooden swords to handguns and auto turrets (including processor production for the turrets). This basically meant skipping stone, iron and copper swords/shields/bows varieties, not to mention the countless other recipes that i have completely never had to use. When this game's story mode is quest complete and balanced, i can imagine the necessity of a more balanced progression requiring the use of most recipes encountered. While the game runs pretty reliably, i have had a couple of crashes when switching out of game mode to look up what kind of creature i need to kill to complete a quest. Other bugs seem to be lack of indicating where to click to harvest certain things, text hidden behind mouse cursor, really dumb ai and animals floating in mid air. While the graphics and lighting are stellar the grass textures they are using are animated 2d sprites that rotate normal to the camera, ala trees in mario 64. Pro's: incredible graphicsbeautifully created alien worldfull featured terrain editing/buildinglots and lots and lots and lots of contentCon's:bugs with ai, graphics crashesnot completebalancing issues (too easy)Bottom line this game looks to be a major winner, but i am going to hold out a bit and catch up on some backlog so i can enjoy a more complete experience in a few months.

content:
Posted: April 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								I guess now would be a good time to write a review though I have never done one before.Planet Explorers I feel reminds me most of an old mmo called Star Wars Galaxies. This game combines house building, vehicle building, armor crafting, weapon crafting, and technology. As well as the normal monster huting and looting, though it is unlike you will find a weapon on a random creature.This game does have its bugs as is seen when a creature some how manages to float up a tree without moving, but hey... its alpha. The combat is fun though a bit repeatitive on the actions, same swinging animation. But to be honest the game is very fun, and a different trend then the MMO that we are used to. The graphics may fall short but this does not mean that the sceen is any less beautiful. The landscape is vast and its quite daunting to consider how long it will take to explore all of it... and thats just for the main story line.Now I believe something I should touch base on is the crafting system. As I mentioned very indepth but a bit hard to understand first off. Items you need to make you first must get the recipe from mobs or NPC's. After that you then have to find the resources and craft the specific item which is normal enough. But when you look to create a vehicle you must make sure to have the specific items your going to use when crafting it in your editor.The mining, herb picking, and diging is all very fluent and easy to get the hang of. I would highly recommend this game if you are looking for something to keep you interested while waiting for the next big mmo. I personally have not tried the multiplayer yet, but from what I understand it does work... and to be honest whats better then exploring a massive span of land with some friends.I look forward to the future updates this game offers, and I hope many of you enjoy this game as much as I do.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								With 20hrs under the belt I can safely say that this game is fantastic.  There is so much to do and so much life to the game.  I will break it down by features.Graphics:The graphics are great.  There isn't as much control over what features pertaining to graphics are used but enough to make sure your system can run it properly.  At full quality it looks stunning.  Light permeating through tree leaves, a nice not-over-done bloom effect, AA, it all works great and runs smooth.  Very pleasing to the eyes.  The voxel engine handles very well and even with an older video card, the game handles it all very well and even displays very far into the distance (im using a nvidia 560ti).    The weather is handled very nice and looks good.  Night time is actual night time.  You can hardly see at pitch black and need a torch or light.  Characters:It is great that they allow you to create your own custom character like sims or elderscrolls games.  The NPCs are active but not to the extent of say skyrim where they have jobs.  They sort of just stand around and walk here and there. You can talk to them and get a lot of story background which is great.  You can even enlist some of them to fight beside you and you can equip them with armor and weapons and whatnot.  The mercenaries have their own set of special skills too.  Some are great with swords and others with guns and so on.  Adds nicely to who you choose to follow you.  I like that the mercenaries reappear beside you when you get too far from them.Story:Great story line.  Makes you want to learn more and more about what is going on.  This coming from a guy that usually is not interested in story.  I found myself wanting to know what happened.  That doesn't happen often at all.  Sound/music: The sound was good.  The music adjusted appropriately depending on where you were and whether or not you were in the area of a hostile enemy. It was a little glitchy but I've read they are fixing that.  Sound effects fit weapons and whatnot.  It could use more attention to vehicles and sounds but overall still good.Quests:The quests are your run of the mill quests.  They are good and add to the the story.  They don't always feel quite at all like a grind.  Some can be, but that is normal it seems.  Other quests are more detailed.  I will say there are some bad bugs with some of the quests that require a npc to follow you.  That npc is prone to get stuck at a tree or rock and unlike the mercs that you hire, the quest npcs don't reappear at your side if you move too far away.  I have found that if you have a quest npc with you, if you bring out a vehicle and get in it, the npc will rellocate to your vehicle which is an unintended fix.  This leads to problems early game especially when you are travelling long distances.  When you have quest npcs with you, you can't fast travel.  If they get unexpectedly stuck in a tree you have to travel all the way back to retreive them.  This can be frustrating. There are some quests that you receive early in the game that won't be completed until later.  Many have had problems with this.  I imagine it will be fixed in later versions given this game is only early access.  SOme quests are a little buggy but that is mostly due to the fact that npcs end up getting stuck in random places.  There was one quest involving two npcs and I couldn't complete the quest because one of the npcs randomly got stuck in a mountain side and I couldn't get him down until I dug out the mountain side.Building:The game contains a lot of building which is great.  Kind of like minecraft.  You can make your own weapons and vehicles and whatnot.  You require schematics to build things and sometimes require to build one thing in order to build another.  It doesn't get overly complicated though.  The difficulty of the build is often representative of the usefulness of what you are building.  For instance, you can't just easily build a helicopter.  It requires you build a cockpick, rotors, engines, energy cells, etc.  It is a very intuitive building system that takes a little time to get use to but once you are it is very easy to use.  There is a lot of fun to be had.  A lot of creativity that can be used.  I will say the game could do better at helping you understand the proper needs of a vehicle.  I made a dune-buggy type car and I had all the pieces but in game I got this red text at the bottom that told me the car is overpowered or something.  It never really told me why it was overpowered or how to fix it.  The car still worked fine as it was.  Enemies: There are a lot of animals and enemies in the game.  Many of the animals are docile until you attack them which is nice.  Some of the animals are hostile from the start and it is fun and interesting to see which animals will attack on site and which animals will run right beside you.  The enemies are dangerous too.  Some prefer to sit back and snipe you.  Others will come slinging swords and whatnot.  Some will even mount turrets and will sling rockets and bullets at your face.  The animals and enemies come in all shapes and sizes and the size of the mob usually indicates how dangerous they are.  There are a few points where you fight some extremely large enemies and they can prove quite hard to defeat.  I will say the ranged mobs seem a lot more easy to conquer given they can be dodged easily.  Overall: Wonderful game with a ton of potential.  It already has a great deal built into and most of what will probably come from later versions is just more content.  I hope they fix some of the not-so-obvious bugs mentioned above (I am sure they will).  Creating your own camp and playing tower defense was really fun.  Being able to craft cars and helicopters and then drive them around was extremely fun.  The game does a great job easing you into the features and concepts of the game.  Very fun and leaves you wanting more (it is in alpha so that is to be expected).  I look forward to future updates and highly recommend you buying this game now if you enjoy rpg and open world sandbox games like terraria and minecraft.  There is a lot of replayability built into the game and right now about 20hrs worth of straight story line with some random quests thrown in.  It is a very balanced game.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20
												This is one of those games that SHOULD be in early access. For the price they are demanding from you for this, it's unfinished and buggy.LIST OF ISSUES:The character models are not pretty to look at and are constantly shaking on screen (that could be just me). There isn't a whole lot of customization or armor/clothing choices to make up for it either. As someone who cares a bunch about the look of my avatar, having good armor and weapons to look forward too is great gameplay incentive. But that is missing here.At one point, all of the items in the game got their labels switched around. For the rest of my playthrough, dirt blocks were called "Carrot seeds" and arrows were "Motor Tires" for example.The world is very nice looking and vast, but it's empty and uneventful, besides the plants and trees you can gather. If you're going to make a BIG world, you need to actually HAVE things IN it.The audio work is a mess. Random sounds come from all sides of you and hardly ever sync with the actual direction it's supposed to come from. The ocean could be on my left and the sound of the ocean will come from the right side. Animal sounds and other similar sounds are so much louder and jarring than eveything else and are completely imbalanced. And while we're on the subject, the voice acting is laughable at best.I know this game is focused more on exploration (hence the name) but the "survival" part of the game is lacking. It's more of "meter babysitting" than it is actual survival. It's just a distraction rather then feeling immersive.The one saving grace of this game is the fact that you can shape the land around you freely. You can dig straight into the ground and dig a tunnel, which I actually found fun. Too bad that and nearly every kind of terra-forming in this game is so damn tedious. Chopping a tree can take so SO long, up to 45 seconds sometimes and the digging in incredibly inconsistent. One time you might dig out a bit of land but then the next consecutive clicks only progress you a few centimeters it seems.In short, the first hour or so made for a good laugh but after that there's not much else to look forward to. And my hopes sunk low when I read around and saw that apparently that haven't done much to improve the game since 2014.So I'll keep following this game, but I'm definately refunding it for now.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 12
												I wish there was a "neutral" option but there isn't so I will attempt to remember to update my review If/When new updates come out that change the game.Overall Problems:      * The game plays like it was Very rushed with very little planning or attention to detail.  It has a very complex building system but no explanation as to how to use it, this could be tolerated in an Alpha game, but this should have been fixed before the game left Beta.      * The dialogue by followers is very cheesy and not vey well thought out as is most of the dialogue in the story.      * Folowers don't obey the settings like passive, stay ect. They also can't help you do anything but attack stuff and cut down trees. they do not mine resources or even collect water.      * There are no real directions or explanation of anything in game, you have to fumble through figuring out how building in every mode works and map settings if you are playing adventure mode.        * No tools to collect resources fast, everything is collected by hand, the colony "processor" will collect resources but much slower than you can collect with the lowest level tools.       * Everytime night comes around you get tons of notices that your colonists are too tired to work.        * Your colony Weapons can destroy your own base parts and your own vehicles.       * Colonists don't make their own food, you have to make the food and put it in the storage.       * You have to have all the resources for building in your personal inventory even if you are building with the colony replicator.        * There are still alot of Alpha level bugs.Story mode:      The story is okay, nothing that I would reinstall the game to play again. The conversation text is full of typo's and outright wrong words in places, and the story just ends.Adventure mode:     Adventure mode has several settings, but there is nothing explaining map setup, or tool level progression if you choose that option.  There are also not enough options in world genereation.    If you start with all items scripts already learned and there is no need to interact wil NPC's at all, if you choose to start without all the scrips already learned and you have to do alot of quests to learn to build what you need to start a colony.   Resources in this mode seem to be very deep in the gound with no settings that let you bring them closer to the surface that I was able to find.Multiplayer:        I Played on several servers, the major problem I found was that other players can simply enter build mode and take any materials you place, on one server players just picked up and took all my colony buildings without being part of my colony. ---------------------------------------------------------------------I will recommend this game if you can find the game on sale for $12 usb or less, don't get me wrong, it's an okay game once you figure out how to do everything but I don't think it's worth the $25 usd price they are asking for it.

number of helpful: 19 of 39 people (49%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 23
												The game is too slow moving and the difficulty ramps up to impossible as soon as you finish the tutorial.  It feels like it needed more time easing the game play loop's difficulty curve.  I baught this to play with a friend and didn't have fun after the first two hours.  I'd avoid this.  This is the type of game you won't know doesn't suit you till the refund timelimit passes.The game has good ideas, but the execution needs refinement.  I'll revisit this later if I hear of any updates that improve things.  There is a good game in here, it just needs to be polished a bit more.Update: 3/31As I said I would, I gave this another try for about another 2 hours.  The lack of instruction on what the options actually mean when creating a multiplayer game was very frustrating.  It was also very frustrating when you would play with the tech tree on and you have no option to filter out things you don't have the skill to craft.  Also, the crafting drop down to let you move to a section, like... armor to helmets, doesn't work.  Typing was also buggy, sometimes it didn't accept me hitting enter or sometimes glitched.We managed to have fun once we turned off the tech tree and figured out that we didn't need to find the nodes in the mineral scanner to find some materials needed for crafting, but it would have been nicer if this was better explained to us instead of us just having to find it out.Still, can't recommend this.  If this were in early access I could forgive a lot of the bugs I and my friend ran into, but you released it, so I can't just give you the "Well... it's in EA" excuse.  There can be fun in this, but the bugs will irritate you.If you can put up with it though, it can be fun, but I'm dissapointed by the number of bugs I had run into that ripped me out of the experience.If my opinion changes as I play it I will update the review once again with more details.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								Ill start with what I liked about the game:The single player is fairly fun, it has quests and the like. Crafting system is very basic and the UI is easy to understand. Graphics are nothing to write home about but are okay and playable in my opinion. The custom content creator is VERY cool which you can make custom 3D vehicles and weapons after getting used to it for about 10 minutes. The content you made can be seen in-game right after you make it (after you purchase it and materials). Its also a voxel game which means the mining and everything is in 3D as opposed to minecraft where its all blocks. Combat can also be fun against certain mobs and large boss monsters. The vehicles and equipment can be fun to use like the jetpack + glider.Why I don't recommend it:First of all the game has been in development for about 3 years now and I still feel like its VERY unfinnished. Most of my complaint is the multiplayer. The lobby is REALLY buggy and attempting to connect to friends can be a pain. Me and my friends played it for about 25 or so hours (steam says only 10 because it disables after you close the launcher) and we pretty much did all that you can do in the game and quickly got bored. Building structures is very lame and unrewarding as there is practically no actual use for them other than aesthetics (they also look terrible). It also feels very awkward to build and you don't get much choice in materials and objects to use. The survival element is mostly just fighting off monsters. Which until you can afford to buy weapons, is almost impossible. You also have NO reason to craft items as you can BUY everything via in-game shop which after you just mine random ores and sell it you can buy anything you want fairly quickly, you get end-game content in under an hour if you wanted.I feel like the game is VERY lackluster in content and will only keep you entertained for 30 hours at most before you get bored of it. They say they will release the game sometime in 2014 and if they do at this state then that means this game is a ripoff. There was also plenty of bugs but because it is early access I won't have that as a reason for my unrecommendation.

number of helpful: 9 of 19 people (47%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								(version 0.86) So 6 hours of play time and then the game totally stuffs up and I cant load a single saved game.  Hours of fun searching forums for fixes that dont work, and Im forced to start again... FARK!!!!!So far the game looks great, seems like a lot of fun, has potential, but all of that is ruined when the game isnt properly playable.  I know its "early access" but I am SO SICK of that BS excuse devs generally pull out to explain any problems.  You release a game and charge people real money for it, then something basic like loading a saved game fails... leaves a pretty sour taste. (See Update below for possible fix)After 26 hours of play and having (apparently) completed Act 2 of the story, Im about to give up until the next update... I currently cant move anywhere north of the plains zone without the game crashing. Pros:+ Graphics are decent for a voxel game+ Engaging gameplay (think minecraft but more detailed and mature)+ Sounds arent too bad but need refining for distance / ambience effects+ Story campaign is interesting enough so far and a good way to learn the mechanics etc+ Intereting item / building mechancsCons:- Save game issues mentioned (ranted about) above- fairly sparse world - needs more living things- camera needs some work- AI pathfinding needs some improving- Creatures will chase you FOREVER until you kill them or die- Fighting is a little rudimentary- Quest / story bugs...losing track of NPCs etc- MANY random crashes seemingly for no reasonVerdict:Buy it on special and wait until its a bit more ironed out before playing it.  Once the problems are fixed Ill probably change this to a "Yes" reccomendation :)Update:  Turns out the work-around for the save / load issue is to *only* save very far away from where you dig (particularly around the crater), and *not* to dig below sea level... so basically go back to a camp and save there.  Seems to work so far.Note: I am updating this review as I play more...10 Months Later:  Not much has changed.  The game is still half finished and a little broken.  This is why I dont buy Early Access anymore.

								I bought this game in 2014 early in its development because I thought it had potential, played it a bit and decided to leave it on the shelf for later. Last week I started a new game to see how things where going and it got me hooked! As it is now the single player story (which is well conceived and interesting btw) and the ISO editor (you can design vehicles, submarines, helicopters, boats, guns, armor, etc) are worth dozens of hours of fun. Its a sort of modern futuristic minecraft with a more elegant and advanced crafting system and UI that I very much enjoy. Highly recommended, can't wait for the final version.

content:
Posted: October 5, 2016
Early Access Review
-Updated Review-05/10/16EVERYTHING IM REVIEWING HERE IS MY PERSONAL OPINION.So please stay open minded!so as of recently gaining interest in the game once again, i decided to give it another shot!and while the game is fantastic in certian areas it has flaws. some extreme that need addressed and some minior that you can make do with on whatever mode you are playing. first let me just get straight to the point on a issue that needs to be resolved as of now, and il go into the pro's and cons of the game :)The game has moved from a 32bit version to 64bit only version (for now - 32bit will follow but with severly reduced features). the developers are extremely active on the discussions page on steam for the game, so if any questions or concerns with the game that need to be addressed you can post there knowing that a dev will reply in that very day you posted the thread.for anyone interested in the game that has a somewhat mid range PC, Please Be Aware the game is still in beta and optimzation is still a high priority for the devs (judging by comments left on discussions) however.. if you are just slightly above the "Minimal System Requirements" chances are you wont get that great of a gaming experience.the game is primarily GPU intesive and RAM instesive, IMHO the min specs need to be adjusted because a 460 wont even net you a stable 30FPS with the lowest settings (Fastest). im going to give a personal thought on what the min specs should be, just to serve as a guide line for for new purchasers and also to serve as what would be acceptable in terms of FPS!OS: Win 7/ 8 / 8.1/ 10 - 64bitProcessor: Quad Core - i5 2600k or better - 3.2GHz or better Memory: 8+ GB RAM Graphics: GTX 580 or better (dunno about AMD but look up the equivelent)DirectX: Version 10 / 11Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 10+ GB available space (SSD Recommend)Additional Notes: Must have OpenCL compatible CPU or GPU (DX10.1) 32bit can run, but will experience - Extremely bad frame rate / Slow load times for both 32/64bit (devs know about this issue and working on it) and the game has alot of crashes!i say these should be the new min specs because a dual core just simply wont cut it when you get to a certian stage in the game that requires you to make a colony. as soon as you start filling your colony, Your FPS will plummit... HARD! people have said they play fine at 50-60 or even 80-90FPS but when they start filling their colony and hit max population. they say their game hangs around the 18-26FPS / 24-33FPS range!now that the rambling is all done, onto the pro's and consPro's:- Fantastic Huge world to explore (in Single player)- Adventure offers unbound freedom (Randomly generated worlds)- Great World Editor- Amazing creation system (build miscellaneous objects / funriture / guns / cars / planes / heli's / boats / shields etc)- Great in world building - Decent colony managment - Good survival aspectsCons:- Story line is meh (not that appealing)- Voice acting could be better- Some aspects not really that well explained- Clunky camera positioning - very bad mouse options (using anything that requires aiming like bows and guns etc has a crap ton of mouse acceleration, not options displayed in settings)if your PC can handle the game, it serves as a very fun and entertaining game that allows people to build in some ways whatever they like.Total Score:7/10

content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								Aw yes, Planet Explorers. An excellent game in my most humblest of opinions (I'm probably the most humble guy there is, so I'd trust my judgement if I were you). Invariably fun, fully entertaining, and fully addicting. I've been playing non-stop for the last 127 hours. I haven't eaten, bathed, drank or even got up to use the restroom in all that time. And speaking of not using the restroom; I'm currently selling some quite stained socks if anyone is interested. They uhhh fell in some chocolate pudding... Believe me when I say that 'I definitely didn't defecate into those socks'. Don't ask me why I quoted that statement and I won't tell you how I invented a new type of poopsock, thus avoiding the possibility of breaking my immersion. All jokes aside though - Planet Explorers is a really really great game that is well worth the money. I hope the devs continue their awesome work. I suggest that any who read this should buy it immediately - before the price goes up (not that I know it will, but Early Access games commonly do when fully released). Buy it this very minute or you might be convinced to waste the rest of your holiday cash moneys on some guy's used poopsocks and totally regret it. You just KNOW he's gonna spend it all on new socks. I mean, he can't use the old ones, can he? Well, can he? I'm just asking for a uh friend because 127 hours seems about long enough for dooky squirts to dry. It could create what in scientific communities, is called: 'dooky shards', and they are both painful to be scratched by and will sometimes lead to Sepsis of the feet. Noone wants Septic feet right? Buy Planet Explorers.

content:
Posted: October 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is amazing. At first, it just seems like a nice solo survival game, but then it morphs into a game where you're creating your own equipment voxel-by-voxel (you can use others' creations if you don't want to design it yourself), building a colony, and managing a group of survivors. In single player, there's a campaign that is well written and interesting. Just with what's in the game now I can highly recommend it. I've played 80 hours up to this point, and I can easily say it's one of my best Early Access experiences. Development speed is on the slow end of the spectrum, but steady. Each release is sizeable, which makes for an interesting replay. Also, the music is fantastic. Seriously.

content:
Posted: November 21, 2016
What I liked: Sanbox to build and craft whatever you want Nice progression of items and techWhat You Need to Know: This game is so unpolished it's like it's still in early access Ok first voice acting is so terrible, why have it if it's bad, just leave it with text only. Trust me it would make the game better Next you have the combat which is so lackluster it makes factorio's combat look amazing. The enemies,some look intersting at first but their animations are lame, attacks are lackluster and overall the combat is floaty and underwhelming. So if your looking for depth in the combat look elswhere.  The first 15 or so hours is fantastic, you get to know the planet, what kills you, new minerals, quest that reward you with new crafting items, and great progression that reminds me of Terraria. After that the quests don't give rewards anymore. This made me not care to progress any further because I seem to have experienced most the game So what is the draw of the game if combat, questing, voice acting and the world get old quick. Well you can design and make your own armor, weapons, and vehicles in their version of of 3D modeling program, (think Besiege but more time comsuming, and you make the whole item from scrath if you want it custom, or just use the templates and modify them) The other draw is building up a base with your own colony with buildings that help you in gathering resources, building complicated crafting items and a place to defend if you want to go all Tower Defense in this game The beginning of the game is so packed with stuff to do, but the late game is filled with so many boring quests it made me quit playing the game, with that said, I will have to not recommend it, even though I enjoyed it for a while I love the factorio style crafting, building your own planes, helicopters and weapons and colony aspect, even though I can't get my self to finish the game right now.My Score:DPrice: 25Main reason for dislike: It's a jack of trades kind of game, lots of mechanics but none are fully polishedGames that it relates to:  Factrio (crafting and colony production) Terraria (Progression early game) Besiege( buidling aspect)

Early Access Review
								Boring game. Seems cool from the preview videos but nobody plays it. So if you're the kind of person who finds enjoyment by yourself with some Lego's and your imagination then you'll probably like this game... but the story mode is kind of empty and lacking... and multiplayer had 5 people on the busiest server... all spread out over the map not even interacting with eachother. There was only one PVP enabled server and it had 2 people on it. Games like this need an active world but instead of the game company running the servers and pushing players to populate one server they allow all kind of people to start their own server and if there is any one on it, its usually like one person. If I could get my money back on this game I would. Maybe in the future more people will play it and it will be worth spending money on... but if you're sick of wasting money on games through Steam that you hardly play... then keep moving. This will probably be one of those.

content:
Posted: February 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								Sick and tired of Early Access games full of hype and potential but havent been updated in months?  Planet Explorers is one of the best open world sandbox games currently in Early Access!  the devs have continued to update the game with patches that come out on a monthly basis if not more!  The Devs also maintain a constant stream of information flowing to the public in regards to the progress and status of the the next updates.The game itself has a very powerfull voxel creation system.  it allows you to create any type of weapon, vehicle or structure!The game is set on an alien planet where your vessel is forced to make an emergency landing, the story line takes deeper into the world as well as deeper into a political fiasco that places the survivors at risk of a civil war.this game is worth far more then its current price and is well worth it.

content:
Posted: March 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								If you have patience and don't mind waiting for something that will be special, get this game!  I might just buy it for some of my friends anyways!Random thoughts on the game:Game has tons of potential, the horrendously slow development time has been a pain in the butt, but at least they've not given up on it!Compared to the many other voxel games out there, I feel that this one allows you the most creativity and customization, just on a much smaller scale.  You can import your own textures and decals so that alone gives you nearly unlimited design possibilities.You want to make an exact replica of a WW2 Tommy Gun complete with serial numbers etched into the gun, you can!  You want to make an Apache Longbow on a 1:1 scale?  You can!  You want to make a wooden pirate ship?  You can!Trying to make a solid glass material, I accidentally made a block that changes color with the time of day, I call it a happy accident!Downside, no real flying vehicles, the airships may "fly", but they still handle like a car and can't even go over many trees.  Fortunately the hit boxes for the larger trees are ignored and you can go through them.Quests are a little buggy at times, but I am happy to notice that they are usually fixed as the community points them out and ones that aren't fixxable with a patch usually fix themselves after you save your game and reload it.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 24, 2015
Early Access Review
Planet Explorers is certainly one of the best games in Early Access. There are some bugs and a lack of polish, but overall a great buy.Pros Very full featured--By this, I mean it delivers all its core game mechanics with depth. Trading works. Crafting works. Crafting is multi-tiered. Crafting the items isn't hard to mess up. But the ability to build your vehicles and items with such minute detail is incredible and really no bugs to speak of here. The storyline--Typically I don't care much for the story of a game. This one had me reloading saves if I missed anything. I loved the story up to where they have it. Building your own colony--And you get to populate it as well, assign jobs. Essentially micromanage the thing if you wish. You get out of it what you put into it--This game answers the call of your desires. Strategy? Check. Action? Check. Survival? Check. Exploration? Absolutely. The detail--This goes hand in hand with the next bullet point. The creators of the game took great care to make everything in the world make sense. The NPCs are exploring the planet and explain why the planet is the way it is when you land there. Exploration--It is a joy to just fly around and see the sights and discover new things. The game has loads of content.Cons Bugs--There are game breaking bugs. I'm not sure if I finished the storyline up to where it was built or if my quests just bugged out. This game is in alpha. And I can assure you that the majority of the bugs I encountered that left a bad taste in my mouth dealt with the their questing system. There were points where I ran out of memory (I'm running full settings on a great PC). No big deal, reload an autosave. But the questing bugs caused me to lose hours. I request that there be some console mode like Skyrim to assist players in self-help remedial measures when it comes to questing bugs. Lack of Polish--I include this because every aspect of the game can use more polish. Polish is the stuff that makes a B+ into an A. And the developers should hold off on this aspect. The game does not need polish in this state. It is in Early Access.  END OF LIST (for now)I mean that. These are the only cons to me. It plays like a finished game short of the questing bugs. I can excuse this of course. It is in Alpha. And the lack of polish is not a con to me, but I leave it there for a discriminating gamer.Story mode is not where it ends. I wanted to put Adventure Mode in Pros, but because of it being more or less an afterthought, I felt that Adventure Mode could not be justified in the Pro category. Adventure Mode is basically playing a randomized map with all features except the main story. But it needs much more work. But I am encouraged that it is there in the first place and am eager to see the developers flesh out the features of the adventure mode. Therefore, I do not think it qualifies as a Con I would prefer not being given everything (scanner updates and all scripts in the beginning of the Adventure Mode). Instead, I would like this to be an option that I could elect.A previous reviewer gave a thumbs down in saying that the project was so immense that it would never be completed. Gamers have a vote in this. We vote with our wallets and our recommendations. I have done both, and encourage you to purchase this game and play some of it. It is expensive for early access, but the content it delivers is well beyond its price. And then please, when you discover this game's merits, support the devs. Endorse this game that so richly deserves recognition.

Early Access Review
								Until this game is completly finished, I would not buy it, even if it is on sale. This game has been in Alpha for a solid year and a half and probably will still be early access for another 2 or 3 years based on how slow the devs are working on this game. There are still bugs from day 1 that are in this game, and while it is fun to play for a short amount of time, you will get borded of this game in about a week. This game does have a lot of potential, and I feel if the devs truly buckeled down and finished this game there could be a lot to offer. However right now this is just a shell of a game. There are lots of bugs and this game will crash/freeze alot. I personally feel like this game was a cash grab and it shouldn't have been released until far later. The devs have made many promises with the game but have failed to deliever them after almost 2 years since they opened the game.

content:
Posted: February 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								To express it in the shortest way I can, Planet Explorers is what Sony's Landmark should be.A little more in depth? This game combines the better mechanics of Runescape and Minecraft while still feeling like its own original game. This feeling most definately lends itself to the fantastic (however loud) and serene soundtrack; the plethera of monsters whose strength can warrant a knife or an organized battalion; and especially the creation tool: an interface allowing you to build items (swords, equipment, vehicles, airships, etc) directly into the game using voxels. No wrap-around, and no microtransactions needed; anyone can quite literally build (or download) for themselves anything they can imagine while in game. This last mechanic - the ability to create items "like it ain't no thing" is what really sets Planet Explorers up to be phenominal. Currently, the game is in Alpha 0.87, but the only bug my friends & I have come across is sleeping in a bed - a bug we first believed to be related to our own incompetence. I highly recomend Planet Explorers. Its mechanics sets it apart from the growing masses in this Sci-Fi genre and its emersion will keep you and your friends eager to play more.

content:
Posted: May 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								Planet explorers is the best open world sand box game that I have everr played. The combat is excellent with many different types of weapons to use and a wide variety of animals and aliens to hunt and all of them give some type of resource upon killing them, usually meat or some item that can be sold to vendors for currency. The crafting system is excellent and has many armor pieces that can be crafted out of differnt level resources from wood to diamonds. The crafting system also allows you to design and build custom armor, weapons, and aircraft/vehicles/boats all with their own individual stats based on what material you used and how much of that material is in the design. You can also manage a colony and build many useful buildings in the colony such as replicator, training station, repair facilities and more. You can build a tram in the game world and then ride in that tram. There are many quests to do in the story mode. There is a good farming system once you have a colony set up. There is a lot of things to do in this game. I highly recommend it.

content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								I bought this game 6 months ago (pre-steam) thinking it would be an amazing upgrade from minecraft. Graphically it is, but when you get down to it. The controls are so bad. I don't know why a traditional WASD control system couldn't be used. It makes combat agains basic monsters so difficult expect to die after any encoutner The custom design feature is pretty cool with one exception, there in no comprehensible tutorial included in the game. You basically have to know how to use auto-cat programs already or find a youtuber that explains the process well enough. While Minecraft resource gathering is tideous, but in this game you literally have no way of knowing if you are gathering the right plant until seeing it for the 20th time and i hope you find it again. Wanna dig a giant hole in the ground? COOL! Just make sure you have a way out, because the caves in this game give you no hope for survival.If you are trying to build a fort to protect from a monster onslaught good luck because those guys can pretty much fly. If a herd wants you dead, your chance of escape is like 20% tops.Overall this game tries to take a game like Minecraft and add elements of modern gaming, however it lacks in the simplicity that minecraft was able to hand out on a silver platter, and it was done with no instructions.

We can see eachother, and the terrain is the same shape, but the plants, animals and resourses are not similar. The game generates a different world for each player in coop mode. This makes exploring together impossible since each person sees something different. Very bad design flaw.

content:

Early Access Review
								Don't waste your money.I bought this about a year ago, it showed a lot of promise. Then there were no updates for a longtime. Excuse is port to unity5. It feels like they've gone completely backwards and are still porting what they had.I'm not a fan in general of early access, and this one hasn't helped. I tried the demo, thought there was enough there to buy, and feel like the second I handed over my money development stopped.New things they are adding I'm not a fan of. The skill system already looks like something that is going to ruin this game (just like 7DaystoDie). I don't understand why every game wants to try to do everything and do it badly. It's not enough to have arbitrary tiers, lets slap arbitrary skill requirements on them, oh and make you research the stuff as well. That is the sure sign of "we've reached the point of we don't have anything left so let's turn it into a long boring grind so you don't realize what a lack of content there really is".So many games right now with so much promise,especially of the "Futuristic Minecraft-type clone with better graphics" (which in and of itself is not a bad thing)  it would be nice to see 1 actually get finished.

content:
Posted: March 23
												First of all this game is a good work IF only reviewed from the "sandbox" perspective. It delivers a really cool concept that you can make almost everything from scratch, including weapons armors and vehicles, which can easily cost you much time if are a big fan of modelling and stuff. If you assess this game from its "adventure" contents well it still needs some more time to polish. The pace of progressing is weird. Sometimes you suddenly inhale huge amount of information, and sometimes you feel it a bit grinding. Melee combat is really a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥♥ once you switch to a gun it feels a hell lot easier. Overall the art style is brilliant. You do need the time to get used to the core of this game. If you are looking for a combat-based adventure game, stay away. If you are a huge fan of sandbox, grab it.

content:
Posted: October 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								I have had the game for a pretty long time. I don't play often anymore since they hardly ever update the project. Overall its a fun game, probably one of the most important metrics for sure. However there are a plethora of bugs (game is in alpha after all so a certain number is expected), game performance has been terrible since release in the adventure mode for the game. Story mode while not complete gives you acceptable performance. Probably mainly due to the fact that its a static world and not randomly generated.May want to avoid the games forums (the official ones, not the steam ones) though they are kinda dead, and the few people who are there won't take any critique of their precious game. (thats fanboys for ya, right?)Overall the game showed ALOT of promise when I bought it over a year ago. However since then development has slowed to a crawl (though they did release an update today I see) and it is starting to be outpaced both graphically and innovation wise by newer EA titles like Empyrion: Galactic Survival, Ark: Survival Evolved (even though that one is more mmo) and several other EA survival titles. So in my opinion, skip it for now till they finish intigrating unity 5, and hopefully start putting the pieces back together from the switch over to the new engine. Play one of the other survival games for now. I strongly recommend Empyrion if you want to be able to get off world and have a good quality first person mode.
