number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
												I backed this game on kickstarter a few years ago because it had tons of potential. I can say for certain that it has improved a great deal since then. They have steadily added content, improved the interface and squashed a ton of bugs. The story/campaign mode is enjoyable and has a nice pace to it. You have loads of freedom in how you proceed and a huge landmass with unique looking biomes to build whatever you can come up with. Unfortunately there are some problems with core aspects of the game that have not really improved much. Things like having to move your cursor around and repeatedly reposition your character to harvest a plant. It doesn't always occur but when it does it's quite annoying and really distracts from the game. The animations and sounds are still what I would consider to be mediocre. The volume of certain things is off. Some noises are way too loud and others a bit too soft. Designing and building vehicles can be a bit unintuitive and they don't always seem to perform like they should. Overall the game still feels a bit 'janky' and unpolished. All of the little things add up to detract from what otherwise is a very good game.If you can overlook the rough edges and really enjoy sandbox games then give it a shot.

content:
Posted: August 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								I recommend this game because its fun to run around, dig, build, create.  One can experiment with architectural design.  That's enough for me to be satisfied but the game as a story has major problems:Be prepared to be frustrated with bugs in the story line.  I've played this game on and off for a while, seen it go through quite a few versions.  On an earlier version I was able to play through story mode pretty far, as far as the developers had written.  My saves were erased with an upgrade and given the amount of time I had spent crafting a delightful and luxurious base, I became discouraged.  I tried to restart, to plod through the storyline with its many fetch-type quests but with another upgrade those saves got erased too.  Recently I came back to the game and have been having fun with it again.  Strangely, though, I cannot get very far in the story quests.  They are extremely buggy.  The story quests appear to have actually become quite a bit MORE buggy since the last time I'd played it.  I can't get past the first quest (a critical character has irretrievably disappeared, and was just reading about the second quest having a high likelihood of a massive game ending type bug also.It is difficult to program games and I respect the hard work.  That being said, I recommend the developers focus on making the core gameplay stable instead of pursuing shiny, new, additional features with each update. I fear/suspect the game has been dropped as a serious development project and that core bugs will not be fixed.  It appears to be used as a template for experimentation instead.  That's cool but It would be nice to be able to actually play it.

content:

Early Access Review
								This is the game that Starforge should have been. If you're tempted to get Starforge, just get this game instead. Things actualy work in this game and there's actually stuff to do. The UI is rather well done, and the block building system includes features like the ability to save a building off as a template to use for further construction. There's also a voxel editor for creating your own item models. Even though the game isn't finished as of the time I'm writing this, it still comes across like a finished game. Also check out Space Engineers, though that one is a bit more technical and more about building vehicles and stuff than this game is.

content:
Posted: August 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								Quick summary at bottom of review.ReviewPlanet Explorers is a good game with even greater potential. Yes the game is Early Access and it wont be released/completed for a while yet, but it's certainly worth supporting the developers and watching the game evolve.In it's current state it is playable, though you'll encounter alot of bugs and such. One of the worst examples is the Adventure Mode randomly generated worlds. You choose 1 of 4 biomes to be your main biome to play in, the others you'll practically never see in game. Not only this but the original spawn point and camp is normally on it's own island surrounded by a large crevice on all sides (imagine Avatar's floating islands, except these are connected to the world vertically). Not too much of a problem, just build a make-shift bridge out of dirt or something. But it does cause alot of annoyance.Story Mode seem relatively good, though I have barely touched it as it is at this point a long tutorial which you can get the over all feel and mechanics of the game within an hour.As for custom content, this is where the game shines. You can create a nice variety of items and weapons in game at this time. Here's a quick list of 'functional' things you can create; Swords, Shields, Firearms, Boats, Wheeled Vehicles (any type on land transport), Helicopters and Planes. Now when I say functional I mean things that you can use. You can also create in-animate objects, wether it be a flag or a wall decoration, the option is there.As for the construction mechanic, it works well. Everything is built with blocks and easy to place with good camera controls, and your buildings don't look blocky at all they are smooth. Though the gathering of these resources is very tedious. Just scan for ores and mine them or just stand in one spot and hold LMB and keep mining. That's it. There is a scanner that can tell you the location of ores in the world within a short radius, but I rarely use it as the most needed ore can be found in stone alot of the time.Combat is again, tedious. Simpley hold LMB until it dies. That's it. Would be nice if there would be (in the future) a skill system making you more proficient in either melee or ranged, with usable skills so you have to be more active in combat. The problem you will have is in Adventure Mode, any level creature will spawn anywhere. You could spawn near an alien camp, which would mean aliens would always be close to you and until you have good enough loot you will keep dying. Thing's I'd Like To SeeMore 'functional' items to create. An example: custom bed or lights.Better combat with possibility of skills.Make mining less tedious (no idea how that'd be done though).Make world generation in Adventure mode contain all biomes.A variety of pre-built items for those who can't create things too well. Or at least blueprints for them (Just a simple car and plane etc)SummarySo a quick summary of positive (+) and negative (-) points of the game:+Custom content, create what you want.+Choice of 3 game modes (Story, Adventure and Build)+A good amount of crafting recipes, including armour and utilities such as a jet pack.+A very well thought out game which i#has so far been exectued really well.-Story mode (for me) drags on way to long as a long tutorial, didn't even finish it.-World generation in current build for Adventure Mode is messy. Also limited to one biome in adventure mode.-Tedious mining and combat.-Optimisation (expected to have problems as it is Alpha, not game breaking though)A solid 7/10.

content:

Early Access Review
								I honestly want to recommend this game, but I just can't.      Environments become a bit bland after a few minutes, and often fail to load.If you even think about using a jetpack or hang glider for any distance you're doomed, as every time I used them I ended up clipping through the ground and getting trapped below the world.Animations are awkward and combat is just boring.        Now I will admit that the crafting system is fun, being able to dig tunnels and build bases, but the building system is so complecated that by the time you've mastered it you will probably be out of creative energy and just want to play something else.        Basically, if they would clean up the animations, simplify the menu's and building system, and put some serious time into fixing their landscapes, this could be a really fun game, but it is seriously shackled by these shortcomings.

Planet explorer offers a great deal more!Relative to minecraft, the graphics are infinitely better than minecraft, based on terrain you can do just as much as minecraft, but more realistic and survival like, no punching dirt into youre inventory, you first need a shovel! Placing blocks is different than minecraft, but you don't need it equipped to your tool bar to do so, still able to create castles of stone and diamond, or dirt, whichever is your preference. But wait, that's not all! The ability to create and customize your own weapons and vehicles within the game, and the ability to use and create them in the game, single player, multiplayer, and just plain adventure!

content:
Posted: July 14, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is the game that Starforge should have been. If you're tempted to get Starforge, just get this game instead. Things actualy work in this game and there's actually stuff to do. The UI is rather well done, and the block building system includes features like the ability to save a building off as a template to use for further construction. There's also a voxel editor for creating your own item models. Even though the game isn't finished as of the time I'm writing this, it still comes across like a finished game. Also check out Space Engineers, though that one is a bit more technical and more about building vehicles and stuff than this game is.

												BEFORE YOU READ!... this is an indie game....most indie games are not going to be as good as games that have been tried and tested over and over [say how minecraft is now? or maybe terraria...etc etc] THAT BEING SAID...leave expectations a bit low...the game over all is fairly damn good...the story is okay the ability to craft♥♥♥♥♥♥is neat but it needs tweaking BAD like i'm talking almost a full rework on building structures at the very least...also it feels fairly...empty...not saying that the world isn't full of creatures and items its more like...you'll run 5 damn miles with 100% the same materials and than suddenly find something new... its really annoying and i wish it was a bit more randomized than that...BUT regardless of all this...if you are into building your own models of helicopters and tanks and such? this is an amazing game...it reminds me a lot of like if you take tribal spore stage and mixed it with a sandbox game.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								UPDATE:  Well after 1 year, I am eagerly awaiting full release of PE, and Grav, well, I stopped playing that last year.  Toxic community and not much depth.  PE is still amazing and even better now.I don't know about the other reviews, the game is being very actively developed, just check the log.  There is a new beta release about monthly.   It's also Early access, bugs are to be expected and then you give feedback.  I see so many early access reviews complaining about bugs.    Pretty awesome game and it's still in early access.  I also got Grav around the same time and both games are fun but each is different in big ways.  I had debated on which one to get for a while but in the end I got both thanks to my brother and his generosity. Both game are beautiful with  bright and varied environments.  This will not be a review of Grav, I'll just briefly touch on some of the main differences.Planet Explorers Story mode is the single player mode.  It has NPCs, missions and a story line.  I've only been playing Grav solo because the free weekend seems to have brought some griefers into the multiplayer servers and I wasn't about to deal with that, so I can't speak too much to the public multiplay, though I did set up a server for a friend and me to play.  Grav's single player is more just about exploration, but there are some tasks that you get some rewards for.The story in Planet Explorers is pretty in depth so far.  You'll meet a lot of NPCs, with a lot of missions and rewards.  The biggest difference is with the crafting systems.  Planet Explorers is insanely cool when it comes to this.  In Grav you're working with about 10 resources that you'll need to craft pre-designed items, such as a jetpack or monocycle.  You'll have different workbenches for creating different items.  Planet Explorers has a lot more resources for creating things.  And then you'll create a few things to create bigger things, and then there is a custom editor built into the game for designing weapons, cars, planes, etc...There is no pre-made car, you have to build the wheels, cockpit, engine, fuel cell and then build it and export it into your world.  For example when I had to build a car for a mission, I needed wood and rubber for the wheels, steel, iron and motherboard for the enginer, and to make that motherboard I needed plastic and copper wiring.  This may sound tedious, but it isn't because you can click on a component in the crafting window and it will then open that component so you can click on the ingredients and make them and traverse the heirarchy that way.  It's VERY easy to quickly make components and see which components will create which parts.  You then go into the ISO editor (the name for a custom creation is ISO), which is like a modeler if you're familiar with 3D Modeling.  You'll place the 4 wheels, cockpit, engine, fuelcell and then build your car however you want.  If you google Planet Explorer ISOs you'll find websites devoted to models that you can download and play with.  There are turrets and lots of guns, it's amazing what people have done with this.  Grav has been fun so far, it's a different game.. and Planet Explorers is amazing and fun too.TL;DR: Planet Explorers is amazing because you can create a lot of custom content very easily using many parts and resources.  The story mode is very indepth.

Early Access Review
								Brilliant game.  If you like open world sandbox with plenty to do to make real progress then this is for you.  The world is fantastic with a variety of environments to explore and monsters to kill.  You can carry an enormous amount of material so you do not have to spend your time running back to base to unload, the crafting system is easy and once you have set up your own colony you can design and build anything from motor bikes, planes, helicopters, vehicles, ships and weapons.The only downside is that the game does crash occasionally and a few of the missions require a bit of help from others but the community is active and helpful.This is a terrific game and although I have only played story mode I am thoroughly impressed and give it a score of 99%.  Well done Devs :)

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								Where to start. I'm playing the .87 alpha version and having a great time. There are plenty of bugs, some game breaking. These are planned to be fixed in the .9 update.  I've built all sorts of colonies: Hobbit colonies in the side of hills. A plateau colony; very defensible AND it makes a great spot for hang gliding. A cave colony which, sadly, crashed the game on me. Constructing vehicles is great fun.  I’ve designed one that was little more than a rocket and a cockpit which proceeded to disintegrate with me on it after a few meters. I’ve built a mountain crawling troop transport with 16 wheels.  Motorcycles and helicopters. I’ve been limited by my imagination and part number limits (i.e. 16 wheel limit).Mining can be fun or boring depending on your purpose. I spread my mining out between building and questing.  Mine for 4 hours straight and you’ll hate it.  Especially if your game crashes or gets hung up. Hint: don’t mine near water until the next patch your saves will get corrupted.Speaking of saves.  You have plenty of slots to use for saving your world.  This is really convienent since you hae three play modes to choose from.  Story is where it’s at for me.  I like having a story line in my games and objectives. Adventure mode is more of a sandbox only play. Build mode is great for building, testing, and saving your designs since there is unlimited resources. There is also a multiplayer component. Sorry to say I haven’t much tried that part of the game.  Updates are a little slow. I want the full game now, but they can’t make that happen. So if you want it all complete and ready to play then wait to buy. Otherwise you’ll sink countless hours into this game and say to yourself and to any who’ll listen “when is the next *censored* update *censored* it!”  Another great thing is that the devs are active with the forum community so be heard!All said this is a very enjoyable game and I’ve spent more hours on it in alpha than I have with most of my release games.Maybe a little bit of a SPOILER if you keep reading but not a major one.The story line is pretty good so far, but still under development. I find it interesting, different, and quite funny that you begin the game with meat as the currency until your colony is built. Finally monsters/animals stop dropping gold.  I mean what animal carries a coin purse!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								First off, I reccomend this game to anyone who even slightly enjoyed Minecraft or Terraria, espescially if you enjoyed the building aspect of the games. So what makes this game different?You create your own weapons, shields, vehicles, and decorations. I dont mean MMO-style crafting either, you literally build them from the ground up, voxel by voxel.A few quick warnings; This game does have bugs and glitches (ie, can't currently explore the northern half or so of the map without it crashing). As a side note, monsters and terrain have a bad habit of destroying your favorite vehicles. To solve both problems, save often.Lastly, I wanted to provide a few tips that I wish someone had shared with me.-There is a meteorite crater just north of where you start in story mode, It is full of Iron and Copper and is great for making money.-Almost straight west of the meteorite crater is a "Rock Formation" the vendors there sell you the scripts (crafting recipes) for a better pickaxe as well as the parts to make a land vehicle. -To the west of where you spawn (Past where the river forks along the coast) There is a vendor, he sells the items you need to make aircrafts.-Don't try hunting (for currency anyways) with bullets. With a few exceptions, you lose around the same amount you gain. Instead, try building up a vehicle with lots of firepower. As long as you have coal from mining, there really isn't any cost to refill the batteries on said vehicle.-(IMO) Build your vehicles out of Marble. It is easily the most abundant of the resources, making upgrades/repairs cheap. Also, my Marble helicopter currently has 55,000 durability after two upgrades. I will die before it does every time.tl;dr? Yes this game is amazing, no it isn't perfect. There are a few bugs that really need to get fixed, but the game is in alpha. Save often and I would easily give this game a 9/10.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
Early Access Review
								My opinion on the game is at the top, and my personal story with the game is at the bottom.I think all of the great things about this game are apparent in the trailer, so I will touch on the cons:-Controls/Camera:The movement is a little jumpy and floaty (if you jump and hold forward you will 'stick' to the wall). The camera is rough and will often go through walls when you are in tight/interior areas. Your chacter will clip through walls and other geometry, commonly resulting in being deposited on the other side. Especially when using the awesome rope gun to grapple around (like Dying Light).-Combat:Combat doesn't have a sense of connection to the attacks and reactions of things being hit. There is no real reason to go melee over ranged unless you want to spend more repairing all your armor.Despite these things I mentioned, the rest of the system is so fun they didn't really matter to me. When this game is more stable I know I will put a lot of time into this game and enjoy it completely. *** I will repeat, even if all the issues above aren't improved/resolved when the game exits alpha/beta, I would still play and recommend this game (it's that good). ***I recommend the game, just be aware some parts are rough around the edges and you could lose your hard work at any time. (read below for more info on that)--- My personal disaster ---My friends and I had a lot of fun running around, making things, mining, gliding, fighting, etc. After putting about 30 hours into making a colony, and various other things, the game crashed after logging into our server in the area near our colony. It loads fully and crashes after about 3 seconds in game.My friend logged in to the server fine in another area and was able to come to the colony without issues. When he logged out in this area and then logged back in, same crash. So, something is corrupt in this area of the map. No we both cannot log in. 30 hours seemingly lost, though it was fun getting there. As this game is in alpha we knew the risk. That being said, we aren't playing until it gets a full release or some massive updates.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								Awesome game with loads of potential. If you're thinking about picking this up, this is definitely one of the better early access survival/crafting games out there with decent graphics and art direction as wheel as physics and vehicles. In it's current state I'd say it's worth the money as it offers hours of fun gameplay and exploration in the Story Mode. Multiplayer and world generation need more work though, it's playable and has potential but the generated worlds are currently no where near as good as the Story map (Maybe the Devs could add an option to use it in multiplayer at some stage?). It would be nice also, if it had some pre-made iso's to start you off for vehicles and I'm pretty sure it's going to be added later, but still, searching through pages of downloads on external websites to find some basic vehicle designs can be a bit time consuming, but worth it once you find them.PS: Always test the stuff you download first in build mode before spending your resources in game so you know if there needs to be any personal adjustments made (such as 4-wheeled steering for a much better turning circle).I've been following this game for more than a year and I helped fund it. I can't wait to see where it goes and it's pretty awesome seeing how far it's come since the playable version they had up for download in Kickstarter. Well done Pathea, keep the updates coming and ideas flowing.

Early Access Review
								I've bought and played many a sandbox game, this one is by far my favorite.  Crafting, check, world modding, check, the ability to craft as many varied vehicles, weapons, tools etc, check!  The amount of hours ive played isnt showing up because i was unplugged for a month, i must have clocked in over 200hrs to date on this, and its still in alpha phase!!!  I've never regretted buying alpha, but with Planet Explorers, it already feels like a complete game, and just keeps getting better!  Kudos to the creators of PE! es, its an ambitious project, but so far its all been well implemented.  I highly recommend this game to fans of Minecraft/sandbox type games, and just buy the game already, build a VTOL, motorcycle etc, and tinker away!!

								While still in Alpha, the building tools are VERY fun!  Holy crap :)  The story, as of 3/14/2015, is not bad; fun dynamic from a few sci-fi predictions with a Earth and Mars colonial falling out (Babylon 5 comes to mind).  Custom weapons is awesome... but custom vehicles and airships?  Damn!  Custom buildings... custom cities lol! number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game has already been worth the purchase price for me.  I have logged many hours (though like all my steam games most is probably while afk at start screen) and plan on many more.   I love the freedom that sandbox offers and all the creative things that can be done in the build mode.  Creating and then driving various vehicles was also a major bonus.  There are some other features right now and more to come that are very enjoyable like the colony.  I always get lonely at some point in games where there is only 1 character (LOVE 7dtd but still waiting for friendlies in sp mode) but this game doesn't have that problem.  You can setup, recruit then go do whatever and stop by when wanting some company, or bring a couple along.  Or go it alone and leave the others to their fate as you attempt to survive the wilds using what you can find, or mooch off them.   The options are available which is great so you don't feel pigeonholed.  This is your new world essentially so do what you can/will.  There are some downsides as it is in ALPHA like mentioned in the store.  The game is a memory hog and needs to be optimized, there are some glitches with loading npc's and sometimes turrets but that will come with time.  All in all I would recommend for anyone that enjoys sandbox, building and space games.  This is from memory so not extremely detailed but something I found useful is to build with endless materials in creative mode without combat interruptions.  Then copy your building using the build toolbar, outline the area and click the toolbar save button.  Retrieve the building the building list and similar to how the ISO and craft system lists components needed and if you have them, you can 1 click the building from then on.  This is especially useful for setting up multi level turret platforms while hunting, or intricate buildings.   Even more so if you play different modes as it saves lots of time.

content:

Early Access Review
								In the story mode of this game you must find and bring a whole ship load of colonists together after crash-landing on an Bezier alien world filled with big stompy creatures and hostile natives. In your quest to establish a colony on this harsh, unforgiving and yet somehow still impossibly beautiful world you can build your own swords, guns, lazers, tanks, bikes helicopters boats and more to aid you in your quest. That should be enough to convince anyone to buy this game. The game is still in early access but I think the devs are going to pull it off and into a successful release as there are regular and good updates which bring new content and fix bugs.

Early Access Review
								Brilliant game.  If you like open world sandbox with plenty to do to make real progress then this is for you.  The world is fantastic with a variety of environments to explore and monsters to kill.  You can carry an enormous amount of material so you do not have to spend your time running back to base to unload, the crafting system is easy and once you have set up your own colony you can design and build anything from motor bikes, planes, helicopters, vehicles, ships and weapons.The only downside is that the game does crash occasionally and a few of the missions require a bit of help from others but the community is active and helpful.This is a terrific game and although I have only played story mode I am thoroughly impressed and give it a score of 99%.  Well done Devs :)

content:
Posted: March 23, 2015
Early Access Review
								There's some bugs and the developers are terrible with sticking with deadlines BUT they do communicate with the fanbase and they generally send out builds that are playable-and every major release is a massive improvement. Pathea is building something really special here.The game is fun for the most part (I hate resource gathering but that's kind of a necessity in this kind of game) but it's already a great world to explore with a surprisingly realistic ecosystem. The combat system is okay and I can't wait to see how a0.9 changes. I have yet to try multiplayer only the single-player story mode and while the quests are a bit tedious, it does teach you the game quite nicely and slowly introduces you to what you can build...and trust me, you can build just about anything in this game. And if you can't yet, you probably will in the future.Overall, this game might be in Early Access but it's shaping up to quite a promising release.

content:
Posted: March 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								Planet Explorers - If you build it you can play with it.I love this game, with over 150 hours in it and so much to do.  I will say Planet Explorers is a missleading name.  At a glance it would seem you just hop from planet to planet and explore them, but there is only one planet.  Of course you can have a different planet each play through but you can't jump from one planet to the next.  What I mean by this is in adventure mode you can generate the type of planet you will explore, A mix of desert, trees, water, grassland etc...You can make your own weapons - riffles, pistols (lasser or bullets).  When I say make you can use a preset weapon to craft, or you can build your own and play with it in the game.  Never played a game with such a nifty option.  It's really awesome to spend an hour designing your weapon, then build it in your adventure/story game.  You can make your own transportation - (note only on the planet can not leave the atmosphere and go into outerspace).  Make a 16 wheeler, make a mortorcycle, a 3 wheeler a 4 wheeler,  a tank, a pickup truck, a helicopter, a fighter jet, a flying carpet (lol someone actually did this).  Tons of things to create to drive and fly around in.  Once again its what ever you decide to create.  My advice to the developers of this game.  Change your main screen shot advertising this game to reflect more of what this game is about.  A guy and gal in a dust storm in cartoonish fashion doesn't set this up for how great this game is.Maybe a screen shot with helicopters, Guns, mortorcycles, Jets.  "If you build it they will come".  Great job on what is in the game so far, and can't wait for the AI update.  I just wish you would advertise or hype this game better for what it really is.  It's misleading in a bad way as it doesn't represent the true cool and fun factor.

content:
Posted: February 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								The good:-Satisfying exploraton (especially in story mode)-Incredibly deep creation system (relatively simple too)-The world feels alive and there's plenty to do-Looks good and runs fairly well on my turdtop-Awesome devsThe bad: -Digging is downright clunkly-Adventure and multiplayer are buggy to the point of unplayability (Early Access though so this'll probably change)-Combat is a little simplistic (A0.9  is supposed to revamp it though, so there's that)-Learning curve is a bit steep with a barebones turorialThe probelms I have with this game are generally things that the devs have already said will change. I personally adore this game and I can't recommend it enough. As it stands the story is unfinished but loads of fun to play anyway and the feeling of venturing into the unknown and discovery is something that I so rarely get in games. Back that up with the complex item and building creation and this game already stands on its own two legs.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
Early Access Review
								There are many things right or wrong with this simple open world survival game. Some good things.Exploration and otherwise the construction of making the nice home for ether yourself or a village. Crafting is fine, items are not that hard to come by because there is a shop in a town that restocks them over night. The diversity and blending of multiple climate landscape make you feel if you have walked more than just kilometers.  Some bad things. The part about items are easy to find is forshadowed for a fact natrual metal resources are hard to find to make those items. Many item recipes require a rare metal recource to craft, otherwise the crafted item in question can just be sold in the NPC town shop.Combat is questionable. Sword and shield is not really a combat option, in fact it is not a perfered option. The gun is where it's at. Enemy difficulty is rediculous, depending on creature. Some are aggrive, some are passive, some are huge. The worst part are that the alien inhabitants kill on sight,  and they are usially the hardest besides the fact thier little colonies are amost impossible to defeat alone. Kiting seems to be the only option to win.Building and Governing towns. Feature that is locked unless you compete a few quests in ether adventure or story mode. But NPC are known to be killable in not revived in time, even though there is no real way to get more NPC fallowers. Creation and Crafting.So complex and uniformitive that sometimes I wonder how someone is able to make a car, a car that turns out is not that good and not repairable. All creations are made as a blueprint and then they are placed in the world only if you have the required resources to place item in world. You make your creation in the creation editor and then save creation as a blueprint for item placement in game. The creation editor is not user friendly at all. It requires more than a slideshow tier manual.Open world Placement of object finds yourself unable to rotate such object for placement, or the fact the game does not tell your how though the keybinding in the options menu.The UglyMultiplayer is dead when the populated servers up to 16 people has only four people in it. This is an open world cooperative game if most if the overall metagame features like town creation and alien coloney raiding requires a group to complete. That is if latency of over 250-300 ping is good for you. Updates are not automated in Steam. Servers also have to update manualy.There are much better indie games with much logical purchase prices. I got it half off on sale of what is considered $30.

content:
Posted: March 9, 2015
Early Access Review
								I've tested a few of these "Minecraft 2.0 wannabes" (as I call the genre) and by far Planet Explorers is the best, in my opinion.While it is true that the game has gone quite long without updates before (yes, a whole year) the devs have explained what happened (tl;dr version: they had to recover from outsource-induced damage), but they are now on top of things once more and updates are coming in regularly again.It is also still true that some glitches might need you to restart your game (usually in story mode) but that's mostly because the patches that fix those issues can't fix them retro-actively. Having a savegame from before you encountered the problem is usually sufficient to prevent this from happening.Multiplayer also leaves much to be desired but the devs are working on that.Remember: this game is still in pre-release, you're bound to run into some bugs.

content:
Posted: March 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								Great game to burn some time...But feels a little too rough for certain aspects, for example; the graphics options for rendering distances, seem to have little/no effect (floating grass on non-loaded terrain) makes for an offputting and ugly view. Found that quests bug out more often than I'd like.It feels like the development is a little 'all over the place', I hope they finish the jigsaw puzzle.But regardless, it is more than playable compared to other 'early access' games which are often in complete shambles.Unfortunately... It's a long term early access game that 'still' riddled with bugs that have been present since release and still has poor UI control scheme's.

								I've tested a few of these "Minecraft 2.0 wannabes" (as I call the genre) and by far Planet Explorers is the best, in my opinion.While it is true that the game has gone quite long without updates before (yes, a whole year) the devs have explained what happened (tl;dr version: they had to recover from outsource-induced damage), but they are now on top of things once more and updates are coming in regularly again.It is also still true that some glitches might need you to restart your game (usually in story mode) but that's mostly because the patches that fix those issues can't fix them retro-actively. Having a savegame from before you encountered the problem is usually sufficient to prevent this from happening.Multiplayer also leaves much to be desired but the devs are working on that.Remember: this game is still in pre-release, you're bound to run into some bugs.

content:
Posted: October 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								Surprisingly advanced for an Early Release. The story line is believable, voice acted, and complex. The world (I've only seen the first 2 areas of 7 I'm guessting), is massive, varied, and not without dangers. No, you won't get chewed up by any hostile mob, but when starting out you'll have to run. and mine, and do the quests. Later you'll be able to get on your self-built motorbike, and *try* to outrun a dangerous enemy you found deep in the forst. Will you be able to dodge the trees? Will he? After many many disappointments in its genre, I'm fully willing to say that this is a massive success in the in the Voxel / Survival / Crafting / Single player game, even well beyond anything else out there. My only negative is the ingame music, which sounds like children's lullabies to my ears... But it's easy enough to mute it through the settings (which are completely implemented), and run VLC in the background. Average performance usage of system while running Planet Explorers AND a 720P movie in VLC:CPU 38%RAM usage around 5 GB of 16GB. Nvidia GTX 760, no cooling (not even a fan). Resolution 1920x1080 on main screen running Planet ExplorersResolution 1280x720 on second monitor, playing the Terra Nova Series on 720p. --------------I recommend this game for children, especially those of all ages. This is absolutely playable for children in multiplayer with their parents, and it would be a great experience for them.You can build, and you can dig to find oreyou can do quests to find out more.Sneak around to see beautiful creaturesand learn what could become of own features. ----FANTASTIC GAME!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 8, 2014
Early Access Review
								TLDR; Recommended, glad I purchased it.It's really addictive. Check the other reviews and, even on the bad ones, notice how many HOURS people log playing this game! I'm ONLY at 13 hours.It reminds me a bit of Uninhabited Planet Survive[en.wikipedia.org] which was a fun show. If you liked the show you'll probably like the game, although I'm certain they have totally unrelated origins.I like exploring, building, and sometimes even following the story.The difficulty isn't very linear, which isn't a bad thing. In the real world you can walk into a forest and attack a rabbit or a bear side by side, but.. which one is more difficult? That's what happens here, too. And smaller isn't always less of a challenge either, likewise some big guys are pushovers. Could make it harder, actually.I haven't had much luck with Online play, though. It works sort-of, but my latency was measured in minutes so it wasn't really playable. Could be just me, but hey, it's a product in development.Solo play is rock solid, the graphics are awesome. There's tons to build and do already. While the game is solid and hasn't crashed on me, as other reviewers point out, it has some bugs. You may never experience them, but they're in there.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								This has got to be the best early access title I've ever seen... granted I haven't played a lot of them but I've certainly had my eye on quite a few ;). I'm VERY anxious to see what comes next. As for what we have now:PROYou can build anything in the *integrated* 3D modelling software and export it directly into your game. ANYTHING. Want a sword shaped like a hockey stick? Go for it. A motorcycle that looks like a giant taco? No problem. How about 50+ foot tall mech that seats three, flies, manuevers in three dimensions, and carries enough firepower to single-handedly liberate a small nation? Check out my screenshots... ;)Hundreds of building and crafting materials to use and mix together with a robust system that is phenomenally easy to use. Example: I burned through my gold pick and I'm a mile away from a repair machine and half as far underground. I open up my crafting window and select gold pick and the mats window tells me I need steel so I click on that right in the window.  Seems I have an abundance of mats for that so I make my steel and then I see up top that steel can be used for, among many things, gold picks. Click gold pick, click build, DONE. Easy.Story Mode. I've been mostly playing in Adventure Mode so I can't honestly speak to Story Mode a whole lot but I'll say  this about it: It doesn't suck! There are so many other games that wind up with devs scrapping most of the details on their story just to rush content... Not these guys and to me that shows integrity, something otherwise lacking in a lot of other titles.I have no cons, as it's still in developpment, so only positive criticism. I have a few suggestions, I know that a lot of devs read these reviews, and I despise digging through forums and creating more accounts everywhere just to post in a single thread somewhere so...Suggestions1st person. I know after reading around that you had it working at one point. This really needs a fix, mining in tight spaces with any kind of precision is impossible when your backside occupies the entire screen.Armor Dyes. I can paint anything I build any colour I want regardless of shape or size but not my armor? I like the models just fine and, quite frankly, custom armor is probably the one thing I have no interest in modding but there really should be an option to dye it. Maybe have a colour picker or something pop up in the crafting window when you click to build and if you choose to change the colour it tallies up the required pigments for you before finalizing?Weapon placement. I made a seriously bad♥♥♥♥♥gauntlet/katar with claws half as long as a man but to my horror the whole thing sticks straight up into the air behind my dude's head. Maybe if the creator had a new tab with a basic human shaped model we could specify wear a weapon should be worn (back, hip, etc.) and in what orientation, sort of like the same way we already can do with parts while building.Weapon pairing! I equip a sword and shield, no problem. I switch to my laser rifle, still no problem. Both are hotkeyed for ease but the moment I switch back to my sword I now have to go digging through my inventory to find my shield 'cause it missed the memo that it was business time. How about a pop-up menu for single handed gear that would allow the user to pair or un-pair the item with other one handed gear? Dual wield pistols, sword and axe, sword and board, etc, all with a single click once paired.More precise painting. The way paint bleeds from one surface inot another is actually pretty frustrating.Craftable solar power. Have I just not found it yet? I play in Adventure Mode mostly and I have yet to see it, yet there's a solar charger sitting outside a tent at the beginning of Story Mode. I wanna build one of those specifically!PAUSE in menu during single player. I don't think this one needs explanation but I'll throw this in here: It sucks if you have to leave your desk for a bit, or use the creator to tweak some stuff, and come back to find your toon starving.Like I said, no cons just suggestions. I could come up with more if I really put the time and thought into it but as it stands I have a craving for tacos now that must be appeased. This game is already well on it's way to being ace and I love it so far, keep up the great work, and for the potential buyer if you're into building games and the like then YES this is worth it :)

content:
Posted: June 29, 2015
Early Access Review
								Yeah I'll recommend the game, but it has many flaws that need to be worked out (like the fish, you can look at my screenshots and find one of a massive fish that is just out of the water stareing into my soul with eyes like headlights). It is loaded with cool and interesting things and even has some of my favorite things for a game to have. Like the giant monsters and the creation system, but the whole thing has such a steap learning curve it took me the best of 1 hour to make a crappy looking gun. The UI is weird and wonky at alot of points, but it works. The wildlife is extensive and is filled to the brim with wonderous creatures, but if they weren't as insanly hard to kill in story mode it would be better. EX: At one point for one of the objectives I had to investagate ruins of a past race, but massive bird creatures had taken a liking to the place and the would agro if I approched. So i took up archery and tried long range combat the started chasing me and they did massive damage so I died at least 20 times before I was able to cheese them to death. Also their are game breaking glitches like one I experianced I had to follow a character to a little pond area and their were enemys their and for some reason after I killed them he walked to his spot or close to it at least and he stopped moving. The quest never updated and he never did anything either. THIS HAPPENED EVERY TIME I TRYED TO REVERT TO A SAVE. So I had to restart but I mean the game is still in development I can't bash it to hard. The build mode is great but no ceatures spawn but you so its kind of boring. As far as I know you can't put a build world into an adventure mode so it spawns things but it would be awsome if you could this would be a great sandbox game. Kind of like minecraft but more my style of minecraft no creepers just giant murderous desert titans or robots or what ever they are I don't care the are cool as hell.I saw this game on green light years ago and downloaded the free version and oh my god so many glitches ranging from spawning in the sky and falling to your death to walking strait and then *Poof*AAAAAAHHHHHHHHH! right on down to the bottom of the universe it's self. So be thankfull that doesn't happen as much any more. So all its an ok game one to try out for a wile test out everything and see if you like it. Get the game on sale I bought it for full price, I dont really care but its not really worth $20 yet so wait for the full game and then make a full desision. Also please take liberties on the grammer I'm super tired.

content:
Posted: June 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								+++Developers seem genuinely interested in this game, despite some misfortune+++One of the sandbox with most freedom out there. Instead of downloading mods to get that decorative item you want, it's pretty straightforward to build it yourself with the in game creator. The complexity of the things you can build is pretty big.+++Brings something new to the table of the sandbox genre+++There is a story and a purpose!++The game is thought out and presents a meaningful and fair challenge.++Supports and encourages the modding community+Effort was put into graphics and animations and they look very good.-There are a few bugs-- game development is pretty slow (at least lately)---Some quests are boring and meaningless. The usual MMORPG quests, fedex quests, kill x enemies quests, escort quests.-A part of the community simply cannot hear any form of criticism. Make a suggestion at your own peril.-Needs a more explanatory tutorial. Took me a while to grasp the full potential of the crafting UI.-Combat needs more fluidity Worth the 23 Euros it's at. There's enough content to justify an non sale buy.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								      This is a game I have been waiting for. If you have ever played Starwars Galaxies this game has almost the same feeling along with many other elements. You are free to explore an open world filled with interesting creatures and terrain. You are also free to create what you want. Along with a block based building system similar to Minecraft the world uses voxel terrain where you can mold the land around you into any shape. You can even create caves with smooth walls rather than the blocky nature we find now in many other sandbox survival games.       Besides the normal building system, you can create your own weapons, items, and vehicles. The crafting system is not a simple customization screen, you actally have to build your items from scratch. Although the creation system is tricky at first once you get the hang of it, it is quite simple. There is also a rich story line which I only scratched the surface of since I tend to lean towards the multiplayer side of the game. The only downside is the game is still incomplete, but that is to be expected since the game is still in development.   I Highly recommend this game if you want the freedom to do what you want then this is the game for you. I give this game a 10/10 due to its great potential and player freedom.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								Okay!!! I've just played my first 24 hrs of P.E. All I can say is this... MINECRAFT ON CRACK, ROIDS and that special juice Bane used in Batman!!!! The learning curve is a bit steap at first..but then the flow opens up. There are some glitches but thats to be exspected. I would have to write a novella to explain everything this game allows you to do...so I'll leave it to youtube to show you...and I watched a lot of youtube prior to this purchase. If you play space engineers, think of this as the part duex of that movie. Your ship crashes (along with hundreds of others) on a strange planet where you must mine and process ore and harvest natural resources (trees, plants, salt water) to survive. And dont forget about all that alien life..some of which is hostile. The best part is P.E's version of modding! YOU CAN MAKE ANYTHING! There is a sweet evolutionary editor that allows you to make any customized item and import it directly into your game *holds breath*......as your playing..YES...I said in YOUR GAME. Crazy huh! PSSST...I dont wanna speak to soon....but I think we have a winner here.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								One word: Overwhelming. This game is beyond having content. It is everything I would personally want from a survival game (Aside from First-Person, but the Third-Person is done in a great Fashion, like Monster Hunter, if you're familiar). The map is sizable for Early Access, terra-forming is wonderful, Creation is beyond anything I've ever seen in a Voxel Game. All of the building is done in the obvious block-by-block format, but you can take the materials you collect, enter a separate part of the game (Either in the opening menu or mid-game) and build anything you feel like, from guns, swords, and shields, to massive Airships to obliterate whatever threat you come across. If you're willing to deal with the rusty controls, get this game. It is a dream, and always fun. Once you learn the basics, you're set.

content:
Posted: March 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is like Farmville (I mean that in the best possible way), but with great graphics, very pretty world. A bit more dangerous than Farmville, you will probably die, but it's all good, that's what revival shots are for. If you are more familiar with Minecraft, I'm not, it's probably a bit like that. A "Voxel" system.You crash land on a planet and start to learn how to live on that planet. The way the textures are done is great, when you are digging a cave, the textures flow well. The minerals you have to collect are easy to spot when you know what you are looking at, the the handheld device helps you find them. I'm enjoying this game.Pros: Well, pretty much everything for a person like me. You have to find things to work with and then make things from that. With the use of the creation system, the trading of isos will flow well, which will release some creative designs, no doubt. Being that this is still an Alpha, I am very impressed. The potential in this game is interesting. Plants. Guns. Cars. Flying cars. Building. Well designed creatures. Nice graphics. A lot of good things to say.Cons: Alpha? A few minor things functionally I'd like to see, but that's how it is with anything, right? Seems well thought out ideas are still possible through suggestions to the developers. Though I can see how too many ideas, all at once, could be an issue for the developers. That's it.I'm liking this game, it's going to end up costing me too many real world hours. Some costs are worth it. Good game for creating cool things, only you will see, but that's half the fun. I think it's worth supporting. After getting the demo Alpha from the creators site, I was sold. Enjoy.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								I have spent alot of time into this game. Offline gameplay over 100 hours. THe reason I am spending so much time offline is because I am a semi truck driver and this game helps pass the time, very quickly. I  spent 10 hours one day building a gigantic base on top of a mountain with several tunnels going to different points where I mined  the area out. Yes mining can get boring, but with how much you can get back for mining it can be quite rewarding. And if you dont like doing anything repeatedly, but want to build,  there is a mode where all you have to do is build, dont have to worry about aliens. So dont have to mine  at all if you dont want to. But mining can be done is such a way,  that you can have tunnels going through the entire map. My current project Im working on in game is to have connecting roads underground, on ground, and above ground. I'm currently in adventure mode so I have to constantly kill aliens, but get rewarded with a in game road system that allows me to drive anywhere where I want to in game, quickly and safely. (Except for certain gigantic aliens with lasers that kill me so quickly I dont even get the chance to defend myself). And after mining you have 70 plus aliens you can go off and kill. By the time they finish there will be so many aliens to kill that the only way to get more different creature types in a video game is go get a nintendo handheld and play pokemon games.  I must say I was surprised by this game and it has reestablish confidence in a industry that is being bombarded by games that are constantly the same. Even with the game in its current state is a fun game to play. This game has me conflicted between two games, state of decay and this game. I usually play this game but I so want to play that other game myself. I run out of time to play both. I recommend this game to a variety of different play groups.

								Ignore my steam time, been playing this since kickstarter and loved it. 								I never post reviews unless I find something special. This is the game I've been looking for over the last couple of years.  Best described: It's like Tereria / Darkout but only in 3 dimentions, with vehicles and weapons that you design and build yourself.  I love the mining mechanic and the user friendly crafting system. number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2, 2015
Early Access Review
								I've now played more than 40 hours  in story mode, and I like it. A lot. I've just about came to the end of the missions, all that's left is some more monorail track building. That said, it has some problems, so this is mostly a list of things that need to be improved. MiningThis suffers from total confusion, because there is one rule: 3rd person perspective doesn't work with interiors. period. So what really needs to be done here is to implement a first-person view, this would fix that. Pathfinding AIThe NPCs are often jittering around, get stuck on trees or other obstacles, making mission where you have to lead somebody somewhere a chore. Scripted MissionsSometimes you've done something which you shouldn't have, like killed some monster before you get the mission, And then one of the "kill 0/3" monsters is missing. Or you killed the queen of the hive which you were only supposed to distract. What works in these cases is to save and reload, but then all three will reappear, and you need to kill all of them again. UIOn big screens, it's barely readable. There's need for a variable font-size.ColoniesThere are NPCs which can do mining or gathering, but it only works when they're your followers. It should really be possible to assign them this Job in the colonies. Also, it would be nice if it were possible to move around machines/beds in colonies, or remove and replace them without all the colonists loosing their status as colonists.VehiclesI've got difficulties steering them, probably due to some mouse/keyboard confusion on my part. A first-person view might fix this as well. Weight and ISOThere seems to be the problem that everything you create gets incredibly heavy; since everything is supposed to be "full metal" instead of being profiles and tubes. So you easily end up with 20 ton Jeeps. Not sure whether this can be fixed. On the other hand, I've never seen anything like it. I can create everything, from swords and guns to cars, boats and aeroplanes. Wow!CrashesIt does this often, mostly after fast-travel or loading a game (which both seem to use the same logic). But that's a known problem, related to memory consumption and apparently bugs in the Unity-Engine. So you can definitely expect improvements in the future. To sum up: This is around 40 hours of gameplay already, in story mode, and while some things feel weird or are unbalanced, it's definitely playable. Recommended.

content:
Posted: November 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								(Updated March 2016) No, Planet Explorers is NOT dead. It is still being updated with large substancial patches and currently aims to be released in 2016. Yes, it took a long time since PE reached Greenlight in 2013, but game development simply does take a lot of work and time, especially when we're talking about such a large and refined (optionally) quest-driven sandbox-game with so many - nearly endless - possibilities (change the beautiful world with it's different biomes to your liking, craft all kinds of stuff from tiny decorations over equipment and vehicles to large buildings with the creation-system, keep up your comfort-level to stay healthy, hunt the naturally behaving awesome-looking animals, defeat giant boss-mobs for quests, defend NPCs and your own fully powered-up SF-colony with turrets, discover weird alien structures, scan and dig for ore, play the mainquest or try free survival on procedurally generated worlds...Too many players being impatient and completely ignorant of all warnings about what Early Access means have created a bad reputation for the whole Early Access system. Sadly Planet Explorers is one of these games that have been slandered because of EA and some players even said that Panthea had "abandoned" this game, while in reality they have regularly kept on updating it. In my personal opinion, Planet Explorers - even in its current state - is already the best of all games I've ever played. * it features large, beautiful, variated and imaginative non-blocky 3D-game-worlds with different biomes and interesting flora. There's one predefined gameworld for the "campaign"-mode, plus procedurally generated worlds that players can create with different settings to choose from* even better - these worlds are populated by fantastic creatures (six-leggers like in Martian Dreams!) endemic to each biome, behaving "naturally" - meaning herds sticking together while roaming the regions, carnivores hunting herbivores in packs, animals sleeping at night, flocks of birds flying off when getting close, etc. - plus giant boss-mobs too (you juast have to love the whale-like Ostrov Sharks)* on the "campaign"-world you can discover awesomely weird looking alien ruins, dams, highways, great walls and camps with hand-made alien buildings* in the campaign you can interact with a decent number of unique NPCs, each with their own personality and background-story - and of course quests, ranging from subquests (fetch me x herbs) to really large main quests (defend a camp with turrets, defeat giant robots/mobs, learn to grow plants, establish a whole colony with different powered structures)* by now you can play PE both (or alternating) in first person and third person mode btw.* you can build extremely large structures like bridges, walls and buildings etremely quickly directly into the game-world with the smootest gameplay mechanics ever. You can save your structures and then copy more of them into the world too - however logically you will need to collect all the necessary materials beforehand* additional to that PE features an awesome creation-system that allows you to create, save, copy and share tons of stuff - all of the equipmant and vehicles you can build will even have certain stats and such will have a gameplay-impact within the game, depending on the materials it's been made of and it's shape. You can design every kind of object from tiny to large, from simple tableware and decoration items to furniture and streetlamps to large buildings.* with the usual ingame-crafting-menu (replicator) you can craft a wide range of pre-set equipment and other stuff too without having to design it specifically. Most of these have a really nice and unique SF-look* after prospecting/scanning for ores you can dig an infinite number of mineshafts and tunnels into the world. Well, you can even shovel away whole mountains if you're in the mood to do so* building defensive walls and different turrets will help you with battling larger enemies, and you will need this after setting up a colony, because there will be irregular invasions, during which native creatures will try to get to the power core of the colony to shut it down* you cannot only craft many different vehicles (also flying ones) in the creator-menu, but you can even build a refined monorail-system across your gameworld. You can dive into deep underwater caves with or without a wetsuit and you can fly by using a wingsuit or later on also jetpacks* the campaign-mode features an RPG-like story with quests and a down-to-earth background-story that is unveiled bit by bit. While it might not be to everyone's taste, I personally like it* there's a minecraft-like free creative/builder-mode with an infinite amount of all materials to freely build and craft with* the third game-mode is a survival-mode for adventurers, featuring an optional skill-unlock-system on randomly generated game-worlds sprinkled with NPC- and alien-settlements and optional small quests - set your own goals there without the RPG-story taking you by the hand* you can ask NPCs to live in your colony and defend the colony (together with your turrets) both in campaign-mode and also in adventure-mode* lately a comfort-level and illnesses have been added to the game, together with medicine to cure your character that you can brew or buy from NPCs. So now it is advised to sleep regularly and not to get soaked in the rain for too long. And digging for seeds (that you can plant) in animal dung might have an affect on your character's health as well...* there are multiplayer-options too now, so you can invite other players to your server or join them on theirs* the performance on my 64bit Windows 7 prof. is totally alright, no problems with the FPS here. I very, very rarely experienced freezes or quest-bugs. No problems with the sound and also nearly none with the graphics. However the game might not run as smoothly on every existing system, and I still experienced frequent crashes after playing for a longer while in early 2016.

content:

Early Access Review
								   If the amount of time i spent playing this game from the moment i  installed it is any indication, i'd give this game even in it's current alpha state 5 stars.   The combination of Minecraft style crafting system with an RPSesque story mode to give the rest of it some kind of point creates an experience that makes you actually CARE about delving into the depths for that last chunk of iron or coal. the addition of an integrated creation system that allows you to make anything from a stool to a house to a racetrack and a vehicle to race on it in multiplayer, as well as weapons and almost anything else you can imagine while still being constrained by the resources and items you've gathered in-game makes for an incredibly immersive world experience.   i got sucked in and played 33 hours the first two days i had this game. i am almost dreading the final release as the alphas scope only encompasses a small portion of the world so far an approximate 40km square area that i have as yet not found the end of.   support this game, get the alpha!

content:
Posted: April 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								this game is so far, very nice. graphics are pretty good and controls, though a little bit strange at first (switching between mouse and crosshair controls mid battle because you ran out of 1 type of heals and need to use another can sometimes be fatal), eventually become familiar and you get the hang of what it is you're supposed to do...some things which may or may not be to your taste:-build mode and adventure mode are at the point of goodness where it's almost better to start with one of those and learn how to play rather than learn in story mode-combat with swords seems a bit pointless in almost every situation after you obtain guns, which is fair enough considering they're guns but it'd be nice for there to be a point to these higher tiers of swords and if it is gun-orientated then guns need more tiers. so yeah, using guns is much easier on you and your med packs, just remember to have bullets...-speaking of combat, there's not really much to it, if you use swords you walk in and click like mad until stuff is dead and normally it's you who dies first. theres no blocking or evasion (yet??) so you take every hit, your only chance not to get hit is to hide behind a tree and use guns to kill them while they run into it-for a rpg, apart from quests it has very few traits that one would expect to find in a rpg-i, personally, have found almost no point in actually gathering resources to make things. you can mine and collect stuff yes, but not to make things, only to sell it to npcs so you can buy the thing you were supposed to and save yourself a huge amount of time. however, if mining and collecting is something you enjoy get yourself a nice shovel and dig til your hearts content-if you do choose to do the storyline quests then prepare to spend upwards of 10 minutes running between campsites when you get a quest where you cant fast travel (or you lose the quest)-jumping feels a little bit slow to start, you press the key to jump and it takes a second to actually commence jumping because of crouching. pffft realismlil' bit extra:-i know its completely unrealistic but i think the jetpack should be able to fly me around forever. to hell with realism.-if rpg is one of the ways this game is going, stats, skills and levels may be something to consider??theres a hell of a lot to this game so far and i definitely think it has potential, i haven't yet experienced everything (i played build mode, got a jetpack and just flew around a bit then played some story) but most of what i have has been enjoyable and completely recommendable.not much else to say really, it's pretty simple, if you like sandbox, open world, crafting and understand the phrase "early access" then this game is awesome, it does a very good job of being pretty much what its tags say it is. though if rpg is what you desire most, then lower your expectations a little bit.

								I am so addicted to this game.  The graphics are wonderful, the sounds and music are amazing.  The gameplay is something totally new.  You crashland on a dinosaur inhabited planet in the story, single player version.  Slowly you gather resources like plants, wood recipes for the replicator and meat... meat is your first currency. No more just square voxel based pieces, now there's anything you can imagine.  I am so stoked, I can't wait to see them finish this game and to see what's next.  Game on, you have me hooked :)

content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								On concept alone, PE already is many a gamers dream game: Getting dropped on an alien world with almost complete freedom of what to do there afterwards. While I haven't played Minecraft myself, the comparisons in regards to gameplay seem acurate as a lot of the early stages of the game consist of getting tools to acquire resources and mining/chopping/hunting what you need. At this moment, Combat is very basic though and I hope that it will be improved over the course of development since most of the other elements in the game are already perfectly viable like movement, exploration, the aforementioned resource gathering as well as building structures and, one of the games coolest features, vehicles.At the time I am writing this, my only real misgivings with the game are the AI of some of the followers as well as the scripting for the quests, since some quests are structured in a way that make it hard or even impossible to complete some quests without abusing the apparant invulnerability of some NPCs or having to fast-travel in order to make some monsters respawn.I bought PE for full price after having it on my wishlist fo some time and I dont regret it, if theres even a small part of you that likes the concept, I suggest getting at least on sale since I honestly think there isn't any early access title right now that shows more promise.

content:
Posted: July 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								Although I have only played 4 hours of the game, I can already see the fun it can deliver. The game, even though in early access has so much for you to do. I, personally am a huge fan of RPG, survival sort of games, and the game creators perfectly executed it. Looking ahead, I can see how great this game is going to get. What I want added to the game-Pets-Personal socialization with NPC's (like marriage or something)-More weaponary (although there is quite a bit of that already)-Classes you can choose would be an amazing addition. (Just like most RPGs)-Endless mode possibly as the game does in fact, have an endingWhat they should improve on -Although I truly understand that this game is still early access, there are quite a few easily noticable bugs. For example, the first time I stepped into the ocean, I kept glitching back and forth.-I don't know if this is just unfinished or they accidently left it out, but some things that NPC's say, you can actually hear it in the audio. However, some things they say can't be heard in the audio. I have even encountered a speech where the NPC was talking halfway, and then he just stopped, so I had to read the rest of it.There is a whole lot more I can but will not say. Overall, I HIGHLY recommend every fan of RPG games or survival games to get it. Whether you like action in your games, or not, this game will give it to you because you can choose, yourself to not follow the quests, avoiding bits of action like setting up a defense of sentry guns to defend off your camp from strong monsters. That is all I am going to say... Just get this game...

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								Planet Explorers is setting out to be a game that really brings the word "sandbox" to life.  That said, we've got to keep in mind that this game is still heavily embedded in Alpha.  This review will be based on the Alpha experience I've had, and may not be accurate as time passes.Starting out the game I realized very quickly that I was going to need help.  There was no sign of a tutorial anywhere.  I quickly figured out that if I wanted to get something out of this game I'd have to go do some research.  YouTube to the rescue!  After watching several really good tutorial videos on "getting started", I was quickly able to start moving forward in the world.  That said, I later figured out that the "Campaign" mode has a somewhat vague tutorial built into it.  Meaning, while it did guide me, there were still some things I had to figure out on my own.I'm going to start my actual review with the item editor, since that's a huge plus for this game.  Not watching any tutorials on this, I was able to make a rather nice looking stone sword and shield, but couldn't figure out where they were located in the crafting interface so I could actually craft them in-game.  This was done in "Campaign" mode, so I assume I needed to first learn how to make a "stone hilt" before the weapon would be available to me.  I have to say the item creator is very easy to use and I absolutely love the "mirror" modes while designing.  I also tried to design a stone & wood bike, but I had a few errors in the build (like having no drivable wheel) and couldn't figure out how to fix the problem.I found food to be a very big problem.  The easiest food I found to make required 1 torch to cook each meat.  To make a torch you needed wood (not a problem) and 1 animal fat per torch.  As most animals can easily kick my♥♥♥♥♥ the animal fat was hard to acquire.  Due to this, I kept running out of stamina and my character became rather sluggish.  Even sleeping 12 hours didn't fix my stamina level, although it brought it up a very minor amount.  It left me a little annoied.  I also couldn't figure out how to farm the seeds I had collected from several plants (used for medical supplies).  Perhaps watching more YouTube videos is in order...The worlds, I've got to say, are impressive.  For the most part.  There was a lot of flora and fauna in the world I started out in, but I quickly realized that most of it involved flat props, and not actual 3D plants.  It's kinda like how the creatures were in the original Duke 3D.  Flat, but seemed to always attempt to face your direction so they didn't look flat.  I'm hoping this will be changed as Alpha continues, because it almost ruins the beauty of the landscapes when up-close.  Then again, with the lack of instructions, I could have an option set that makes the flora appear in that manor instead of how it should look.Mining and digging is somewhat similar to other voxel games, like "7 Days to Die" and "Space Engineers", where the ground smoothly deforms instead of cubed removal like how they do in "Minecraft".  Object harvesting is very similar as well.  Trees, for example, must be fully cut down before you actually get resources from them.  That said, at present Trees simply vanish when cut down.  I'd personally like to see some kind of "falling" animation, and the tree vanishing instead as it lands on the ground.Creatures in the game were somewhat interesting.  I'm not exactly sure how creatures come into being, whether it's simply random generation or there is a massive database of them, but I found the ones I ran into to be somewhat strange in appearance.  One looked like the body of a brontosaurus, with the neck of a giraffe, the face of a clown (no word of a lie), and 6 legs.  I turned away from the creature because I deemed it too ugly to kill.  Another seemed to be a very low to the ground creature, hard to see in the flora.  It had 8 legs, a head kinda like an iguana, and a tail like a rat.  I tried to kill it, but my little dagger did virtually nothing.That brings me to combat!  I found it to be a bit unnerving, to say the least.  I couldn’t really tell what was damaging me when a creature attacked.  I couldn’t tell if I was getting clawed, if they were biting me, or if I was taking some kind of area damage.  I couldn’t even tell how much damage I was taking, without staring at my health bar.  There was no visual indicator of damage (No numbers/points appeared), which sometimes left me wondering if I was even hitting the creature.  As their health bars are so compact, unless you do serious (or a lot of) damage it’s hard to tell if the creature’s health is even dropping.Overall I have to say that I’d give the current state of this game a 7/10.  I can’t go any higher because I don’t know if the things that are missing (Tutorial/etc.) will eventually be added.  Right now it seems like a very user unfriendly game.  That said, it’s still early Alpha so I can’t give it too much negativity.  I purchased the game myself, and I’m not regretting that purchase.  We’ll see if that changes as Alpha moves to Beta, and Beta moves to final release…As it stands, if you want to take the risk, then I’d say this game is definitely recommended.  I find the price-point of $24.99 a little high for an Alpha-Version game, but if you consider most finished games sell for something like $60-80 it doesn’t seem too unreasonable.  This game has the formula to be a serious contender in the "sandbox" genre, assuming the dev team stays true to the promises they're making.

content:

Early Access Review
								Look dont mind my play time i just got it. I think this game is really good! There are some bugs here and there, but if you are patient and you like games like rust mixed with starbound mixed with skyrim you will like this game. It is a survival voxel type rpg with a crafting interface, The crafting system gets an A+. The AI get a B-. They work but..... They dont really, especially in escort missions. The game has huge monsters like in the final fantasy franchise, even if there not that powerful it gives you a very good sense of achievement.Also they game takes some work and time to go through, BUT! It is really rewarding in the end. Another key feature in this game is the 3d animation modeling that can be imported into the game. 1 word AWESOME. You get to make your own sword anyway you want it to look. You pick the material, then you build it using 3d animation modeling you can color it and put decals on it and voila!!!!! You can also make vehicles which is really cool even though its pretty complecated :PAll in all so far i give this game an B+. It needs improvement but if your patient im sure this game will become one of the epics.

Early Access Review
								This game has great potential, but it's a blast to play even in alpha.  I would describe it as a cross between Entropia Universe and Minecraft.  But since not many people have played Entropia Universe, you could say it's like Minecraft in space with good graphics.  The story mode is a fixed map with a questline and I believe adventure mode creates a randomly generated map.  The land feels vast, so there is a lot exploration available.  You can mine, chop down trees, and gather plants as resources to craft items.  There is an in game item editor, so you can really create (and import) anything you can imagine.  Of course you can also build structures easily and you don't have to place one block at a time to do so.  All I want to do is play this game all the time.
