content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								An excellent game. At first, I forgot the game was even Early Access, it was so good, for me, at least. The storyline was interesting, and while at some places it appeared to start getting a little bit boring, other things come along, like those maddeningly-hard 3 giant Warbots that guarded one of the storyline's main objective! While the game was, overall, quite good, there are some things that I can see improvement on- but not nearly as much as I would see in other Early Access games. I've played in all three modes: Story, Adventure, and Build, and mainly play in Story, since you can actually talk to people, look at a map, find people to trade with, etc etc etc. I also like Build because it gives more options in terms of experimenting: without a colony, it can be quite fustrating if you make a Creation, and find out that you did something wrong. However, here are the things that I think could have a bit of touching up on, or reworking: - AI, both in Colonists, and, say, your Followers. It's aggravating to have to go out of your way so that your Followers can actually follow you, and player-made buildings are worthless with Colonists, since they just walk up to a wall, and then appear on the roof. - Mining. I say this because, even at more advanced levels, it's a pain to mine. While sometimes you can just get caught up in seeing the massive amounts of items coming into your inventory, and having plenty of space to do so [Since Minecraft is one-item-per-block, and this is 20-items-for-half-a-block]. Drills might be useful: a mining machine would be much appreciated. Slopes would be helpful as well: the voxel system is awesome, just a pain to go up and down the mines, you know? - Movement. Ever played, say, Red Faction: Armageddon? If you were to introduce a movement system similar to that, I would be so bloody grateful. While everything is very, very nice, such as the running and attacking animations, RF:A has a much more versatile character movement, with lots of running and jumping, and you can change what you're doing mid-action, whether just turning or jumping away. - Colony. I don't know the plans, but I'd see it as very useful if you could have your colonists also work with mines and the like. If the Colony could generate an output, a production, instead of constant need of attention, both in the form of adding military might through turrets to keep the bad guys away, and in keeping everything running.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is great however it could use much refining. It is understandable that this game is merely an Alpha which makes it reasonable for flaws to be in the game but, nonetheless, the game is very fun. I enjoy this game a lot in almost every aspect, save for a few, from creating vehicles to collecting resources. There are some issues in the game like how a monster will hit you through walls, which causes stupid deaths, but the issues like that are being resolved with each passing patch.In this game, you can do almost anything you want. You can drive around in completely customized vehicles, creating the vehicles through voxels in the creator, and even build your own colony within the online servers with other players. You can design your own sword, gun, vtol, truck, tank, boats, etc. which allows this game to be completely based on your actions. The ground can be shaped the way you want to make it. All trees can be cut down and even buildings demolished. Anything you want to you in Minecraft, you can do here with much more interraction in a non-block world.I would have to say, despite how much I love this game, the major flaw that ruins it for me would have to be the servers. There are no official servers for multiplayer and, if you wish to have a reliable server, you're pretty much out of luck unless you make your own. Almost all of the servers are locked for groups of friends and the public ones are laggy and, if they go down, everything you did on them is lost. Anything you do on a server is confined to that server. This means that if you gather the best weapons and armor and make a civilization on a server, you cannot take them to a different server. It is recommended that you make your own server so that everything you make is saved.All in all, this game is one of the best games I have played in a long time and I will play it a lot more when more content is added. For an Alpha, I give it a 9/10 but i expect that to hit 10 once the bugs are fixed.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								It's alpha. you'll need to reference the wiki to find out what different items do, how to control the game, and what you ought to be doing.But even with that, it's fun. The item/vehicle/weapon creation system is pretty unique amongst this type of game, and is done reasonably well (a part of me ached to have more Blender-like controls, since modifying existing objects is a bit rough at the moment). Combat is decent, though most of the time I tended to lure monsters to a colony so the colonists killed them for me.After an hour or two of resource collection you won't need to do it again, which is good. It's got a great mining system that smoothly deforms the ground as you mine (it's actually the best implementation of that I've ever seen), but the animation is slow and controlling the camera underground is an exercise unto itself.Building a colony is fun, I appreciate that there's finally a minecrafty game that emphasizes that you're not alone, and allows you to recruit NPCs to work at your colony. There do seem to be some bugs with it, but nothing insurmountable. My biggest gripe is how *small* your colony has to be. It's not feasible to build dwellings and houses for your people, because if you put their beds too far away (read: like 50m away) from the colony center, it won't count towards your colony.Overall, it's definitely rough, but I like where it's going. I'd recommend that if you're uneasy about the "early access" pricetag, that you wait 6 months and give it another go - i expect it'll be more fully-featured at that point. If you want something cool to play *right now*, i'd still go for minecraft or starbound. But this is one to keep an eye on.

content:
Posted: July 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								Although I have only played 4 hours of the game, I can already see the fun it can deliver. The game, even though in early access has so much for you to do. I, personally am a huge fan of RPG, survival sort of games, and the game creators perfectly executed it. Looking ahead, I can see how great this game is going to get. What I want added to the game-Pets-Personal socialization with NPC's (like marriage or something)-More weaponary (although there is quite a bit of that already)-Classes you can choose would be an amazing addition. (Just like most RPGs)-Endless mode possibly as the game does in fact, have an endingWhat they should improve on -Although I truly understand that this game is still early access, there are quite a few easily noticable bugs. For example, the first time I stepped into the ocean, I kept glitching back and forth.-I don't know if this is just unfinished or they accidently left it out, but some things that NPC's say, you can actually hear it in the audio. However, some things they say can't be heard in the audio. I have even encountered a speech where the NPC was talking halfway, and then he just stopped, so I had to read the rest of it.There is a whole lot more I can but will not say. Overall, I HIGHLY recommend every fan of RPG games or survival games to get it. Whether you like action in your games, or not, this game will give it to you because you can choose, yourself to not follow the quests, avoiding bits of action like setting up a defense of sentry guns to defend off your camp from strong monsters. That is all I am going to say... Just get this game...

But since not many people have played Entropia Universe, you could say it's like Minecraft in space with good graphics. Of course you can also build structures easily and you don't have to place one block at a time to do so.  All I want to do is play this game all the time.

content:
Posted: June 18, 2014
Early Access Review
								This sat in my wishlist for a couple months until I broke down and bought it. At first I was thinkin I bought a turd but after playin a bit, it's actually pretty cool. It has crashed on me a couple times but it's early access but aside from that and a few graphical errors, I havent had any problems.    Now to the good stuff. The world map is friggin huge! I'm thalkin', walk 15 minutes north from the southern most side and you'll only get maybe a quarter of the way up...maybe. The item creation is insane. It's pretty much a mod toolkit. Weapons, vehicles, massive bases, you name it. If you think it, you could most likely make it.    At one point, I was mining for resources. Literally digging a mine shaft into the ground. Well, I didn't scan the surface so I didn't know that I was mining over a huge cave system. I fell in. After exploring the cave I found my only option was to dig myself out. After getting back to the surface I realized, Hey, I could make a Batcave style base outta that later! Needless to say, I'm incredibly happy that I picked it up and see myself putting a lot of hours into the game.....and hey, it ain't even done yet. Can't wait to explor the rest of the world and see what the Devs have planned next.

Early Access Review
								Pros:fun with friends, scavenging and exploring the open world with them can be very fun for hours on end while on the way you can battle larger creatures with your dinky little starter knife, even if you die to the overpowered monsters its oddly funloads of creative features that are in and are to be added, the buidling system is very nice, and I like it, build a home anyway you want to and build the tools to build your home, even build the guns and swords you use to defend said home with the creative system that lets you make them however you wantA very nice looking game, specially when gliding in places like the desert when there are canyons and other natural formationsCons:buggy to hell sometimes (it is in its earlier stages of devolopment after all)can't move away from friends when they are doing tasks such as digging or else it wont appear for you, had a friend dig into the ground while I was away and on returning he was 100 feet under solid ground for me.bad starting placement, sometimes spawning you in the middle of the ocean or a canyon you can't get out ofsometimes enemies are just weirdly overpowered and do way too much damage at the stages you find them, making the little thing on the ground you think you can kill, one shot you, this is much more noticeable in co-op where it seems there is no barrier from letting you walk 10 feet to find a giant and get 2 shottedFinal thoughts:I think its a very good game and worth the money as its boasting a large selection of features even in the current state along with its wonderful looks and fun with friends, but if you don't like the bugs that are in a early access game I say wait for the full game to come out

content:
Posted: July 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								Although I have only played 4 hours of the game, I can already see the fun it can deliver. The game, even though in early access has so much for you to do. I, personally am a huge fan of RPG, survival sort of games, and the game creators perfectly executed it. Looking ahead, I can see how great this game is going to get. What I want added to the game-Pets-Personal socialization with NPC's (like marriage or something)-More weaponary (although there is quite a bit of that already)-Classes you can choose would be an amazing addition. (Just like most RPGs)-Endless mode possibly as the game does in fact, have an endingWhat they should improve on -Although I truly understand that this game is still early access, there are quite a few easily noticable bugs. For example, the first time I stepped into the ocean, I kept glitching back and forth.-I don't know if this is just unfinished or they accidently left it out, but some things that NPC's say, you can actually hear it in the audio. However, some things they say can't be heard in the audio. I have even encountered a speech where the NPC was talking halfway, and then he just stopped, so I had to read the rest of it.There is a whole lot more I can but will not say. Overall, I HIGHLY recommend every fan of RPG games or survival games to get it. Whether you like action in your games, or not, this game will give it to you because you can choose, yourself to not follow the quests, avoiding bits of action like setting up a defense of sentry guns to defend off your camp from strong monsters. That is all I am going to say... Just get this game...

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								Planet Explorers is setting out to be a game that really brings the word "sandbox" to life.  That said, we've got to keep in mind that this game is still heavily embedded in Alpha.  This review will be based on the Alpha experience I've had, and may not be accurate as time passes.Starting out the game I realized very quickly that I was going to need help.  There was no sign of a tutorial anywhere.  I quickly figured out that if I wanted to get something out of this game I'd have to go do some research.  YouTube to the rescue!  After watching several really good tutorial videos on "getting started", I was quickly able to start moving forward in the world.  That said, I later figured out that the "Campaign" mode has a somewhat vague tutorial built into it.  Meaning, while it did guide me, there were still some things I had to figure out on my own.I'm going to start my actual review with the item editor, since that's a huge plus for this game.  Not watching any tutorials on this, I was able to make a rather nice looking stone sword and shield, but couldn't figure out where they were located in the crafting interface so I could actually craft them in-game.  This was done in "Campaign" mode, so I assume I needed to first learn how to make a "stone hilt" before the weapon would be available to me.  I have to say the item creator is very easy to use and I absolutely love the "mirror" modes while designing.  I also tried to design a stone & wood bike, but I had a few errors in the build (like having no drivable wheel) and couldn't figure out how to fix the problem.I found food to be a very big problem.  The easiest food I found to make required 1 torch to cook each meat.  To make a torch you needed wood (not a problem) and 1 animal fat per torch.  As most animals can easily kick my♥♥♥♥♥ the animal fat was hard to acquire.  Due to this, I kept running out of stamina and my character became rather sluggish.  Even sleeping 12 hours didn't fix my stamina level, although it brought it up a very minor amount.  It left me a little annoied.  I also couldn't figure out how to farm the seeds I had collected from several plants (used for medical supplies).  Perhaps watching more YouTube videos is in order...The worlds, I've got to say, are impressive.  For the most part.  There was a lot of flora and fauna in the world I started out in, but I quickly realized that most of it involved flat props, and not actual 3D plants.  It's kinda like how the creatures were in the original Duke 3D.  Flat, but seemed to always attempt to face your direction so they didn't look flat.  I'm hoping this will be changed as Alpha continues, because it almost ruins the beauty of the landscapes when up-close.  Then again, with the lack of instructions, I could have an option set that makes the flora appear in that manor instead of how it should look.Mining and digging is somewhat similar to other voxel games, like "7 Days to Die" and "Space Engineers", where the ground smoothly deforms instead of cubed removal like how they do in "Minecraft".  Object harvesting is very similar as well.  Trees, for example, must be fully cut down before you actually get resources from them.  That said, at present Trees simply vanish when cut down.  I'd personally like to see some kind of "falling" animation, and the tree vanishing instead as it lands on the ground.Creatures in the game were somewhat interesting.  I'm not exactly sure how creatures come into being, whether it's simply random generation or there is a massive database of them, but I found the ones I ran into to be somewhat strange in appearance.  One looked like the body of a brontosaurus, with the neck of a giraffe, the face of a clown (no word of a lie), and 6 legs.  I turned away from the creature because I deemed it too ugly to kill.  Another seemed to be a very low to the ground creature, hard to see in the flora.  It had 8 legs, a head kinda like an iguana, and a tail like a rat.  I tried to kill it, but my little dagger did virtually nothing.That brings me to combat!  I found it to be a bit unnerving, to say the least.  I couldn’t really tell what was damaging me when a creature attacked.  I couldn’t tell if I was getting clawed, if they were biting me, or if I was taking some kind of area damage.  I couldn’t even tell how much damage I was taking, without staring at my health bar.  There was no visual indicator of damage (No numbers/points appeared), which sometimes left me wondering if I was even hitting the creature.  As their health bars are so compact, unless you do serious (or a lot of) damage it’s hard to tell if the creature’s health is even dropping.Overall I have to say that I’d give the current state of this game a 7/10.  I can’t go any higher because I don’t know if the things that are missing (Tutorial/etc.) will eventually be added.  Right now it seems like a very user unfriendly game.  That said, it’s still early Alpha so I can’t give it too much negativity.  I purchased the game myself, and I’m not regretting that purchase.  We’ll see if that changes as Alpha moves to Beta, and Beta moves to final release…As it stands, if you want to take the risk, then I’d say this game is definitely recommended.  I find the price-point of $24.99 a little high for an Alpha-Version game, but if you consider most finished games sell for something like $60-80 it doesn’t seem too unreasonable.  This game has the formula to be a serious contender in the "sandbox" genre, assuming the dev team stays true to the promises they're making.

content:
Posted: December 17, 2014
Early Access Review
								People have built ancient ruins, giant temples, castles, Starcraft Ghosts C-10 canister rifle, , keyblades, a lightsabers, a Star Destroyer and a TIE interceptor from Star Wars and Kaneda's iconic motorcycle from Akira.If that plus a history about a misterious alien planet with an unknown inteligent alien species and giant monsters roaming around are not enough to have you interested then nothing will.Also, the game engine was changed and it is beautiful now. The weapons have a wider range of options for you to create, from Bows, to Sniper Rifles and High Powered Laser Rifles.You can make robots now, and armor, and design your own Turrets, and terraform the terrain with pavement of your choice.If you like building and creating, this is the game for you. You can't make the complicated machinery from Space Engineers, but you can design your own gear and buldings from scratch anytime anywhere. Made me feel like Tony Stark... sans the drinking problem.

content:
Posted: April 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								I am so addicted to this game.  The graphics are wonderful, the sounds and music are amazing.  The gameplay is something totally new.  You crashland on a dinosaur inhabited planet in the story, single player version.  Slowly you gather resources like plants, wood recipes for the replicator and meat... meat is your first currency.  Slowly you find other crashed people who have quests and further recipes.  This is a totally new concept of a survival game, an rpg... a shooter and a sandbox game.  Oh, and I haven't made anything yet but there's a built in 3D program that will apparently allow you to build anything you want.  No more just square voxel based pieces, now there's anything you can imagine.  I am so stoked, I can't wait to see them finish this game and to see what's next.  Game on, you have me hooked :)

content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								On concept alone, PE already is many a gamers dream game: Getting dropped on an alien world with almost complete freedom of what to do there afterwards. While I haven't played Minecraft myself, the comparisons in regards to gameplay seem acurate as a lot of the early stages of the game consist of getting tools to acquire resources and mining/chopping/hunting what you need. At this moment, Combat is very basic though and I hope that it will be improved over the course of development since most of the other elements in the game are already perfectly viable like movement, exploration, the aforementioned resource gathering as well as building structures and, one of the games coolest features, vehicles.At the time I am writing this, my only real misgivings with the game are the AI of some of the followers as well as the scripting for the quests, since some quests are structured in a way that make it hard or even impossible to complete some quests without abusing the apparant invulnerability of some NPCs or having to fast-travel in order to make some monsters respawn.I bought PE for full price after having it on my wishlist fo some time and I dont regret it, if theres even a small part of you that likes the concept, I suggest getting at least on sale since I honestly think there isn't any early access title right now that shows more promise.

content:
Posted: June 18, 2014
Early Access Review
								This sat in my wishlist for a couple months until I broke down and bought it. At first I was thinkin I bought a turd but after playin a bit, it's actually pretty cool. It has crashed on me a couple times but it's early access but aside from that and a few graphical errors, I havent had any problems.    Now to the good stuff. The world map is friggin huge! I'm thalkin', walk 15 minutes north from the southern most side and you'll only get maybe a quarter of the way up...maybe. The item creation is insane. It's pretty much a mod toolkit. Weapons, vehicles, massive bases, you name it. If you think it, you could most likely make it.    At one point, I was mining for resources. Literally digging a mine shaft into the ground. Well, I didn't scan the surface so I didn't know that I was mining over a huge cave system. I fell in. After exploring the cave I found my only option was to dig myself out. After getting back to the surface I realized, Hey, I could make a Batcave style base outta that later! Needless to say, I'm incredibly happy that I picked it up and see myself putting a lot of hours into the game.....and hey, it ain't even done yet. Can't wait to explor the rest of the world and see what the Devs have planned next.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								An excellent game. At first, I forgot the game was even Early Access, it was so good, for me, at least. The storyline was interesting, and while at some places it appeared to start getting a little bit boring, other things come along, like those maddeningly-hard 3 giant Warbots that guarded one of the storyline's main objective! While the game was, overall, quite good, there are some things that I can see improvement on- but not nearly as much as I would see in other Early Access games. I've played in all three modes: Story, Adventure, and Build, and mainly play in Story, since you can actually talk to people, look at a map, find people to trade with, etc etc etc. I also like Build because it gives more options in terms of experimenting: without a colony, it can be quite fustrating if you make a Creation, and find out that you did something wrong. However, here are the things that I think could have a bit of touching up on, or reworking: - AI, both in Colonists, and, say, your Followers. It's aggravating to have to go out of your way so that your Followers can actually follow you, and player-made buildings are worthless with Colonists, since they just walk up to a wall, and then appear on the roof. - Mining. I say this because, even at more advanced levels, it's a pain to mine. While sometimes you can just get caught up in seeing the massive amounts of items coming into your inventory, and having plenty of space to do so [Since Minecraft is one-item-per-block, and this is 20-items-for-half-a-block]. Drills might be useful: a mining machine would be much appreciated. Slopes would be helpful as well: the voxel system is awesome, just a pain to go up and down the mines, you know? - Movement. Ever played, say, Red Faction: Armageddon? If you were to introduce a movement system similar to that, I would be so bloody grateful. While everything is very, very nice, such as the running and attacking animations, RF:A has a much more versatile character movement, with lots of running and jumping, and you can change what you're doing mid-action, whether just turning or jumping away. - Colony. I don't know the plans, but I'd see it as very useful if you could have your colonists also work with mines and the like. If the Colony could generate an output, a production, instead of constant need of attention, both in the form of adding military might through turrets to keep the bad guys away, and in keeping everything running.

content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is an absolutely wonderful experience. The 3 different play modes offer a change of pace to the overplayed sandbox genre. Story mode, although, barebones at the moment gives a sense of direction and is a different take on a tutorial. The game, however, isn't user friendly at the start. It will take some time to learn the crafting/resource gathering/ survivng. One playthrough in Story mode offers all these basic knowledge(s) and you are free to wonder the map and do as you will. If following the storyline is what you desire, then it will keep you entertained. Most of the dialouge in the story mode is voice acted. Overall this is was an excellent purchase. The graphics are refreshing, the buildmode is wonderful, and the challenge will keep me entertained for many hours to come.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is great however it could use much refining. It is understandable that this game is merely an Alpha which makes it reasonable for flaws to be in the game but, nonetheless, the game is very fun. I enjoy this game a lot in almost every aspect, save for a few, from creating vehicles to collecting resources. There are some issues in the game like how a monster will hit you through walls, which causes stupid deaths, but the issues like that are being resolved with each passing patch.In this game, you can do almost anything you want. You can drive around in completely customized vehicles, creating the vehicles through voxels in the creator, and even build your own colony within the online servers with other players. You can design your own sword, gun, vtol, truck, tank, boats, etc. which allows this game to be completely based on your actions. The ground can be shaped the way you want to make it. All trees can be cut down and even buildings demolished. Anything you want to you in Minecraft, you can do here with much more interraction in a non-block world.I would have to say, despite how much I love this game, the major flaw that ruins it for me would have to be the servers. There are no official servers for multiplayer and, if you wish to have a reliable server, you're pretty much out of luck unless you make your own. Almost all of the servers are locked for groups of friends and the public ones are laggy and, if they go down, everything you did on them is lost. Anything you do on a server is confined to that server. This means that if you gather the best weapons and armor and make a civilization on a server, you cannot take them to a different server. It is recommended that you make your own server so that everything you make is saved.All in all, this game is one of the best games I have played in a long time and I will play it a lot more when more content is added. For an Alpha, I give it a 9/10 but i expect that to hit 10 once the bugs are fixed.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								It's alpha. you'll need to reference the wiki to find out what different items do, how to control the game, and what you ought to be doing.But even with that, it's fun. The item/vehicle/weapon creation system is pretty unique amongst this type of game, and is done reasonably well (a part of me ached to have more Blender-like controls, since modifying existing objects is a bit rough at the moment). Combat is decent, though most of the time I tended to lure monsters to a colony so the colonists killed them for me.After an hour or two of resource collection you won't need to do it again, which is good. It's got a great mining system that smoothly deforms the ground as you mine (it's actually the best implementation of that I've ever seen), but the animation is slow and controlling the camera underground is an exercise unto itself.Building a colony is fun, I appreciate that there's finally a minecrafty game that emphasizes that you're not alone, and allows you to recruit NPCs to work at your colony. There do seem to be some bugs with it, but nothing insurmountable. My biggest gripe is how *small* your colony has to be. It's not feasible to build dwellings and houses for your people, because if you put their beds too far away (read: like 50m away) from the colony center, it won't count towards your colony.Overall, it's definitely rough, but I like where it's going. I'd recommend that if you're uneasy about the "early access" pricetag, that you wait 6 months and give it another go - i expect it'll be more fully-featured at that point. If you want something cool to play *right now*, i'd still go for minecraft or starbound. But this is one to keep an eye on.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								In a nutshell, and for those that are hesitant or confused on what Planet Explorers truly is, it's a concoction comprised of Starbound and Minecraft, and then what Star Forge was expected to be, but has since fallen short of. If two of the three titles I mentioned ring a bell and you enjoyed them (or in Star Forge's case, didn't and wanted more), you're more than likely going to enjoy this game. Continuing this with this thought, let me explain further, it takes its great exploration and sandbox-like feel from Minecraft, almost heavily with a lot of flare. Explore and you'll find many biomes, fantastic looking creatures that may or may not want to murder you, and land formations and villages and caves waiting to be explored, glided down from, or spelunked. The areas of land are huge, and are quite aesthetically pleasing. Adventure mode will be your friend if you want to explore with a challenge of mobs. From Starbound it takes the great space feel with many different creatures and customization. Even though it technically looks like it would be more similar to minecraft, the building style present in the game feels much more like Starbound, the buildings can be extremely detailed and massive and amazing (I suggest you go check it out on YouTube or just the Steam Community page), and dont worry, if you want to build without threats, theres a mode just for you, no monsters to ruin your time. And from the image of Star Forge, the look and feel of the game and combat (although not quite as… hectic). The generation, the funky mobs, the unexplained, it all fits in very well for the image I had constructed of Star Forge. And to kick it all off, there is a pretty decent (although sometimes grindy RPG style) story to it that explains the occurrences and sends you exploring and hunting and building and saving and protecting the many people of the storyline (which, for better or worse, features almost full voice-acting). I wont spoil anything, but to give an overview of the intro, you are placed in a futuristic setting in which Earth has been browned and polluted, many of the other solar system’s planets and moons colonized and populated, and to branch out further with new hope for the human race as a whole (especially that of Earth’s), you and many many other people were sent to a planet to colonize it and research further. It was scanned and checked before arrival and there shouldn’t be any surprises, however, upon descent, your ship hits something mid-air, evacuation procedures initiate, and off you go to this planet at extreme speeds. Good luck.tl;dr and overall: Pretty good game with a lot of content that is just magnified upon adding more than one person (although no multiplayer Story mode is very disappointing). Crazy builds available for download made by the community, which is more or less balanced in resource cost, makes it even better. Lots of exploration to be had. Good way into the story myself, and I am enjoying it, but sometimes the AI gets a little… wonky. In its current state 7/10 Would recommend, with forewarning of Early-Access. Definitely some bugs (but most can be solved by saving and reloading in Story). Worth every cent.

content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								Craft/sandbox games are popping up everywhere since the success of Mincecraft.Many of them arn't bad, but are nothing more then "meh" MC clones (I have tried alot of them, and most couldn't keep me interested for very long.)Then there is this beauty.You can mine, chop, and dig, but the landscape isn't "cubed" but adapts dynamically.And ofcourseyou can craft a vast amount of items, build tools, houses, bases, vehicles, etc...But wait ! There is more ! you also have a spore-style editor in-game to craft blueprints for your own custom <any item>.When you are finished building your blueprint (in the game called an "ISO") the game calculates what parts and materials you need to build it, and you can create and use it in-game.Exploration is encouraged, and is much more fun then most MC-style games, because the landscape actually is pretty. You spot alien creatures are ripe for the hunting, but carefull, some might just hunt you. Or work in packs.It looks good, it plays good, and it even has story mode ! (also, adventure, build, ...)If you enjoy Crafting/sandbox/survival games, this one is a must-try.

content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								Note: At the time of this writing, the game is on Alpha version 0.82.I like that you can download objects from other players from right in the game. I haven't been able to try out the multiplayer yet but I'm looking forward to it. The NPCs in the story do a great job of giving you the scripts you need to build almost everything as long as you do the side quests. It's also nice that I can sell my extra wood and marble to them before buying an item to 'trade' my wood/marble for newer tools.I am enjoying the story missions, when I don't run into a quest stopping bug (Up! Up! Up!). The game has its share of bugs like not locking the mouse into the game window during fullscreen. For dual monitor setups, this means your game will go into window mode every time you click outside of it. I change my setup to single monitor when playing. My game has not crashed at all since the 0.82 update.One of the tricks for a few of the bugs you'll encounter is to save your game often. IF you hit a bug, load up your last save and try again. If you get stuck on a quest ad don't have a save; save, quit, load. I got stuck on a quest to rescue some survivors from a stuck ship and almost gave up after reloading a few times and then it suddenly worked without explanation.tl;dr: It's a great game with a few bugs. The game has great potential. If you like sandbox builders and save often, you'll love this game.

								This review is for the alpha so take it with a pinch of salt if you're reading it at a later date.Good game but the controls are a bit off. It kinda just drops you into the action (which can be good or bad depending on how you play) I was still on one of the tutorial mission learning how to mine copper when a HUGE rhino looking thing came out of no-where and insta-killed me. Also animals tend to spawn like 10 feet in front of you, which is really troublsome, especially when it's a freaking giant beast that can kill you in one hit if you don't have good enough armor. Problems aside though it's a really good game, but it might be best to wait for it to go on sale.

content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								I like this game. It has a lot going for it. BUT...it is far from complete and is still full of issues and problems that are game breakers. It is worth getting if you know this going in and DON'T want to play the "story" mode. It is therefore more of a sandbox game, like Minecraft, where you can run around and harvest resources and build some stuff while trying to not get killed. The developers aren't hiding anything, it is "Early Access" after all. It will be a GREAT game once it is done. I just hope it is before No Man's Sky comes out because that would replace the need for this game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								The game is actually quite decent, even in its early access alpha stage. The strength of this game lies in its gameplay mechanics that it can offers to players, i.e. open world RPG, vehicle and weapon customisation, crafting and colony building. The world "Maria" itself is actually quite beautiful, I really like the forest biome. The game also features a mechanic similar to the monster hunter game where you explore the world, see a big nasty alien and hunt it down for meat or other resources, though the combat mechanics in planet explorers are  .... mediocre at best but still acceptable in my view.In a nut shell, I would recommend this game to anyone that likes open world adventure, exploration and RPG stuff. Given its current price of 14.99 USD, thats a steal, considering the game can offers so many features even in its early form, unlike some other overpriced AAA games ;)

content:

Early Access Review
								I shall tell you a tale. The tale of a man that was minding his own ♥♥♥♥ing buisness. That man was me, I was wondering far and wide in search of many differant minerals. Along my travels I met one of the many inhabitants of this female only occupied planet (planet Lesbiana, quadrant 69bj), and we set off in search of gold, along the way slaying many a beast. Silently laying in wait just out of my render distance sat a great horror one that strikes fear into even the bravest of neckbeards. I roamed closer not any the wiser of what prison shower♥♥♥♥♥♥scene that was about to take place. When IT it rendered in ,The Giant Space♥♥♥♥♥♥Robot from Space began to stand, I ran as fast as my skinny futuristic weakling legs would carry me, but it was to late, I and my partner were blown away in a volley of 10 or so rockets and one accurate laser blast. I layed there plotting whether I should call the cops and report♥♥♥♥♥♥or just go to therapy for a few years.  10/10 would drop the soap and get♥♥♥♥♥♥♥again.In all honesty it is a great game. All great games have problems at the start , for me the adressable ones are having to leave and rejoin the server in multiplayer and friends not being able to pick you up, in the build servers you need an infinite amount of items not like 1000 items each because if lets say you want to use a model someone made of a jet or one of the bigger models its uses up pretty much all of those items. One thing this game seriously needs very bad is a party system that overlays on to your screen and not just on the map, similar to Arma 3 wastelands party system. With just my short time playing this i enjoyed it alot, but be wary its still in alpha so it will have problems. Great game even in alpha state.

Early Access Review
								Planet Explorers - Story Mode is the only thing I have tried so far.  The game is in beta so there are a few tweeks that I would love to see added that would make this more friendly to players like me who tend to "get lost", especially since this is an exploration game.  That being said, the graphics are nice and quests are easy enough to get. I wasn't expecting the chat bubbles with the NPCs to be at the bottom of the screen though.   Quest markers on the map would be awesome and even a lead (guide) pointing me to them would be even better.  Crafting is pretty cool, scripts (instead of recipe or plans) seems a bit odd to me. Overall this game has great potential and would be a good game to LAN with!

								This game is kinda confusing at the very beginning but all you have to remember is F2 locks and unlocks your cursor and you can harvest alot of the things in the game.  Mining goes below ground with what limit I have yet to try to reach.  The crafting in the game is simple enough and can be done anywhere and you can make multiples at one time in the same time as one which takes alot of the repetativeness of crafting in other games out. content:
Posted: January 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								This has got to be the best early access title I've ever seen... granted I haven't played a lot of them but I've certainly had my eye on quite a few ;). I'm VERY anxious to see what comes next. As for what we have now:PROYou can build anything in the *integrated* 3D modelling software and export it directly into your game. ANYTHING. Want a sword shaped like a hockey stick? Go for it. A motorcycle that looks like a giant taco? No problem. How about 50+ foot tall mech that seats three, flies, manuevers in three dimensions, and carries enough firepower to single-handedly liberate a small nation? Check out my screenshots... ;)Hundreds of building and crafting materials to use and mix together with a robust system that is phenomenally easy to use. Example: I burned through my gold pick and I'm a mile away from a repair machine and half as far underground. I open up my crafting window and select gold pick and the mats window tells me I need steel so I click on that right in the window.  Seems I have an abundance of mats for that so I make my steel and then I see up top that steel can be used for, among many things, gold picks. Click gold pick, click build, DONE. Easy.Story Mode. I've been mostly playing in Adventure Mode so I can't honestly speak to Story Mode a whole lot but I'll say  this about it: It doesn't suck! There are so many other games that wind up with devs scrapping most of the details on their story just to rush content... Not these guys and to me that shows integrity, something otherwise lacking in a lot of other titles.I have no cons, as it's still in developpment, so only positive criticism. I have a few suggestions, I know that a lot of devs read these reviews, and I despise digging through forums and creating more accounts everywhere just to post in a single thread somewhere so...Suggestions1st person. I know after reading around that you had it working at one point. This really needs a fix, mining in tight spaces with any kind of precision is impossible when your backside occupies the entire screen.Armor Dyes. I can paint anything I build any colour I want regardless of shape or size but not my armor? I like the models just fine and, quite frankly, custom armor is probably the one thing I have no interest in modding but there really should be an option to dye it. Maybe have a colour picker or something pop up in the crafting window when you click to build and if you choose to change the colour it tallies up the required pigments for you before finalizing?Weapon placement. I made a seriously bad♥♥♥♥♥gauntlet/katar with claws half as long as a man but to my horror the whole thing sticks straight up into the air behind my dude's head. Maybe if the creator had a new tab with a basic human shaped model we could specify wear a weapon should be worn (back, hip, etc.) and in what orientation, sort of like the same way we already can do with parts while building.Weapon pairing! I equip a sword and shield, no problem. I switch to my laser rifle, still no problem. Both are hotkeyed for ease but the moment I switch back to my sword I now have to go digging through my inventory to find my shield 'cause it missed the memo that it was business time. How about a pop-up menu for single handed gear that would allow the user to pair or un-pair the item with other one handed gear? Dual wield pistols, sword and axe, sword and board, etc, all with a single click once paired.More precise painting. The way paint bleeds from one surface inot another is actually pretty frustrating.Craftable solar power. Have I just not found it yet? I play in Adventure Mode mostly and I have yet to see it, yet there's a solar charger sitting outside a tent at the beginning of Story Mode. I wanna build one of those specifically!PAUSE in menu during single player. I don't think this one needs explanation but I'll throw this in here: It sucks if you have to leave your desk for a bit, or use the creator to tweak some stuff, and come back to find your toon starving.Like I said, no cons just suggestions. I could come up with more if I really put the time and thought into it but as it stands I have a craving for tacos now that must be appeased. This game is already well on it's way to being ace and I love it so far, keep up the great work, and for the potential buyer if you're into building games and the like then YES this is worth it :)

content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								Okay!!! I've just played my first 24 hrs of P.E. All I can say is this... MINECRAFT ON CRACK, ROIDS and that special juice Bane used in Batman!!!! The learning curve is a bit steap at first..but then the flow opens up. There are some glitches but thats to be exspected. I would have to write a novella to explain everything this game allows you to do...so I'll leave it to youtube to show you...and I watched a lot of youtube prior to this purchase. If you play space engineers, think of this as the part duex of that movie. Your ship crashes (along with hundreds of others) on a strange planet where you must mine and process ore and harvest natural resources (trees, plants, salt water) to survive. And dont forget about all that alien life..some of which is hostile. The best part is P.E's version of modding! YOU CAN MAKE ANYTHING! There is a sweet evolutionary editor that allows you to make any customized item and import it directly into your game *holds breath*......as your playing..YES...I said in YOUR GAME. Crazy huh! PSSST...I dont wanna speak to soon....but I think we have a winner here.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								Amazingly good for an early access game. I haven't played through the entire story mode yet, and haven't messed around with the build or survival modes yet, but Planetary Explorers currently looks and feels like it could be a fully developed game. It has good graphics and a well thought-out, if very loose, beginning to a story so far with a very imaginative setting and good mechanics. I definitely like the crafting system better than games like minecraft, and the voxel mining system looks very natural relative to a lot of other games I've played, although I wish the camera didn't track the character's motions quite so  precisely. The environment is wonderful and fairly varied once you venture beyond your starting areaMy biggest complaints for the game so far are that A) there needs to be a bit more detail in the starting missions or at least a more in-depth help screen to describe some of the controls (such as that you can toggle running with "r" or that, yes, those ARE herbs that you can harvest by facing them and right-clicking) and B) that the game becomes exponentially more memory-intensive as you progress and begin actually exploring the island. The second one is by far the most serious, because so far I've explored less than a tenth of the massive continent you start on but have encountered the error that my fairly high-quality, memory-rich expensive laptop has run out of memory to run the game on. At the moment, the game is trying to store too much awesome for my computer to handle at the same time. Much as I am in favor and awe of the good graphics and incredibly huge open map, I would settle for a bit less of it if it meant I could finish the game.That said, the game shows great promise and I would definitely buy it again just for what I've seen so far.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								One word: Overwhelming. This game is beyond having content. It is everything I would personally want from a survival game (Aside from First-Person, but the Third-Person is done in a great Fashion, like Monster Hunter, if you're familiar). The map is sizable for Early Access, terra-forming is wonderful, Creation is beyond anything I've ever seen in a Voxel Game. All of the building is done in the obvious block-by-block format, but you can take the materials you collect, enter a separate part of the game (Either in the opening menu or mid-game) and build anything you feel like, from guns, swords, and shields, to massive Airships to obliterate whatever threat you come across. If you're willing to deal with the rusty controls, get this game. It is a dream, and always fun. Once you learn the basics, you're set.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is really amazing, the depth is there but you are not required to get into it.  As fun as any survival game but without the repetitive zombie theme, instead you get a nice change with the sci-fi theme that brings crazy scenery, plants, bugs and even a somewhat scary enemy.  jEven at the early stage of alpha this game is currently in there is so much to do, once you figure out how to do something you will quickly be finding more and more to do and before you know it you have played for 6 hours.  You might think you would have gotten alot done in that time, well not likely the map in this game.....its enormous.  But for good reason, there is a creation system in the game that allows you to create; like actually "create" your own vehicles.  You get the basic guts and mechanical stuff, then you get to completely design the body, style, gun placement, how many wheels etc etc.  The creation doesnt just apply to vehicles and aircrafts but you also get the option to completely create your own sword, shield and gun designs.  Now you might think that leads to overpowered stupid looking junk that everyone will be using, wrong the creation system requires you to gather the materials you build with and it will take some trial and error before you really get what you want.  Its simple yet still very detailed when you want it to be, granted there is a short learning curve but those who would enjoy the game will have no problem with that.After watching some videos I recently came to realize there is a glider backpack and a grappling hook in the game that you can aquire somehow.  So far I have only played the story mode and that has taken quite a bit of time to learn and make a small amount of progress through.  So I have not had the thril of jumping off high mountain tops and gliding around this enormous map, or using the grappling hook to climb insane mountains.  I have only seen video of the aircrafts you can potentially design and I cannot wait to design my own.  The game is every bit worth the $24.99 price tag and to think its only in the alpha stages.  I cannot wait to see what else they add to this game, I unfortunately do not have the internet access to use the multiplayer feature but exploring this massive world with all the options they give you would be alot of fun with a friend or two.  I look forward to the future of this game and hopefully you will take the time to immerse yourself and enjoy the adventure that is available in Planet Explorers.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								In a nutshell, and for those that are hesitant or confused on what Planet Explorers truly is, it's a concoction comprised of Starbound and Minecraft, and then what Star Forge was expected to be, but has since fallen short of. If two of the three titles I mentioned ring a bell and you enjoyed them (or in Star Forge's case, didn't and wanted more), you're more than likely going to enjoy this game. Continuing this with this thought, let me explain further, it takes its great exploration and sandbox-like feel from Minecraft, almost heavily with a lot of flare. Explore and you'll find many biomes, fantastic looking creatures that may or may not want to murder you, and land formations and villages and caves waiting to be explored, glided down from, or spelunked. The areas of land are huge, and are quite aesthetically pleasing. Adventure mode will be your friend if you want to explore with a challenge of mobs. From Starbound it takes the great space feel with many different creatures and customization. Even though it technically looks like it would be more similar to minecraft, the building style present in the game feels much more like Starbound, the buildings can be extremely detailed and massive and amazing (I suggest you go check it out on YouTube or just the Steam Community page), and dont worry, if you want to build without threats, theres a mode just for you, no monsters to ruin your time. And from the image of Star Forge, the look and feel of the game and combat (although not quite as… hectic). The generation, the funky mobs, the unexplained, it all fits in very well for the image I had constructed of Star Forge. And to kick it all off, there is a pretty decent (although sometimes grindy RPG style) story to it that explains the occurrences and sends you exploring and hunting and building and saving and protecting the many people of the storyline (which, for better or worse, features almost full voice-acting). I wont spoil anything, but to give an overview of the intro, you are placed in a futuristic setting in which Earth has been browned and polluted, many of the other solar system’s planets and moons colonized and populated, and to branch out further with new hope for the human race as a whole (especially that of Earth’s), you and many many other people were sent to a planet to colonize it and research further. It was scanned and checked before arrival and there shouldn’t be any surprises, however, upon descent, your ship hits something mid-air, evacuation procedures initiate, and off you go to this planet at extreme speeds. Good luck.tl;dr and overall: Pretty good game with a lot of content that is just magnified upon adding more than one person (although no multiplayer Story mode is very disappointing). Crazy builds available for download made by the community, which is more or less balanced in resource cost, makes it even better. Lots of exploration to be had. Good way into the story myself, and I am enjoying it, but sometimes the AI gets a little… wonky. In its current state 7/10 Would recommend, with forewarning of Early-Access. Definitely some bugs (but most can be solved by saving and reloading in Story). Worth every cent.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								Updated Review:After the devs started undertaking an overhall of the game, I tabled it for a while.  I had already completed the story, had my save wiped, and completed it again, so I didn't feel I was missing much.  18 months later, with a0.9 out, i picked it up again... and it's boring.  NOTHING CHANGED!  The view is exactly the same and the graphics don't feel any different.  I looked up a screen shot of my last save, and they look nearly identical, with a few slight differences.  Before the view distances were synced properly, but now the grass can go on forever with no terrain beneath it, making it look like the grass can fly.  There's a weird haze over anything further than ten feet, and the close plants don't appear as vibrant either.  Loading times are longer, and lag spikes are more frequent, but watching my computer performance, not linked to high hardware demands.  So I take it back, it doesn't look the same as before 0.9, it actually looks a bit worse.Sounds now detract from immersion.  Ambient noises like the ocean waves cannot be turned down without turning down sound effects as well.  Voices are hard to hear, and the text font sometimes goes blurry.  The music used to be nice, but after hearing the same thing for hours, it gets monotonous.  The tracks are short and there's little diversity if you're staying in the same area for a long while.  Weapons are put away in the middle of combat because you changed your view angle.  Bows are so weak you might as well be throwing rocks, but you get guns and laser pistols soon enough.  Those also suck until you spend the time upgrading, which I highly recommend.  The turrets are more fond of shooting your own base than any enemy, and there's no quick way to refill them.  Axes won't start hacking at trees unless you have them drawn, not just equiped but drawn.  The interactions to harvest plants are choppy and irritating.  Monsters will despawn while you're still trying to empty their inventory.  Trees magically regain all of their durability if you stop hacking at them for more than a second.The creator tool is still awesome, but at the same time aggravating.  You can create many amazing things, like if you want to spend hours making a sword or carving out a shield, or possibly days on something bigger.  You can change your view angle, and camera locationg, but working intricate designs is extremely difficult.  Even curves are a pain, so most initial designs come out looking like boxes.  I'm not really into moschism, so I just use the scripts or workshop.  I did build my own helicopter though, and let me tell you that's a challenge.  The softest landings damage it, despite tires and iron struts.  That's fine, helicopters are delicate.  So delicate that if you ram into an invisible tree, your creation is dead.  There are also invisible walls marking the edge of the story zone.  No semi-transparent warning, nope, just flaming death.The camps have been changed since I last played though.  Before, the martian camp was decorated with everything they could want or need, which is in line with the story, and I happily stole it all.  Yeah, suck it martians.  I guess the devs didn't like that tactic because now the martians have the same camp, but with skeleton buildings.  No doors, no stairs, no pretty plants, nothing.  And the buildings themselves didn't change to accomodate, they just stripped them bare.The pathing has been improved slightly (very slightly).  Now my followers don't get stuck in a cave, but they do still walk off plateaus, get trapped in rivers ten feet from the beach, get stuck inside buildings, or inside trees, or rarely stuck in an empty field with nothing around.  If you have them assigned to a work station they'll sometimes teleport though, so yay I guess.  Okay, so I ragged on it a bit, but that's mostly due to the devs spending a year getting 0.9 out, and the transition being less than stellar.The price has gone up a bit since I first bought it, but for those that have never played it before, I still recommend the purchase (currently $25).  Yes, it's incomplete and the movements aren't fluid, and mining is slow and painful, but your first dive in will be to an incredible new world with a story that actually makes you curious about why the martians and earthlings hate eachother.  I don't think I ever really found out besides there was a war or something, but I hope there's more (otherwise the backstory sucks and needs some filling out).  Edit:Previous Review, Jun 23, 2014I currently recommend SINGLE PLAYER for this game. While there is a multiplayer function, the lag is terrible on servers of size >6. As for single player story mode.Great game, especially for being in alpha. No major bugs that I found, but at the same time not everything is working yet, which is to be expected. The scanner is the only real pain right now as minerals don't always show up. Combat is as expected, though a first person view would be great for those tighter areas. The story is engaging as I'm trying to solve the internal human problems as well as slowly imagining a history for the alien species. The graphics are amazing, even on low settings, and while there are very different regions, they transition smoothly.

								I shall tell you a tale. The tale of a man that was minding his own ♥♥♥♥ing buisness. That man was me, I was wondering far and wide in search of many differant minerals. Along my travels I met one of the many inhabitants of this female only occupied planet (planet Lesbiana, quadrant 69bj), and we set off in search of gold, along the way slaying many a beast. Silently laying in wait just out of my render distance sat a great horror one that strikes fear into even the bravest of neckbeards. I roamed closer not any the wiser of what prison shower♥♥♥♥♥♥scene that was about to take place. When IT it rendered in ,The Giant Space♥♥♥♥♥♥Robot from Space began to stand, I ran as fast as my skinny futuristic weakling legs would carry me, but it was to late, I and my partner were blown away in a volley of 10 or so rockets and one accurate laser blast. I layed there plotting whether I should call the cops and report♥♥♥♥♥♥or just go to therapy for a few years.  10/10 would drop the soap and get♥♥♥♥♥♥♥again.In all honesty it is a great game. All great games have problems at the start , for me the adressable ones are having to leave and rejoin the server in multiplayer and friends not being able to pick you up, in the build servers you need an infinite amount of items not like 1000 items each because if lets say you want to use a model someone made of a jet or one of the bigger models its uses up pretty much all of those items. One thing this game seriously needs very bad is a party system that overlays on to your screen and not just on the map, similar to Arma 3 wastelands party system. With just my short time playing this i enjoyed it alot, but be wary its still in alpha so it will have problems. Great game even in alpha state.

content:
Posted: March 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								      This is a game I have been waiting for. If you have ever played Starwars Galaxies this game has almost the same feeling along with many other elements. You are free to explore an open world filled with interesting creatures and terrain. You are also free to create what you want. Along with a block based building system similar to Minecraft the world uses voxel terrain where you can mold the land around you into any shape. You can even create caves with smooth walls rather than the blocky nature we find now in many other sandbox survival games.       Besides the normal building system, you can create your own weapons, items, and vehicles. The crafting system is not a simple customization screen, you actally have to build your items from scratch. Although the creation system is tricky at first once you get the hang of it, it is quite simple. There is also a rich story line which I only scratched the surface of since I tend to lean towards the multiplayer side of the game. The only downside is the game is still incomplete, but that is to be expected since the game is still in development.   I Highly recommend this game if you want the freedom to do what you want then this is the game for you. I give this game a 10/10 due to its great potential and player freedom.

content:
Posted: July 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								Lot's of PotentialThis game has been on my wishlist for a while and I finally picked it up during the Summer Sale. I have been playing in Story mode, so that it was this review will focus on.The graphics are 50/50 for me on this game. On the one hand, you have beautiful ditant scenery that you can actually go to. On the other hand, you'll walk over plants that are flat and seem to follow the camera. The character graphics are fine, but nothing that wowed me.The gameplay is similar to Minecraft (a favorite game of mine) in that you will need to dig for ores and then craft items out of them. The mining aspect is interesteing in that sometimes you'll have to dig out an area. You can't just mine straight through. [Also, if you want to go spelunking, make sure you have a rope gun. Otherwise, if you don't dig a gently sloping tunnel down to the caves, you'll need to dig one to get out or fast travel.]The quest system is what you would expect. Go to an NPC. Talk. Get quest. Complete quest. Get reward. The one area that I would like to see improvement in is the Designing area. The item designer is not user friendly and can be difficult to figure out. The one thing that I think would vastly improve this area is the ability to select and move pieces that you have placed. Additionally, it would be nice for there to be some basic designs available to the player already. Not everyone wants to go in and design a car.If you get the chance, pick this game up. It's got a great foundation of gameplay and should only get better.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												Planet Explorers is a fun survival, rpg, build, managment and fight game.PE got a lot of genres mixed in and gives the player the choice of how he wants to play. You can play the singeplayer story, what can take a lot of time, play the sandbox or build mode or try out the advanture mode even with friends (but be sure that your hard drive got enough free space).If you like to explore big worlds, build stuff (weapons, armors, vehicles, buldings and if you like even a WC) fight monsters like the teenage mutant ninj... no not ninja... but mutatet fur sure.... turtles... this game could be for you but expect that this game would need more ressources thant you would belive.Pros:you can dig holes.... almost everywhere!able to build your own stuff (design it in the creator, you could even make you a "steve costum"!Abillity to have your very own colony and trains! (i love trains!)I mentitioned that you can build vehicles, but did i told ya that you can build helicopters, cars, ships and submarins!fighting creatures tha remind you of dinosaurs, godzilla and dragons (well i would say its a mix of a dragon and a chicken...)very big worldsSup. Team (and devs) respond quite fast and they care 'bout the gameCons:Big worlds need a lot of space! (and i mean a lot... like something around multiple 100 gigs)performance issues with big colonies AI companions that like to scare the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of you (just spawning right in front of your face!)graphics aren't that good, so if you someone who needs perfect visuals i'm sad to inform you that this game can't do you right, don't get my wrong, its beautiful (this is only a - if you are fixated on high end graphics)The creator alows much freedome but sometimes just turns you crazy (the recoloring is a real hassle)All in all, i would recomand this game if the pros are your thing.PS: i'm sorry for every spelling and gramatical error in my review

number of helpful: 10 of 22 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 14, 2016
												BEWARE - If you will potentially want a refund (which you likely will) If you attempt to play multiplayer, despitethe fact you more than likely wont get it working port forwarding or no, when you quit the game leaves a process running in the background and continues to count as being played by steam. So even though we only loaded it up and tried to get a multiplayer server going a couple times; it sais we have played for over 15 hours each making a refund more difficult. Make sure when you quit you lookin task manager for the process and end it manually.Now my experience from playing on my mates account (what drove me to misguidedly buy it in the first place)1. The item creation is really cool, played around making my friend items on his computer, however being able to make your own items is the only good part of this game and once you see the game itself, even this is lacking.1.1 the item creater looks extensive however it is missing core parts which effectively mean that items you will find in game will be better than what you can create anyway. eg, you can get 2H melee weapons in game, you cannot make 2H weapons in the creator. You can get many different 1H hilts in game, but can only use the first 3 low tier ones in creator.this put a massive dampening on the only good part of the game.2. Graphically it is uninspiring and extremely dated, which I can excuse if the gameplay was fun.3. The gameplay is not fun, starting out doing the very first quest in adventure mode and I got swamped by about 8 NPC humanaoid enemies which hit like trucks and you basically cannot damage. Sure, you can kite them around for half an hour shooting them with your rubberbands (bow) or hitting them with your wet tissue (sword), but it isnt fun.3.1 combat is woeful, despite being able to double tap to dodge, dodging does exactly nothing for you.4. Audio, The sound is quite calming and nice which is a good thing and likely designed to stop you raging at game mechanics.5. Multiplayer, the "multiplayer" basically does not work,we tried creating a private server with port forwarding set correctly and noone could see the servers, regardless of which one of us set it up. You can create it via a proxy server based god knows where and then 90% of the game mechanics are broken by the latency. eg die (because the first NPC you talk to in town spawns about 15 high level mobs with firearmswhile you haven't even made a wood bow) and then cannot respawn, BUT you can drive your nameplate around ....6. As mentioned, when attempting to make a server it created a background process which does not exit when you exit the game, racking up hours and preventing an easy refund.I have a suspiscion that this is intentional because there is no way in hell this game is in release standard.7. The environments are boring and extremely vast nothingnesses, games liek 7 days  to Die also have this but the environment still feels alive and dangerous somehow, not so here.8. The AI, should just be renamed A.I could go on, however in summary; I had quite a bit of enjoyment creating items to use in game which I could copy from my mates computer easily enough, however that is the end of the fun in this game, there are soooooo many bugs, features that down work and lack luster mechanics that it is obvious this game is still in alpha or EA.It is definately not in release. or worth ~$30 asking price, to expand - this is I tihnk the only comment I have made on steam in the many years and games (even ones I regret buying) that i have asked for a refund.

number of helpful: 10 of 22 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								A few things that give this game alot of potential as a open world sandbox game is;ability to design your own weapons, items, and vehicles. This is what sets the game from all other games that allows for crafting and open world sandbox. You can choose to build the ingame items or upload/create items of your own. decent crafting treedevs are coming out with a world editor that allows you build your own world and populate it as you see fitthe storyline questing is decent enough to get you started into the game before you choose to go into adventure mode and strike it out on your own. But  what I dislike about the game;very awkward User interface. it takes more clicks than it needs to craft or perform certain functions such as scanning. The devs said they are working on this and hope to release a new UI in the next month or two so we'll seeLacks a true vibrant multiplayer environment. Most of the multiplayer servers are empty. And even if you do find a decent one, you can be subject to griefing because there is currently no way to protect your stuffThere's no sense of challenge or purpose. I get that it's open world sandbox and the only agenda is the one you set.However it feels boring just logging on and killing creatures and building stuff. The game needs more conflict.documentation needsdespite special effects such as damage dealing effects are non existent and needs to be improved upon. Other than a little green bar at the top, you don't know if you're doing damage. Positioning around the NPC can feel awkward as well.Aside from building stuff and killing creatures, there just isn't enough motivation or purpose to playing the game.  It needs more players on the multiplayer servers as well. I will review this game in another month or two and update my review.

number of helpful: 10 of 22 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 23, 2015
Early Access Review
								First of, this is a great game. Just the jetpack-glider combination alone, is almost worth the buying price (use the jetpack to gain altitude, then glide around the game world. lots of fun).Furthermore there's an interesting storyline, and it's a builder game, where you can build all kinds of things, even your own colony, and inhabit it with npcs, that you can recruit from the various story areas.Also, the game is still in development, so from time to time, new content become available, such as more main story, more gameworld, more build or npc options, and so on.But there lies the biggest issue, from my perspective: The updates.As each time a new update comes around, your savegame is no longer working.The devs usually give out a savegame, so you can continue the storyline, from where it stopped last, which is okey, but it's just not good enough.If you spend 40+ hours playing the game and building stuff, having to start all over each time there is an update, gets old REAL fast.And for me, that is the deal breaker. Until savegames can be used from update to update, I will not recommend this game.

								I'll keep this short and sweet:Pros: Voxel editor is funMost of everything works as intendedDigging/mining works as it should usually.Excellent sandboxCons:Very silly/shallow storyMain map is based around story modeDevs are putting out about two updates a year, maybeUpdate is generally related to the story that nobody cares aboutVoxel editor is clunky interface wiseImporting textures is too much of a hassle, same with making custom voxels for the editor.Custom weapons are nrealy impossible to make equal to the pre-made weapons w/o looking like silly blocksMelee combat is clunkyAll guns feel like watergunsHaving too many voxel objects (10+) makes the game lag/crash even on a high end rigTL;DR Devs are focused on the wrong stuff, when they care about the game at all. They should have dropped the story mode and made a planet generator along with spaceships.A shining example of why not to buy Early Access games.

number of helpful: 7 of 16 people (44%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								You know, I don't understand the comments haters seem to possess for this game. I mean, because it is playable, you seem to think that it has to be finished on your own time. It is in ALPHA not BETA. When a game is in the ALPHA stage, it is still being designed and littered with bugs and glitches. Some games can take much longer than the designers plan to be completed, you know. Plus, the game designers have their own lives to deal with, along with this game's development. I mean, they could have family members dying, or their wives could be pregnant, etc. Considering that this game has sooooo much potential, you guys should be more patient. On a more positive note, I would give this game a 9.5/10. It has a ton of potential and, once all the bugs and glitches are fixed, I truly believe this game could become one of the best games of the year. I mean, it is games like this that make the video gaming industry so successful. So please, please guys, be more patient. I feel as though I can almost guarantee that the wait will be worth it. P.S. One of the few problems that I have with this game is the name of the planet. "Maria" is such a boring name and I feel that it could be better. And if the name was chosen because the designers couldn't come up with a better name, I bet I could think up some good names. Just a thought...

								Was not The game I thought it would be. Still a decent game. I suggest having a high end performance laptop, or else the game will be slow and painful for you. number of helpful: 6 of 14 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								There is a lot of potential in this game.However at this point in development, it's just that, potential.The only reason why this game is getting a "Not recommended" is because the timing on everything is off. From the amount of time it takes to gather resources to the animations of the creatures and NPCs.I could see myself making some really cool creations in this game, but I can't bring myself to spend the hours to gather all the resources needed to do so. So I then tried the build mode that gives you infinite resources from the very begining and found myself getting bored of building because it took too long to do a simple flat diagonal bridge over a small crevasse (something like 20+ minutes).The way how the building works is really cool with the options to expand on the XYZ planes before placing the blocks you want. However, due to the constraints of the camera, I found I could only build outwards/upwards so far before I would have to reposition myself for a better view of what I was working on. The process than became: build a little then move a little and repeat until done.I'd like to see different sized blocks that I could place as the current size can be VERY small when working on anything larger than a small shack (and even then I found myself doubling up on the wall thickness because I felt a single block wide wall looked like a couple sheets of plywood stuck together).As far as the story section goes, my only comment would be to do away with the voice acting as sometimes it seems out of place, like the voice actors were distracted while reading their lines. Otherwise I found the missions/quests to be very entertaining and fun.Overall, I'd say pass on this for now and wait for the game to become more fleshed out. It's interesting and visually impressive AND the terra forming is superb. But, the amount of time you spend on creating anything will try your patience as it can feel like you're building because you HAVE to and not because you want to as well as you'll feel like you're fighting the camera to get anything done.
