The questline is horribly bugged, and it is unlikely that you will be able to get though it at all.The game is in more of an alpha state. There are major parts of the game that are currently not accesible.

content:
Posted: September 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								First off, id like to note that this game has incredible potential, i can only imagine how amazing it would be at a complete stage(thats assuming it will ever get there). One of my main frustrations is the lack of attention the devs are putting into their own creation. Yes i payed to support development, and whether or not they continue is their choice. Im proud of my decision because i feel that im supporting a great idea. I was pitched a game that promises much and does deliver, however here are some things that i do find detremintal to gameplay.-Poor Mechanincs-Lack of Unique Enviroments-Terrible Ai programming(hopefully in the future i can interact with all intelligent npcs in several ways, creating a real feeling rpg. I want my actions to be reflected in game. It would be great if aliens did more than just walk a few steps and then unintelligently try to persue me(they usually just get stuck behind rocks)-MULTIPLAYER DEV. For the love of god, this game deserves more multiplayer development. I want to explore the world with friends and random players, i want a unique world that punishes you and rewards you because of your actions (such as players who become anarchists or those who follow colony rules) which brings me to another topic-Colonies: You place a few tents and one or two bungalows and call that a colony? Please make this feel like a sci-fiction game. Give me colony police, factions, trade markets, anything to make it feel like an "RPG". Create background stories for the multiplayer, smart AI that can use vehicles and scout the land. Add small cities, maybe even a nice military branch you could join in which you raise in rank and can possibly explore other worlds(Just and idea).Make it feel like a Sci-fi game-Lack of replayablity: The survival mode is really needs some work, it doesnt feel difficult, especially when i have to find other aliens to have some action. A few random search parties and attacks on my locations would be nice. Destroyable buildings would be nice as well, as once i hide i am pretty much safe for the rest of eternity.-fix the vehicles: Poor mechanics, easily damaged.Overall the game provided entertainment but not for long. I quickly realized that planet explorers was unfortunately boring and not worth the money i payed. I hoped that my money would atleast bring me great updates to enjoy, but the developers  are making slow and low quality updates that dont really make the game any different.So, i do not recommend you buy this game for any reason other than for a future version that gives more playable content. In other words, dont buy it in its current state.

content:
Posted: April 6
												Hours on record at the time of reviewing - 172.5Planet Explorers has been a ton of fun, and I have racked up 120 nerd hours since picking it up after full realease. Consistent, addictive, great map design with Maria (Main Story map). You can appreciate the detail and thought that went into making the VIP Colonists roles (Botanists, geologists, zoologists, bacteriologists, miners, security) Keeping in mind what sort of new or unknown viruses may be present in the that new planet. Seems to me pretty up to par when a real planetary colonization effort would take place in a distant future. Good variety of ISO's, the freedom to craft whenever and wherever you want and with a good and steady growing community uploading their creations if crafting is not your thing and rather spend more time playing, building and progressing.There is enough content, gameplay hours and sandboxing in Story Mode to make up for the flaws that that need some correcting in Adventure Mode, which are the following:• Adventure mode still feels bland, lacking content and not up to par with what is found in Story Mode, not really delivering those same dramatic landscapes and backdrops. Feels like it could be delivering a lot more, the randomly generated maps have a lot of imperfections (Terrain leveling, roads that go into the water, high-level monster spawnings where you're just starting out. • The Dungeons in Adventure Mode feel bland, linear, lacking some polishing, same layouts often found, the monsters in there are just the same wildlife found anywhere else on the map and not even following a theme of which biomes each are found, but rather mixed in together. On a more positive side, there are things found in adventure mode that would like to see in the other modes:• The unique building models that would save us some time when builing a colony and placing the already built structures to house colonists and shops for vendors. • The road network between colonies/towns.Overall I'm looking forward to the remaining gameplay I got, taking my sweet time with progressing the story, while building and exploring along the way. I feel like my initial investment back when the game was in early alpha was a good investment in the hopes of having a good finished product delivered in full-release and with updates/builds still coming in, and will most deffinitely support Pathea in further development and future DLC/Expansions for this game, I see it as a mint product that with the right new updates and content it has the potential to go far and have a long life and growing community.Thanks Pathea!

number of helpful: 3 of 8 people (38%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game sets a standard for an EAG that will raise the bar to a height other game makers will come to curse this ones dev team for to be certain.This game also may imo be the MMO killer. For a long time now Ive been frustrated with the transient nature of MMO and how they can be shut down and taken from we the players. City of Heroes was the last straw for me and since then although I missed MMO for many things.The sense of a perpetual ever evolving world.A game made up of more players then just me and a few friends.Virtually unlimited evolution of ones own character.These things can now all be found here in this game. And in a setting that will feel very familiar to fans of space colonization stories like that of Dragons Dawn in the dragon riders of Pern series.This is a game that needs our support my fellow gamers. Its already solid enough to enjoy playing and developing skill with the item creation tools. I found a design online for a simple copper sword that surpassed all my own attempts and left me imagining how in a very real sense that items creator made something that may well in time come to be used or built upon by many gamers to come. You have a chance to start exploring new worlds, being the adventurer you want to be, and engineering tools to survive that will make MacGuyver , The A-Team, and John Crichton all be proud of.Yes there are flaws, the story modes quest line still ends suddenly, and can be buggy enough at times especially involving NPCs and pathing that you may need to reload abit back now and then. But it is EAG after all some stuff is bound to be WIP right?Most seem to favor the adventure mode or just outright build mode. I actually have played through the story mode a few times, the time to get through whats there varies widely based on how much you like to explore, harvest, craft etc. Trying to find rarer rescources can stretch that out even more.But I find it a good extended tutorial you might say, to keep replaying as I for example didnt do alot beyond basic tool crafting my first play through, my second I found some great designs on a few sites and made a potent copper sword and a wooden sports car to cruise the land with, these sped up my ability to get through some of the story encounters quite easily and cross the landscape with a furious speed that once had me thelma and louise it off a cliff one dark night. Lesson learned dont over drive you headlights on an alien landscape or in any unknown area especially for that matter. Granted I was being chased by some alien monsters but I probably could of stopped and and taken them down so welll yeah.Anyways love this game, need to buy more copies for my friends when I can. You should check it out if you like sandbox adventure and crafting and the like. good times to be had I swear.

content:

Early Access Review
								Im gonna be as fair as I can with this seeing as there 2 sidesI understand there is problems going on with the game and some people dont have the paitence or the time to deal with them I get that.Heres what i think is good:The creation system is pretty fun i enjoyed time with my friends fighting with our custom weapons and vechile i understand some people dont have that creative edge which is why the workshop is greatWide variety of animals to fight and aliens my favorite being the giant spider thing during story mode got me invested in the creation system.Buildings are ok building forts and fighting with friends was great but I agree it needs a little work.Progress seems slow on development but if you look at the changelogs the devs are working really hard it took them a long to make A.09 but within the time they made that they did all these hotfixes that were really nice.The bad and ways to make up for them:Graphics can be rathering annoying i get that and most people dont wanna turn them down and if you do they tend to look horrible what I reccomend is first making sure you have a updated flash then if its still bad custom of it using custom graphics you can make it look nice and still work for your computer you just have to work at itOre mining is see alot of complaints about this one people having a pain finding ore and then getting to it I reccomend making a cheap speedy buggy wink wink creation system and just ride around scanning for ore youll find what you need and even then what you dont just mark it then when it comes to mining navigate with the scanner best you can to stand over it your gonna need a rope gun just dig straight down dont worry the lava wont get you then mine wherver you see a weird shaped rocks and your bound to rack up a lot of ore (I reccomend going for a gold pickaxe as quick as possible so your most efficient with the ore)Final problem and one I can really really understand people hating is the random save deletion devs updates I think are causing this cause theres so many changes to the world you cant work with that file no fix to this and i hope the devs do something about it in the future.Overall I beleive its a game well worth the time best to play with friends but well worth it I enjoyed it my Friends enjoyed it. I dont care if you dont like it please just dont write a negative review with .1 hrs on the game like some people

content:
Posted: February 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								I really liked this game in the beginning, played about 17 hrs worth.  Decided to reinstall recently and see how it is coming along,  but after recent patches the game has become frustrating to play for two reasons:Keybinds- Certain keys can no longer be changed, this is a big issue as I use EDSF instead of WSAD.  Unfortunately E is Interact and can't be changed.  Be aware you may not be able to change keybinds to what you want.Hitching- I can run the game in Fantastic setting with 60-100 fps but every minute or two I get this half a second hitch where the screen sorta freezes. My current suggestion is wait longer before getting this game.  If the dev team can correct the keybind and hitching issue I'd love to give the game a try again.  They have added a lot of really nice elements to the game, I just find it unplayable in the current state.

content:
Posted: September 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								Have you ever used heroin? It's like a trip into an alternate universe where you don't have to think about how badly you've ♥♥♥♥ed up your life, or how badly ♥♥♥♥ed up you are against your will. I've spent a lot of time doing a lot of drugs, and everyone I know always wonders why I'm not as outwardly happy or outgoing as I was back then. I don't have the heart to tell them that by quitting the drugs that were killing me, I no longer have any desire to talk to them or spend time with them. Sometimes I do genuinely enjoy the company of others, but it is generally while highly inebriated and then in the morning my anxiety comes back tenfold, and i struggle to make it home before the panic attacks start. Maybe one day a game like this could be fully fleshed or interesting enough to hold my interest for more than a few minutes. Maybe i'm describing Second Life, and that game was an absolute catastrophe. Maybe it's the other way around, and life would be better if i could stray too far from home and be devoured by a gigantic terrifying monster. I would feed this creature, and it would live longer, and I would have been given a form of purpose, for at least some time.

If you are on the fence, spend your money on something else.Developers who would rush past the Alpha stage and immediately push to release are absolute garbage. This is a prime example of why Early Access games should be regulated and frequent patches should be enforced until a viable product is produced.

content:
Posted: July 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								I played this game a lot. And still i don`t know if it is good or not. It has a potential. If you buy this you will enjoy a big world, custom equipment and ships and lot of other stuff. The main issue are udpates. Very rare and you need to wait long... They are big though. Second thing which made me really nervous is DIGGING. Yup. I have shovel.... wooden, stone, iron, steel etc... And still. Digging is pain in the♥♥♥♥♥ When you want to build underground tunnel network, better give up. I tried, lost almost six hours and what? You cannot place rail pivot, obstacle. (there was none, maybe some pixel big crunch... Minor error. Still so annoying...)Second thing is fuel. To maintain your base you need coal, to generators. Nothing else because it won`t work... (Still we can have small solar panel to charge batteries AND we have petrol... Maybe some gas deposists could be added or uranium...) Neverthless...Warning for potetntial buyers!- Wait to see how the updates flow, when they speed up then... Buy on your own risk. - When you don`t like the risk... Buy similar game: Space Engineers. - For now THIS game is storaged in my library... Wiaitng for some major update.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								the devs are aciively working on it, and it is a fine game, with a singleplayer and everything, check out my screenshots. it has a great mechanical physics engine other games don't, you can literaly DESIGN moving machines. that fly , drive, boat etc.. it's fairly insane on the crafting department if you go in depth. That being said patch 81a broke the game for my rig, but i'm building a new rig this week, so i look forward to it. if you want to play ABOVE low graphics get 970/r9-290x + and a good i5, or a 8600+AMD because this is a MONSTER on voxels. it doesn't just map the viewed terrain it maps entire cave systems, under ground water ways, a world of actively tracked monsters. When you can play it on MAX it's gorgeous. the devs are active and they are dedicated, but instead of putting out ♥♥♥♥♥♥ patches every 2 days, they complete entire segments of the games function per alpha patch, this sometimes leads to patches being a month+ apart, but the changes are usualy MASSIVE fixes and content. I HATE minecraft, I hate ARK, i hate all those kinds of games, especialy when they shove MP down your throat. Planet Explorers is genuinely a masterpice being made, it's just rough right now, and still alpha. no other survival explorer world game has gone as in depth or included a REAL storyline with NPC deviations and freedom. it's literaly a planet sized planet to explore. When completed the growth for content in the SP campaign will be mammoth, as well as the servers and custom worlds people run now. I've owned this game nearly a year, don't expect it to be done soon. But when it is done, expect it to be awe inspiring

content:
Posted: March 17
												This game has unexpextedly been alot of fun. I originally did not have much hopes for this title after my first experience. (about 1 year ago) since the new updates the game has much more to offer. Likes:*Craft anything without haveing hours of farming due to the ingame currency system with the npc's IE if you dont want to go collect coal, kill monsters then trade the hide for currency! and buy what you need.*True terra form in a easy to use system that makes sense!*Great voice acting for all major npc quests!*A rather large world to explore*Build anywhere! *Easy to understand UI and hot bar*Really compelling story mode that keeps you going.Cons*Graphics are not the best*Development seems slow (however they are updating again!)*Random clipping issues (no as bad as Subnautica though!) LOLOverallGood game with tons of potential, have spent alot of my time recently enjoying this game. ps the riding system for the aliens makes sense, good work Devs, for a crew with a limited budjet its a great overall game.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 20, 2015
Early Access Review
								Ok..  This game is great.  And my family loves it.  The crafting is awesome and the environment is great.  I wish I could say the same for LAN multiplayer.  It is riddled with bugs.  I don’t know how internet multi player works (because we have to use satellite and it eats my my monthly bandwidth) but it has to be better.  The LAN multi player must have an internet connection.  And it is a lot of work to get it to work.  But when we did get our computers to connect with one another the problems continued.  I usually could not see my friends character.  And when I could they were not in the location where I saw them.  There screen would show them in one place and I would see them in another.  And when they would run I would see their character spinning around and jumping and such but they would stay in one place.  They have a lot of network bugs to work out.  There are still alot of other bugs and they seem to be working on them with regular updates.  Which is far better than some developers.  But I guess that is what Early Access is about.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20, 2015
Early Access Review
								Do you like running for hours? Have you ever wanted to jus run and run and runandrunandrun for the first 3+ hours of a game?Do you enjoy the lack of satisfaction upon completing a mission?Do you enjoy complex controls?Do you enjoy feeling stupid as the games controls defeat you again and again?Do you enjoy researching games on youtube for hours just to figure out how things work?Do you have alot of free time?Then my friend your in luck, today and today only, this game, one of wonder can be YOURS!For jus the low price of whatever STEAM is selling it for you can OWN your very own, digital copy of Planet Explorers.LIES!! NO!! no lies here folks. Have you ever wanted to play a game that reminded you of the frustraion you had as a young gamer. When you would throw your remote and break it, or even break the console itself!Those days can be your again my friend.  For the low price of just $__.__(<~~~put your price here) You can own a game youll instantly regret getting for the rest of your life!!!No but seriously, i kno the game is still alpha and it IS a dope game, ANY GAME where u can build cars n helicopters. (like banjo kazooie nuts and bolts????) yes like banjo kazooie nuts and bolts. is dope, however i did find myself getting jus so angry with this game, which is funny cuz im so not an angry guy lol. the last time i got mad at a GAME i was like 9 haha. i would reccomend the game, even if it pisses you off youll still enjoy it. i just hate the way it feels like warcraft, like jus way too open n i dunno boring? like spore? the terrain for me is like that. oh whats that? theres monsters raiding the camp? (looks around) not a single monster. Start running.and im all about travelling within reason, but if i start the game, and have to auto run for 20mins in the first 10 15 mins of gameplay....yea that so totally destroys my hard on for this game. BUT on a lighter note, buy it, so im not the only one stuck in hell. i need help. and a friend.BTW, let my wife play this last night, and yea....nothing like your significant other showing you up on a video game, the whole time im jus like, WHY IS THIS HAPPENING, basically the game played smoothly for her. she was able to actually have events trigger, which did not happen on my save....Women.

								i found this game extremely dull. for one point, there is no "exploring" you walk in a plane for 30 minutes and see the same stuff over and over again. not only that but when you get killed by an aggressive creature, you have to wait about 2 minutes for it to walk away and leave you alone, otherwise you would be killed by the same thing six times in a row. i havent found any landmarks, or any special locations, and i walked for quite a while. i more recently started in a spawn location surrounded by unclimbable mountains. onto the price, i spent $15 on this game and i was disappointed, if i had played some sort of demo before i bought it, i would not have even thought of purchasing this game, even for $10.    either way, bad game or not, it is a pretty one. this game has a wide variety of creatures, many of which i havent seen. and the foliage is quite pretty too. there are many harvestable plants, which are used for crafting and trading.    the quests in the story are very annoying.in conclusion, i despise of this game, i think it is overpriced and repetetive, the quests compare to a free MMO, back and forth, kill ten of this collect four of these, craft a torch that takes you forever to find animals for. i think this game is bad. i understand it is in early access, but these are things that are at the core of the game, not things like glitches. i want my $15 back. and i would rather play everquest. i did not enjoy this game at all, i tried to like it, honestly, but all i saw was a mmo.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is good, but has some bad.  I will write my thoughts...  I am a bit tired and out of it, so ignore my writing errors for the time being and take it as a persons opinion who played about 10 hours and generally liked the game.If you dont read on and are considering buying the game, I say give it a shot and invest your time and money in this game and the creators of the game.  I think this game is inspiring and has potential and is a nice break from full-on squares that you might find in them there vox gamez... yikes, already losing insperation to write.Overall personal rating on this game at 10 hours or so of playing: 6.75 / 10Bad: I know so many people can pick away at this game, so dont be sold on the bad, just take it as opinion and know that the game does have some issues and need some tuning, but is still pretty cool.The graphics are a bit strange, kinda hard to put my finger on, but they are not typical or extra cool right from the start. I would like the game more if it played and felt more like Skyrim, but with it's original concept focused into an RPG open world sci-fi creation/sandbox experience.  Speech of characters could use some work.  Boundaries and other limitations can be somewhat annoying.  Story line is basically non-existant at first and leads a person to play the game purely for the creative aspects.  None of the characters are at all concerned about crashing, the crew, their lives or anything else in what feels like would really be happening.  If this game started off at an astroid and you joined the crew of a ship and got to know the people before crashing, it would improve the game, build interest in specific characters and make a person care about wanting to establish a life on a planet after crashing.  This game feels like a 'prototype game' in that it will end up being dropped by most players who find a game or game company who decides to add some basic things that are no in this game.  Paying with meat is weird to a certain extent, I know there has to be a better option...  I dont have that answer right now but when you are walking around with 1,400 meats on ya... I mean.. that would be pretty crazy and heavy and stinky.   combat is not coded to well, it feels very vintage in its abilities.  Take games like Mass Effect and other 3rd person view games that the combat was not absolutely perfect but it was still fun and at least do that.    The controls are aweful for the most part,  I mean, this is a big issue for me as I am an old gamer and have felt the controls of many many many games and there is just so much that could have been done to make controling the character more fluid.  Good:If you are looking to customize your game play and the time behind the controls of a character, this game is something that you may want to check out.  If you like the idea of building, designing and customizing a life in an alien enviornment well here it is.  I enjoy running around and being able to 'live off the land'.  I like earning my way through this game in somewhat of a progressive manor.  You start off near a crashed life boat type ship and than its up to you to figure out what to do and become something more.  I think I could write better story lines (because thats actually one of my trades) but I see lots of potential as this game goes on and I am excited to play it, play it again and master it before rendering a complete evaluation.  I usually know pretty quick whether a game is going to totally lose its ability to interest me or if it will just take a lot of work, and because of the creative aspects, it is hard to say where it is going.  Lots of time can be wasted playing this game, so you have to have your own goals for your character and what is going on.  Do you want to build a house or fort or create tech to be able to create something bigger and more advanced?  well,  you should plan that ahead and stick to it.

								This is my first review and I thought I would give my input. This game has great potential, Big time I cannot wait to see what the future holds. The PC Scanner "Allows you to see where resources are" in a 3D grid like I have never seen really cool, also the fully custom skins for your items you can make and when I say custom I mean it full range creativity. If you don't get this game now that is fine but at least watch to see what it becomes if they play their cards right it will be a show stopper

content:
Posted: May 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is a great game, for any who like minecraft, terraria or other games like that, this is a great pick. Multiplayer and adventure mode are pretty empty and bland but its only in an early stage of development so thats to be expected, the story mode, however, while nothing to special is still great but mostly consists of petty fetch quests but i doubt theyll stay like that.but were the game stands out the most is the deep building system. Teraforming is a bit buggy still and buildings are simple to make with the deep build mode system. its not that different from minecraft but instead just a retexture of different tools for different materials you can design your own. its a simple to learn but complex to master system that really works well right now with few bugs (that ive encountered). plus it has much content and more frequent updates than Starforge.

number of helpful: 25 of 53 people (47%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								I honestly have no idea why this game gets such great reviews. It's an Early Access game, but the last time I saw it was a year ago. To say it's improved would be a gross overstatement.First off, optimization sucks. I have a rig that can run most AAA games with ease on full. I've tried all of the rendering options, and no matter what I do, the game absolutely slows to a 10 fps crawl even when I'm the only living thing on a small, barren island. It's not like the game looks good or anything, it's pretty basic.The world generation is terrible and very frequently I've seen trees and boulders sticking out of the sides of islands. Along with that I've fallen out of the game world twice in 20 minutes.The UI is clunky and the controls are terrible. It gives you the illusion of having two control schemes only for one to just flat out not work and you're forced to work with its default awful WoW-type interface that tries to be both an MMO and Minecraft, but is bad at both. The animations are buggy and I've frequently been moonwalking underwater. Chatting with other players is difficult and a huge pain. Some hotkeys, like holstering your item, just flat out don't work. Also, the HUD is useless in informing you if you've taken any damage or are undergoing any effects.Honestly, I haven't gotten far into the game, only an hour or so with half in SP and half in MP, but I feel like I've played all I need to know that this game's not worth it, at least not right now.Say all you want about how it's an Early Access game, but the truth of the matter is, at the time of this writing, from what I've played, this game barely passes as an alpha. It's riddled with bugs, is unpolished as hell, and has quality worse than most free games out there. I came in expecting a 3D Starbound sandbox and got just another stagnant, buggy as hell Early Access game. Don't buy it.

number of helpful: 22 of 47 people (47%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								In it's current Alpha state, I would not recommend this game... yet. It still needs a lot of work. My biggest peeve when playing was the length of time it took to do... anything. The day/night cycle is too long (one minute is about 5 seconds), the movement of the character is slow (even running), and the controls are clunky and poorly executed. I think this game has great potential, but it still needs a lot of work. The crafting of ISO's and buildings is an excellent idea, I just wish it was simpler to use. Also there is not much help from the game. No tips on what to do during a quest, no journal or log to keep track of plants/wildlife/materials/etc, definitely not much help when crafting. Another thing that really bothered me was knowing what I could and couldn't interact with and selecting those certain things. it took way too long for me to figure out what plants I could harvest and to even harvest them. It felt like no position or amount of clicking around said plant would help me harvest it. acquiring resources is a real drag. I'm stuck on a quest from an AI in the game that requires me to find 30 pieces of copper and 5 pieces of tin. It's freaking impossible to mine quickly and there's no distinction between minerals in the terrain. I've  acquired all kinds of minerals from terrain that looks the same. Which brings me to the world itself... it's pretty boring. The first mission in the story requires you to escort two companions to a camp, but nothing attacks you or delays you. you just run there.... talk about anti-climactic! Anyway, the world itself needs more life. The graphics are okay. The lighting and shadowing is well done, some of the plants look fine, but the grass.... it's literally everywhere and it looks bad. Well that's about it for the negative stuff. There are positives to this game though. It has potential to be great and I know once the delevopers consider our feedback as a community this game will be polished pretty nicely. Until then, I would say buy at your own risk.

content:

Early Access Review
								Aside from the expected Early Access wonkiness Planet Explorers unfortunately runs into the same trap a lot of similar 'Minecraft BUT MORE' games fall into, which is to ditch the intuitive Lego-ish building in favor of something more akin to a  3D modeling suite. I wish it all the best because it's so exciting on a conceptual level but unless the game part of the finished product ends up wildly compelling (right now it's like a wonky and lonely MMO) it's just really hard to recommend spending your time learning how to build stuff in this over doing the same in Blender or UDK (both of which are free to mess with) and picking up some useful skills along the way.

number of helpful: 130 of 269 people (48%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								Quick Review as of 0.75 Alpha. If it's a game being sold, it's a game i'm going to review.--Pros:Large Open WorldSandbox gameCraftingAlien AnimalsNice water--Cons / needs to be improved:Clunky Controls.No first person view *** CORECTION** THERE IS FIRST PERSON. World has no atmosphere, as in no life, nothing happening.Poor textures. Poor graphics. (Too much bloom, strange grass that constantly waves, no FOV slider)Poor animationsPoor combatPoor UI, especially when building ISOs. Feels like I need a degree in graphic design to use it.No collision on certain objects, able to walk through them.No tutorial, or help guidePoor character customisation. Poor AILimited DialogueStarting from the top this game features an open world larger than 7 days to die if I judge at a glance. It has grass lands, deserts and forests. Crafting is also included in the game which uses a similar system to starbound if i recall correctly, similar UI as well, nothing much to say apart from it appears to work as expected if you have played starbound or terraria.The controls are poor in my opinion. As you first start the game it requires you to hold the right mouse button and drag to move the camera. Or you can press F2 and have it follow your character as you would expect from a game post year 2005. The problem with this is the UI becomes difficult and you can't interact with anything unless you press and hold tab. So for you to talk to a character I have to hold tab, then right click on the character. If I let go of tab I can't click the dialog options. As you are walking around the world, apart from alien animals wandering around aimlessly the world is empty. It's hard to explain however minecraft also suffered the same problem. No birds or atmospheric sound effects. Nothing really happening in the atmosphere. The textures are poor. They look like they have just stepped out of 2006. There is too much bloom, the grass is horrible and I know they are trying to go for an alien look but it really grinds against my gears. All of the grass waves in front of you for no apparent reason, there is no logic. Apart from the textures at least the colours are good!The animations are fairly bad. You jump 3 metres high, and there is no life in your character it's like moving a robot. This is especially apparent when in combat. I think the character only makes 2-3 animations in the whole combat. You also get a shield which I couldn't work out how to use as it's stuck inside his arm and is smaller than a compact disc.The UI is poor. The ISO designer which lets you build weapons or design vehicles appears at first view like you need a degree in graphic design software. After about 20 mins you start to get the hang of it but personally I gave up because I'm playing a game to have fun, not to make me feel like a designer at work. The UI on 1920x1080 appears very small. I had to put on my reading glasses to see anything. Also The whole layout feels clunky, when talking to people I don't like how you click on the words and how they are 3pt small.The character customisation needs work. Nothing to choose from and the pre-set faces are terrible. You need to add the option to design your own face like sims, as the pre-set faces are the most ugliest I’ve seen to date.The AI is Poor. They walk around turning on their back heel like Michael Jackson, or staring at walls. I was attacked in the starting camp and everyone let me get my♥♥♥♥♥kicked, thanks AI  !At this stage it's absolutely not worth £18.99. For some reason I see people talking it up like it's the best thing since slice bread and WHY?! I am not going to try and pretend it's good so I feel like I got my money’s worth. It's not very good unless you are new to gaming.It's worth £5 on a steam sale. It's an avoid from me. First game I switched off and deleted after an hour.

number of helpful: 5 of 13 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 25, 2016
												I picked up this game early in the EA cycle and almost immeadiately put it down after playing a couple of hours since the initial release was a steaming pile of hot garbage.So I gave it a year or two to gather some steam and put some polish, enough time to pass from alpha to beta.And its still hot garbage.Okay for the usual breakdown:Visuals:Visually Planet Explorers is pretty nice, for what it is and what cycle of development its in it accomplishes a great deal. Character customization is fine, standard fare. Building things is equally detailed and can produce some very amazing things.Sound:Likewise, gets the job done, it's not perfect but its still beta so a few bugs here and there is to be expected.Gameplay:Here is where Planet Explorers still fails.In early alpha the 'fetch' quests had you traversing great distances for the most minor of things. At that time spawners didn't care if you were a veteran or a fresh spawn, you would likely stumble into alien creatures vastly out of your league all for pidly rewards.Beta... they've cleaned it up but they've added more game modes and no documentation. When you now start up the game you can adjust your visuals and get thrown into a starter screen where you pick Story, Adventurer etc etc. NONE OF WHICH are explained. I *imagine* story is the original alpha experience, the crashed ship, the fetch quests etc and so forth so I thought I'd try adventure.The first thing to fail is the fact that you can only take one quest at a time. There's half a dozen in your starter area but you can only take ONE main quest and one side quest. The main quest has you hoofing it a huge distance to a 'settlement', have fun running half an hour back and forth between HUBs to do the other STARTER quests. That's only a guess as the original beautiful world generation is utterly borked in adventure mode. Leaving the starter village required building a set of stairs to reach the floating mountain and the road onwards. Seriously... and its not the only floating mountain, I spawned on a grassy plateau surrounded by water at the bottom of a huge cliff and half a dozen floating mountains.There's no explination of game modes, there's no tutorial to (re)familiarize yourself with how the game works. You spawn and are pretty much up to yourself to figure out how the game works.Like alpha, I played the beta for an hour then uninstalled again.Seriously, I advise all perspective buyers to wait. There's tons of potential here assuming the devs stop taking five steps backwards every time they take one forward. It's great that its optimized and looks pretty but if the functionality is abyssmal it doesn't matter how nice it looks.

content:
Posted: May 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								After a day of playing heres my thoughts.Stay away from multiplayer, just is not there yet. Clipping and other bugs just mean stay away. Single player. This has some hope. the creation system kinda works, still missing a good interface. Kinda suck in the story line, a few key items are missing like wheter to get the petro from. dingging a hole streight down, and you'll be hours trying to get out of it. Wait till you have fast track before you pull this stunt. Cash flow in the game is meat. You can get a giant mob stuck behind rocks and trees to kill off fpr massive paydays. When min ing the pick axe is useless and difficult to use, use the shovel instead it easy and does a great job. Trade marble for meat, and meat for what you want. Over all its like mine craft meets skyrim, except the fun is stripped out. You can build things and yes the mobs can destoy what you build, so make it out of sturdy materials. content:
Posted: March 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								I am sure this game is very fun and innovative but unfortunately for me it is just way to difficult and overwhelming. To explain I tried story mode and had some fun with it for the first few quests...but then the game became WAYYY to difficult WAYYY too quickly. The sheer distance you had to travel from a doctors camp to another quest point was too long and during your travel to this point blood thirsty creatures who are way too tough kill you instantly, even with my gun they were still too difficult. Then another quest took me to some altar where 3 giant bird creatures hovered over it...I died numerous times here but thankfully the game gave you an invincible NPC to follow you with a rifle to help you...so I waited dead for the NPC to kill all 3 of them and the NPC even had trouble cause it took over 20 mins for him to kill 2 of the birds....finally I got up bought some bullets from the NPC and the bird took over 50 bullets to die!!! DXI stuck it out and played a little longer even though my frustration at this point was high from dieing so much, I came to point where a female NPC took me into the creation tool kit to make a vehicle...This creator is not user friendly at all, and the tutorial is skimpy at best. For me I could not figure out how to make a basic car without looking up a guide on youtube. To my knowledge there are no base vehicles either, so that means that you HAVE to build a vehicle otherwise your trapped on foot the entire game.This game is in development so I can't be too hard but it just seems to drop you off in this overwhelming massive world with little instruction to help you out... I am sure if I spent an hour mining materials I would have had a bit easier time since I could have probably made a better weapon, but the game should not be like that at least not so early. The game should not punish you and send you on a "chore run" to mine 100 iron just to kill 3 birds. I say if you are thinking about this game is wait til it is out of development and they address issues.

content:
Posted: February 28
												I bought this game in early release about a year ago but was too busy to play it until recently (late February 2017).  But I kept up with the reviews, and saw a lot of thumbs down for it.  My experience has been the great with the game, and I'm guessing that a lot of players who gave bad reviews jumped right in to story mode.  I did the opposite, I went in to build mode first because I like exploration games, and also because I wanted to see what the game could actually do.  I have played build and adventure mode, but not story mode yet.  Keep in mind this game was billed from the start as an “open world sandbox adventure RPG game,” and I love sandbox games.Build mode:This is the sandbox aspect of the game, and it's fantastic.  The worlds and scenery are utterly gorgeous, and the adventures you can have are enormous.  I jumped in to this first to see what the developers achieved, and it's really nice.  You get all the weapons, some template air/land/water vehicles, turrets, jetpacks-- if it's in the game you get access to it.  Playing this mode first helped me figure out how to use the GUI, controls, and how things worked overall so it was definitely the right move.  Besides being beautiful, it had some nice touches like the music changing with the terrain type.  It was awesome to fly around a helicopter in the desert at night with search lights and then to return to my base by finding my campfires.  I built a quad and tore up the sand, so much fun.Cons of build mode:  As feedback for the developers I would say that while the fun level of build mode is top notch, what made this great experience feel sterile is the fact that you're completely alone.  Not even a single animal.  There were animal sounds by the beach, but no animals.  Bird sounds, but no birds.  It would be a great touch to add some passive animals just for scenery, or to practice one's hunting skills.  The ability to add an NPC follower or something might be nice too, but non-threatening animals I think are a requisite to complete the beautiful picture of nature they have painted.  This solitary player presence affected the replayability of this mode since it gets boring to play around as the only living creature in these huge worlds.Adventure mode:This mode is where you essentially jump in to a map and have choose-it-yourself adventures.  It's the same beautiful scenery, and the seed-generated map I got was the stock planet Maria.  I covered about half of the map and found at least four different kinds of environments so far.  But superimposed on to this grandeur that I saw in build mode was animals, NPCs, and quests (and even dungeons), a nice old school touch that I didn't expect.  In this mode you get the RPG features, like having to gather resources and work the tech trees to advance.  I'm glad I did build mode first so I understood what to do and how things work, which made entering adventure mode even more fun for me.Cons of adventure mode:  I didn't notice too many negatives about this mode, but one that I saw was glaring.  I think there were two difficulty level choices (easy and normal) for adventure mode, so I took easy just to be safe because I wanted to explore it.  Well, some hit-point related things definitely were not easy.  For example, my NPC follower and I were crossing terrain and these two huge birds started to attack us.  A single strike from a bird resulted in the lost of 75% health, not what I would expect on an “easy” setting for sure.  The same was true for entering one dungeon, we got wiped out pretty quick by the NPCs there, so making sure that the easy setting means “go have fun in all areas” should be considered.Miscellaneous:I didn't get the crashes a lot of people reported.  I ran version 1.6 of the game, and I was on a mac mini with 8GB of ram and Intel 4000 graphics.  The game ran very well, with slight lag in the finer special effects but not enough to ruin my enjoyment of the game overall.  I did have a problem with the game consistently loading though.  It would get stuck on the company logo screen and not move on, so I'd have to keep force quitting it and keep trying.  I found a similar “mac loader” problem in the forums so I hope the developers can smooth this out.Summary:Planet explorers is a great game, and top notch exploration game in my opinion.  I logged 35 hours on it in the first 3 days of playing it was so much fun.  While it's no longer in early access, it's still a version 1.x of a very large, intricate, and ambitious game.  I supported the developers in the EA phase because I wanted to see it work, and I have done that for other games like Kerbal Space Program.  So if you expect a finished product out of the box you should stay out of all EA and 1.x release games, but if you want a great game where you can build, explore, quest, and just have fun then Planet Explorers is well worth a look.

content:
Posted: July 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								I was pretty excited when I first discovered this game. It combines the creative aspects of my two favorite games, Spore and Minecraft, in a whole new framing device. Unfortunately, as I discovered, it's also horrible. The mechanics and controls for both the mining and block placing and the vehicle and item construction are just the absolute worst.The whole thing is crippled by a long list of "poorlies". Poorly constructed hitboxes and collision detection. Poorly distributed and poorly labeled natural resources. Poorly balanced combat and trading mechanics. Poorly organized tech tree and story progression, with missions frequently given out long before you've unlocked the items and abilities required to actually complete them. A poorly designed user interface that consistently suffers from the left hand not knowing what the right hand is doing, and as a result frequently gets in the way of itself.There's very little rhyme or reason to which lines of dialogue are voice acted, with the voice acting often cutting out mid-paragraph or even mid-sentence, and of course the audible dialogue doesn't match the subtitles. The characters all manage to somehow be both obnoxious and forgettable simultaneously. And to top the whole thing off, it isn't even fun!Many have stated before how much potential for greatness this game has. I agree. It could have potentially been a wonderful, terrific game, in the same way that the Soviet Union could have potentially put the first man on the Moon or Hannibal could have potentially conquered Rome. It worked beautifully on paper, but thanks in part to staggering incompetence in the execution, it wound up as an embaressing failure on such a fundimental level as to leave it utterly beyond the possibilty of being fixed, with the great game it could have been left as just that: what could have been.Just buy Spore and Minecraft. You'll save yourself a lot of pain.

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								Waste of money, not worth wasting the time and effort if you really want to make the most out of this game. Seemed like a promising game where one could explore and get lost in alien terrains while building insanely customizable weapons, vehicles, and shelter -- but I found the terrain to be incredibly repetitious and mostly flat and the overall gameplay experience to be very sad. It all seemed very unfinished, as I could swim underneath entire islands, and most shorelines were incredibly steep, and by steep I don't mean cliffy. The camera angles, controls, sound effects, and music are all really horrible. On a lighter note, kudos to whoever designed the alien fauna in it. I encountered a huge variety of ornate looking creatures I hadn't seen from YouTube videos or the Steam page for this game.

content:
Posted: March 28
Product received for free
												At first, I didn't understand the game at all. I stopped playing and thought, what a waste (I got it as a gift). But after a while I gave it a second try and saw the possibilities of this game. I am quite happy with this game now and enjoy building and playing a lot.You really need to understand this game, they have a hard time explaining how to play. Hosting your own game has some issues too, but when it works, it is ok. Sometimes a bit lag or some bugs, and the fighting system isn't very good but acceptable for me. Don't expect a 'perfect' polished game! Be warned!I recommend it if you like: 1. Building, having your own base(s) and people which gives endless possibilities. 2. Designing your own vehicles/aircraft, or use other peoples designs and like to explore.Avoid if you: 1. Haven't played similar building games, because you have a hard time learning (ARK, Minecraft)2. Get frustrated easily

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								Waste of money, not worth wasting the time and effort if you really want to make the most out of this game. Seemed like a promising game where one could explore and get lost in alien terrains while building insanely customizable weapons, vehicles, and shelter -- but I found the terrain to be incredibly repetitious and mostly flat and the overall gameplay experience to be very sad. It all seemed very unfinished, as I could swim underneath entire islands, and most shorelines were incredibly steep, and by steep I don't mean cliffy. The camera angles, controls, sound effects, and music are all really horrible. On a lighter note, kudos to whoever designed the alien fauna in it. I encountered a huge variety of ornate looking creatures I hadn't seen from YouTube videos or the Steam page for this game.

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								I was pretty excited when I first discovered this game. It combines the creative aspects of my two favorite games, Spore and Minecraft, in a whole new framing device. Unfortunately, as I discovered, it's also horrible. The mechanics and controls for both the mining and block placing and the vehicle and item construction are just the absolute worst.The whole thing is crippled by a long list of "poorlies". Poorly constructed hitboxes and collision detection. Poorly distributed and poorly labeled natural resources. Poorly balanced combat and trading mechanics. Poorly organized tech tree and story progression, with missions frequently given out long before you've unlocked the items and abilities required to actually complete them. A poorly designed user interface that consistently suffers from the left hand not knowing what the right hand is doing, and as a result frequently gets in the way of itself.There's very little rhyme or reason to which lines of dialogue are voice acted, with the voice acting often cutting out mid-paragraph or even mid-sentence, and of course the audible dialogue doesn't match the subtitles. The characters all manage to somehow be both obnoxious and forgettable simultaneously. And to top the whole thing off, it isn't even fun!Many have stated before how much potential for greatness this game has. I agree. It could have potentially been a wonderful, terrific game, in the same way that the Soviet Union could have potentially put the first man on the Moon or Hannibal could have potentially conquered Rome. It worked beautifully on paper, but thanks in part to staggering incompetence in the execution, it wound up as an embaressing failure on such a fundimental level as to leave it utterly beyond the possibilty of being fixed, with the great game it could have been left as just that: what could have been.Just buy Spore and Minecraft. You'll save yourself a lot of pain.

												planet explorers is a fun little adventure game with an inovative and in-depth item creation mode that allows you to put anything you can think up into the gameworld to mess around and have fun with, for example have you got an idea for a cool looking plane? using parts and different materials you can use the creator to create your plane and then use in-game materials to craft it and place it for you to hop into and fly around at will. the main downside of planet explorers is the fact that it is so early in development it is difficult to play and feels a little empty, the game also requires more optomisation and graphics options for those with low end PC's*EDIT*After release, I still find it fun to return to the game and mess around with it from time to time, now the story is definitely much longer and I am enjoying it a lot more the second time through

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								The makers of this game clearly have high hopes, but the game itself shows little to no sign of living up to them as yet. While one might wonder if maybe the game is at least not hideously boring at some point in the plot, it certainly is at the beginning. Combined with the clunky interface and cartoony, outdated-looking graphics, more than one gamer has simply gotten bored too quickly to get into it.Worse, the game will not work if a joystick or game controller is even plugged in. This means that gamers need to crawl around behind their machines and unplug these peripherals before playing this game, then crawl around again to plug them in after they're done. As if that wasn't enough, the developers may have known this would happen from the beginning and have not corrected it; if true, then this is a sign of sloppiness and lack of professionalism on the part of the game's designers and a poor omen for the future of the game and the company lazy and shortsighted enough to let it remain like this.

content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								First impressions: 2 hours in.The game is not that bad but it feels alpha in general. If you wish to experience smooth gameplay than this game isn't for you. In short just wait a while till it gets better.Things I didn't enjoy.-Interface feels bulky, to small icons, ugly, confusing.-Interaction with enviroment needs to get better. Right now it's hard to dig a tunnel for example without getting your character stuck or bumping into stuff all the time.-Game runs slow on older machines (makes me turn down the graphics and look like an old windows 98 game). This isn't because the game is that graphical. It's just bad programming at this moment (I suppose it needs to get more effecient).In general when this game is finished and running smoothly it will be worth the money. But now it's "so-so". Will review the game at a later time.

number of helpful: 4 of 12 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								Incredible, I spent 20 euros for a poor game, which worth 5 bucks maybe-   No fight : Close fight is a joke (minecraft look like kind of realistic game in comparison) -   No craft : i suppose Starbound players will be happy, you just choose in a list, no discoveries, no surprises -   No mining : you just mine the surface, underearth there is nothing but dirt, and you fall upon sand (center of the planet ...) some tiles under the surface. Well, you can scan as to find ore from place to place.-  No music : all the time the same theme-  No lure  :  you can head upon north you will discover nothing (the title is "planet exporer" ?) except some "villages" which you have nothing to do with.-  No aim : there are mecanic "boss", 2 kinds of them :  if you search for them some hours you will find some , but well, after you kill them, what else ?-  No choice of characters : you can only choose teenagers figures, ok ok ok-   Fatal error and Freeze screen (reboot your comput, ctrl alt del donot works) will be your best and closest friends in this game, specially while battles. I tell you, this alpha game is basically badly created : nothing could really improve it. Above all the lack of crafting discoveries means this game have no future for adult public, at least.For french people : évitez le. Et♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ il n'y a quasiment rien à faire dans ce jeu, à part redémarrer votre ordi constamment. Franchement, les fan de minecraft vont être drôlement déçus. Il n'y a PAS de craft, il n'y a pas de vrais combats, ce jeu est prévu pour des QI inférieurs à 45.Un truc que j'hésite à faire passer en anglais : on trouve bizarrement peu de commentaire négatifs dans la plupart des classements sur steam, allez savoir pourquoi. Faites comme moi, lisez systématiquement les commentaires négatifs d'abord, vous éviterez les mauvaises surprises.Bon jeu.

number of helpful: 3 of 10 people (30%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								Pro: + Massive maps+ Crafting system that doesn't require a WIKI+ combat that doesn't look like it's from 1985 like some other popular mining games. People complain about the combat, but I think it's ok. You can avoid hits and run away if you need to.+ Mining is sphere based, which means all kinds of nice round edges, no more cubes to hit.+ Mining is addictive because you get a constant stream of resources being gathered.+ Water looks great and acts like a proper fluid.Con:- You can craft while running. Why ?- Music loop is a minut long which makes you feel like you are running around in circles. It hollows out the gameplay and is very annoying after a while.- The game is super overwhelming when you first get into it. Noting is indicated. The learning curve is quite impossible.This game needs alot more tutorials, flashing arrows, flashing indicators, something that gives you at least a hint of what is going on.- Running simulator. Probably because it's story mode, you travel mile after mile of waving grass landscape in the beginnerszone. Ok it's "planet-explorers", but as a freaking pedestrian ?- The lighting system is so awkward that when you are in a giant cave, it looks like it's open-air on the far side but it isn't, it's just terrible lighting.- Very complex item creation system. You'll need alot of time and patience to use it. Zero tutorials.- Starting a new character is extremely slow, some resources take minutes to chop down.- Guns have no recoil. ugly and weird.- My bow is more powerfull than my rife ? Lmao...Conclusion:As opposed to games addicting you into logging back on to continue, this game is the opposite. It doesn't appeal at all and the music makes the whole experiece quite stale. Turn off the music when you get this game.

content:
Posted: January 30
												So the game is ok for a while. There are a lot of quests and there is a full story. The world is beuitiful. Nice vibrant colors.The whole game is voxel based and tbo it looks great considering the whole world can be terraformed etc (Mind you it looks great for a voxel game). "IF" you are into just building and dabbling with the land the game is good for that. An open building sandbox game.Sadly all other aspects of the game lack polish. The simple fact/deal is they made the descision to completely flip game engines during EA. This took them about a year.During this time there were literally no updates to be spoken of. It felt like the game had all but been abandoned. That whole year that could of been spent polishing/fixing the combat/movement/UI was lost. (The UI in particuliar takes the cake for just about the most unintuative POS out there)Fast forward a bit and their investors were getting impatient and pushing Pathea to release as to get their returns.Add all that up and you have what feels like a game that needs/needed more time in the oven. The Devs mentioned themselves it may have been a mistake to redue/overhaul the engine and I'm here to say it isn't may.It absolutely was. It killed the quality of the game and that's sad.One bad move/call cost them what could of been a really great game.If I had to sum the game up in one word it would be "Rough".Rough around the edges in almost everyway.I would say if you can get it on sale you may enjoy the building creating aspect etc. Just don't expect anything mindblowing cause that ship has sailed.

Early Access Review
								As of Jun 10, 2014, the game is just too broken to be worth it.  Every 30-45 seconds of movement, you will fall through the earth or magically float above the ground - gravity and physics are apparently somewhat optional here.  Sometimes you end up back on the ground again, sometimes you just die.  Either way, frustrating.  Even without the physics glitches, the game just isn't that interesting - missions are fairly run-of-the-mill, and the story and environment do little to get you to want to commit to the game.  It's not really bad, it's just not exciting.

content:
Posted: December 4, 2016
Product received for free
												Currently game presents a memory leak, which will eat through your RAM like it is skittles and go for your HDD.As well as there is a very useful vortex caching turned on by default, which may and will eat around 120 GB of space on your hard drive for single world. And it will brick your savefile if it runs out of space on your drive.Other than that, if you manage to stop the game from bricking your savefile or ruining your HDD, it is riddled with lots and lots of bugs, including sequence and gamebreaking.If you manage to sift through all that unfased - you will enjoy a decent exploration game with horrible and illogical story.I actually suspect that two teams of writers worked separately from each other and one of them was obviously inferior, because certain group and it's characters motivations are just plain dumb, while others are quite well fleshed.tl;dr -That bunch who did programming for the game needs to be legally banned from writing anything more complex than "Hello world" print in console. If you manage to cope with that - there is a good game there somewhere. Very deep under all that♥♥♥♥♥♥ Kilometers of it.

number of helpful: 6 of 17 people (35%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 6, 2014
Early Access Review
								There are a lot of proposed features in the game, but all of them are executed in an unintersting fashion. Nothing really stands out, and the environments look bland. Also, the controls and animations are subpar. The bosses spawn randomly and are thrown in even at the beginning when you have little to no resources. Combat is nowhere near fluid either, and you end up spamming the left click button frequently. I last played the game six months ago, and when I downloaded all of the updates I still didn't see any improvements to the core game that really fixed the issues I mentioned before. For the amount of money the game costs, you are better off playing other survival games that may even cost less.

content:
Posted: August 7, 2016
												Controls and animations still suck. Updates are tiny and take forever. Good concept, horrible execution, and at its current rate of development, it might see release right around the same time Star Citizen does in 2021. Titles like this are the reason I don't back games on Kickstarter anymore. A $50 lesson well learned. If you really need a sandbox game to play, there are several titles available on Steam alone which are much further along in the development process (and after considerably less time) worth your time and money. Pathea is made up of a decent bunch of people, but that doesn't make them a competent developer. I backed them because they promised to make a game I wanted to play, not because they're a bunch of nice guys.BTW I invested a good amount of time into this game before Steam. Just figured I'd point that out before some drooling fanboy says something about the 1.4 hours since Steam release.Edit: And now they've released the game, and moved on to other projects. Hey Pathea, how about you FINISH YOUR FIRST GAME BEFORE STARTING ANOTHER!!Just stay far, far away. Go buy Subnautica, Astroneer, Space Engineers, anything but this.

number of helpful: 0 of 5 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								1. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME UNLESS YOUR COMPUTER IS HIGH END*I have a mid to high range computer and I'm running on ALL low settings as well as very low res (which totally ruins this game) and it's still choppy2. Handful of very annoying bugs within first 5 minutes (not game breaking but the kind that purely♥♥♥♥♥♥you off)3. Nothing to do. You get plonked into a world with no aim and on top of that, everything is 'for its own sake'. Why build a tower? Because you can. Why build your own NPC army? Because you can. Yeah you can kill some fat 6 legged dinosaur with a small army but for WHAT? Bigger pieces of food? No, come on.Those are my major issues, that broke the game only a couple of minutes in. There are many minor issues I had already encountered...All the rumours you heard about its bad controls are true; this is the worst experience I've *ever* had in gaming with 'user friendliness'. Yeah there's lots of animals. But they move around with random pathing, so plenty of them are all just walking into trees all around the world and permanently stuck. The animals don't make any noise and rarely interact or even acknowledge one another, they'll even just sit there walking into each other head first endlessly... so the landscape feels *dead* and void... do not trust the hype in their trailers. There is NO tutorial so expect to be playing with guides up at the same time. Nothing in this game is 'intuitive', meaning it doesn't feel natural and you often get the feeling of "wtf did I just do?". The combat is P A T H E T I C even for an alpha, something that should have been address months and months ago. Almost all the animations are buggy. The quests are typical "Do my laundry then find 800 copper" which actually isn't so bad at the start but clearly its not a sustainable model of replayability. I can go on and on... and I was only playing the game for 20 minutes. The rest of my time on the game was me trying to figure out why such a crappy looking game killed my PC. I'm extremely disappointed in myself for trusting their trailer. It's not the same game. Be VERY catious with your money on this one and *DO NOT BUY THIS UNLESS YOUR PC IS GRAPHICALLY POWERFUL*.

content:
Posted: February 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								Won't run on my system. I've got a pretty ordinary Core i7, Win7 64-bit machine. But I get a fatal error message when I try to run the game in whatever mode. If I continue, all I get is a black, empty world and a set of control icons that don't seem to do anything. So, overall, not the most fun I've ever had in a game.I've tried a few basic fixes, and I've waited a couple of months in the hopes of a patch. No luck. From the many positive reviews here, I have to assume the game does run, for a lot of users. On the other hand, from the long, long "problems" thread in the forums, I can see that it fails for a lot of others, not just me. That's not good enough. I've got a ton of Early Access games loaded and running fine. They're at various phases of completion, but the key word is "access" - if the game doesn't run, I'm not getting "access," early or otherwise. And there are only so many hoops I'm willing to jump through. If 999 other games work great on my system, and this one doesn't, am I seriously supposed to blame my system?So, for now, a sad thumbs-down from me. I'll keep an eye out for further updates, and gladly revise my review - as soon as the game lets me.

number of helpful: 4 of 14 people (29%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game looked really promising from the preview, but that's where the good things stop.Aside the fact that the game's main gimmick seems to be the concept that you can build your own furniture, weapons, vehicles and other- there's too much that gets in the way. My computer isn't awful. I can run plenty of modern games at a decent framerate, but Planet Explorers is so badly optimized it makes playing the game a chore. If that wasn't bad enough already, the game is an eyestrain at best. The art direction is all over the place, and that's kind of to be expected with generated terrain. However, when all that seems to generate is flat after flat, I kind of lose any interest in potential "exploration". There's nothing to see, anywhere. The enemies are laughable, and the game is really, really buggy.To top it off, the UI is a colossal mess that doesn't seem to work 90% of the time. There is no easy way to navigate the menus, and it takes a lot of fidgeting to finally get some semblence of understanding of where everything is located.If you are gonna buy it, listen to the main menu music once. Then turn it off. There, you've heard the soundtrack to the game. Unless you want to hear it forever, for the rest of you experience with Planet Explorers, please for the love of god turn off the music.Perhaps the developers will be able to fix these features in the future, but as it stands- stay far away. There's better sandbox games on Steam right now.

number of helpful: 2 of 10 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								This looked to be the next step in crafting-game evolution. Unfortunately, poor implementation means this is one to avoid. First of all, there is no reason for this to be third-person POV. It causes the combat and crafting mechanics to be awkward and clunky at best -- and frustrating beyond belief at the worst moments.Secondly, the mining system is a nightmare. There is zero indication of what ore might be found where -- just whack around until you find something, I guess! (See edit below.)The developers get points for ambition, but until there is a major overhaul of the entire game, I'm not going to spend much time playing it. Alas, I regret this purchase.EDIT: I forgot that first-person POV is possible (I had tried it, and forgot, since I immediately switched back to third-person). We don't see what's in our hands. There is no indication that a sword (or pickaxe, etc) is being swung. Mining in first-person is unfathomable. Here's a screenshot:


First-person POV while mining. The blue circle is where I will strike. I don't know if I'm taking an action or not; there is NO indication. 
A Screenshot of Planet Explorers
By: Joey Jo-Jo Junior Shabadoo




Perhaps a future update will let us see tools/weapons in first-person.There is a scanner (thank you, Anrj, for the comment), but it's vague at best: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=264180346 The campaign requires a search for tin, but it doesn't appear on the scanner.I did manage to find the required items, so I might keep playing. But my recommendation is still Don't Buy.

number of helpful: 1 of 8 people (13%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								DISCLAIMER: I played this game on multiplayer mode ONLY on version A0.82 ."Planet Explorers" brings all the joys of Everquest: Landmark and Runescape into one gigantic ball of overpriced crap. It's hard to know where to even start with this one. The monsters look like something out of the Spore Creature Creator except, unlike Spore, these creatures actually sap the sense of adventure right out of the game. The combat system is entirely non-existent, with amazing innovative features like slow spam attacks and no detectable hitboxes. Controlling the character is akin to jabbing your eye with a pointed stick while furiously masturbating to Rosie O'Donnell. I could go on, but I think a metaphor would serve the purpose far better:Someone comes up to you and offers you a gatorade for free, and you say "wow! Thanks! This tastes great!" The same person then asks if you would like to try a completely new flavor of gatorade that is specifically designed to cure cancer, acne, and world hunger. Of course, you say "I would love to try that new flavor of yours," but little do you know that the special flavor is actually just urine-infused hose water, and, WOW, IT'S ON SALE FOR $15! THAT'S A STEAL! So the guy makes your gross hose water for the next hour and then pours a nice big tub of it right on your lap before running off with your wallet.Don't buy this game.

When I entered into a single player game, I could walk through most trees, and the voxel terrain deformation is more like "hit the ground a few times and a slightly concave and clearly square bit of terrain will dissapear!" When my friend tried out the single player, he literally could not spawn in. He would just fall through the world every time he would respawn. It happened 3 times in a row, before he rage quit the game. Worst money I've ever spent and I have no illusions of getting my money's worth as long as it remains even an iota like this.

Posted: November 11, 2016
												Currently at the time of this writing I CANNOT recomend this game based on the grounds that the Development team has ignored UI issues presently in the game that make it hard for people with certain visual impairments or general vision loss to actually enjoy the game.  And as for someone who DOES in fact have a visual impairment this grealy effects my ability to enjoy the game to it's fullest potential.  it should be noted as well that these issues were brought to the attention of the Dev team during the beta phase of the game's devlopment as well as suggestions that could be implimented fairly easily to rectify said issues.  Presently there is NO UI SCALING in the game and all though some text areas have been addressed and text has been made larger in some respects.  But even at 1080p the current scaling is currently unaceptable.  Alos many of the UI Elements in the game, buttons, interface backgrounds and even some text rely heavily on the color blue.  for people who cannot percieve the blue color spectrum I would strongly suggest avoiding this game until the UI is darkened to create a stronger contrast to make text and other UI elements visible.   Also there may exist some recent gracphics changes to the display of collected items and or resources that could also make it difficult for individuals with varying degrees of color blindness to enjoy the game without furstration.  Also there is what I percieve as missing key information in quite a few tooltips within the game mainly in game creation and the onscreen map interface that you can see in the varous screenshots provided.  So it is mainly guess work as to what these features do or how they impact world generation.  As for the game itself.  There really is a lot to see and do and a lot of thought has been put in to both the story mode and the adventrue mode.  I am actually glad to see that they made changes to adventrue mode that in a way bring it more in line with story mode.  If you're wondering how you could compare the two.  Story mode is just that a story based adventrue that could be used as a very long tutorial for Adventrue mode.  As for Adventrue mode,  think of it more along the lines of the sandbox type game you would expect, i.e. Terraria and or Minecraft, (But of course with much better graphics in both cases) As for the overall dificulty of the game as it has been explained by the dev team, there really is no real difficulty settings for the game even though the user is presented with an Easy and Normal mode settings.  there might be some slight changes in enemy toughness but it's not enough to really play the game on Easy difficulty settings.  One of the nicest features of the game though is the ability to create your own items through the built in ISO editor, this allows you to make weapons, armor vehicles and other items that can be used in the game.  it does take awhile to figure out how things work, but once you do you can make some really interesting items.  the only draw back to the system is there is limitations on some weapons on how powerful you can make them.  So ideas of the 50 barrel shotgun are out the window with this one.  All and all is it a good game, Yes I would say it is, but also as I said, for someone with a visual impairment the game is not user friendly and not recomended at this time.
