content:
Posted: February 19
												Wow. What a piece of absolute garbage. The developers really dropped the ball on this one. Bought it while in Early Access, because there were a lot of great ideas. Played it then. It wasn't awful at its stage in development. I thought, "I can see this making a great game someday." Well, that someday came.Cons: - Music is just godawful. When it doesn't sound like some cheesy background score from the shopping interface in the Sims, these abysmal vocal tracks play. Why on Earth would I want to listen to music with lyrics in this game? They're not even good lyrics. It sounds like someone on the dev team got their mom's church band friends to record a song for charity. Seriously does not help the tone.- The character creator interface is not intuitive. I appreciated being able to change my hair to literally any shade imaginable. Other than that, serious lack of ingenuity. Nothing special about it. Might as well have made the player a specific protagonist for all the flavor it adds.- The cut scenes are blatantly unfinished. No score plays throughout. Voice acting doesn't fit the character models, and sometimes it doesn't even sync. Once again, there is no definitive tone. So I'm stuck wondering what the h3ll I'm supposed to think or feel. This is STORY mode? Where's the story? Might as well not even be part of the game.- Skipped the tutorial because it was not compelling. I got this far, through the boring character creator, that awful song, a cut scene that made me want to puke, what incentive do I have to sit through what is no doubt a crappy tutorial as well?- Started on the planet. Right away, the game wants me to talk to some lady who's not feeling well. Probably because we were in a crash. Hang on. I just crashed on the surface of an alien world and you want me to CHAT WITH SOME CARSICK NPC?!?!?!? I then decided to run around. For some reason, this PC game about EXPLORATION has the worst camera controls imaginable. The mouse is virtually useless. The camera slowly turns to point in the direction my character is running... WHAT!? IS THIS 1995!? You have a mouse. USE IT. Oh well. I ran around, picked up some fruit, then I jumped into the ocean and experienced some glitching when I tried to swim. That was the last straw.Seriously. This game had a ton of potential in development. All squandered because someone's mom's church band wanted to do right by God. ♥♥♥♥ you, God. This is trash. I wish I'd never survived that plane crash in Alaska when I was 11. 10/10 Would avoid playing this for two years again

Early Access Review
								Whatever you do, do not buy this game. It is by far the worst game I have ever bought. Everything in it is broken. The AI, the voxel system, the combat, everything. The trailer and gameplay may look cool, but I promise you it does not live up to that potential. The single most important resource is iron. My ffriend and I spent 2 and a half hours before we could find a single piece but we needed eight more pieces so we could not get one shotted by any wildlife in the game. Now the best experience I've had in this game is when I die I have to restart the game just to respawn. In order to respawn, you need a certain item. You spawn with 25 of this item. My friend and I eventually ran out because we spawned next to some dinosaur and consistently got one shotted. When we ran out, we could not respawn and had to restart the game. When we joined a different server, we had to restart the game. This happened to both of us. This was about 2 years ago and there has not been a single patch that has fixed anything worthy since. So please, do not waste your money on this game as I did.

content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								Where do you even start with this...This game could have been amazing. I say could because the major issues cannot simply be fixed with patches, the whole engine needs to be redone.I wanted to start with the qualities of this game but I feel dissapointed, this game could have been so much more. You're given an open world, the ability to shape the world, an in-depth crafting system and a lot of stuff to do.Let's start off with the biggest flaws of the game - the controls and combat.Controls are clunky and work against you, the floaty jump seems to serve no purpose and is mostly a waste of time to use because of how combat works. When you engage in combat with any melee enemy they will automaticly lock on to you and keep charging into you. You'll get trapped inside of the bigger enemies and jumping out of the way doesn't seem to do much. Weapons feel bland and uninspired. You get a comicbook style effect when your arrows land and the only visual representation of dealing damage to a target is by looking at the incredibly small healthbar at the top of your HUD.AI is equally terrible. Usually this wouldn't mean much for a game like this. However, for some reason the story mode is filled with escort missions. You have to carry these worthless drones around, usually just to look at something only to be told to meet back at camp. If friendly NPCs weren't immortal gods with fists of steel dealing 10 times the damage you can ever hope to achieve I'd say they serve no purpose. They get stuck constantly, they're slow and if you dare think you can use that fancy glider while you're escorting someone you're most likely going to have to walk all the way back to pick up your lazy slob friend as the AI refuses to find a way to you. They also tend to stay out of fights until you've been beaten up a bit just out of spite.If escort missions weren't a part of this game the AI would be just about acceptable, no more than that.The sound effects are bad and the voice acting is awful, possibly the worst I have ever heard. It becomes rather obvious that the so called voice actors are just the devs doing silly voices. Good audio plays such a major role in video games and putting a bit of effort into improving the audio would go a long way.The visuals aren't great. The textures are dated and animations look stiff. The wildlife is filled with different animals but sadly a lot of them seem to be reskins and many of them share the same animations. There is however another issue with these "animals". A very important part of coming up with new creatures is to make them somewhat resemble something we already know. Many of these creatures look absurd and I am not sure if they really belong in this world. There's a creature that walks around on four legs, has two arms and for some reason it's wearing a mask. Why? I don't know, it doesn't make sense.The one thing this game has going for it as far as I can tell is the building mode. If you are the creative type and you set aside some time to understand the building mode you could create some incredible vehicles and weapons. This is a game however and a lot of people aren't interested in spending hours creating 3d models.I never set foot into the multiplayer of this game as I couldn't bring myself to recommending this game to any of my friends so I can't judge that aspect.It feels as if the devs know that the game can never be what they wanted it to be and turned to the cash cow that is early access. I would not recommend this game for anyone other than people interested in 3d modeling.

								Do you enjoy being lied to about features?Perhaps you enjoy a non-responsive options menu?Oh I know what you will reall love, you'll love our lack of intuitive control scheme, responding camera and a camera mode that makes any sense!Yes folks, step right up and drop 25$ USD on this game to enjoy our full suite of non-responsive options menu, a beautiful camera system that does nothing but pan up at the sky all day, no matter how hard you try to pan it back down to a more sensical. We want you to gaze upon the sky in wonderment as the only other thing you're able to see thanks to our amazing camera will be nothing but tree tops and mountains.If you can't even develop a camera system that makes sense, how the HELL do you expect people to build anything at all? And no free flying in a creative mode? Are you kidding me? Planet 9/10Options Menu 10/10 (Would troll player again)Camera System 15/10 (Hey, if the camera system is broke, why can't I break a ratings system? After all, I learned it from these developers).Anything good about this game at all? Meh, the expansiveness is awesome, the graphics are pretty good and the lack of super noticeable and huge blocks like Minecraft is awesome. But they might as well have♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥that all away by using a camera system that only pans up to the sky everytime you click it to move/angle it.Can I get a refund on an Alpha? How easy is that?If I had a YouTube channel and some good Fraps programs...I'd love to rip this game a new one. Lmao.

number of helpful: 3 of 16 people (19%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								As a summary for those who don't want to read this whole review, this game is pretty, but it's not really what it appears to be at first glance. Try an actual sandbox instead of the 'amazing sandbox voxel rpg' that the developers claim it is.After all of the below, I noticed my windows firewall had blocked something from its files, which I ignored since it was a PNG file, started playing again, and my computer restarted, and I lost all my progress (even the 15 minutes I spent building a house out of dirt).To start, I'll just explain the gist of the character creation and story, and what I did.So, the first thing you see is a male character in his underpants and no tutorial on customization. That's fine, since everything is labeled and at that point EVERYTHING is point-and-click, so there's no problem there.A cutscene happens. There's a ship's captiain saying something that I couldn't hear so it was esentially gibberish to me. Something about historic mo's mints for humming beans. Then the ship sees another ship, then the captain says "OH H***" (censored for VERY sensitive people, it's not actually a swear word but still shouldn't be said) and then they all crash on planet Maria. Oh, dearie me.Then there's this person that needs a healing tonic on the planet. Your hero is a jumpsuit-wearing idiot with no facial expression at all that jumps way too high. First I had to look up how to get resources. The answer was HOLDING right click with a tool to fit the resource you want to collect. For the plants I needed, I figured the knife would work, and that did the trick. I crafted the tonic, and realized something about the inventory.It's annoying. EVERY item you get says 'new' on it and you have to click it to make the new sign go away. But if you already HAVE dirt and then mine more, it says 'new', and it's clearly not.So I gave the tonic or salve or whatever to the NPC and they say they need water to wash it down.Wait a minute, I give them liquid and they need water to wash it down. And they were HURT, for crying out loud! So I get the water and run into a four armed monkey on the way back.At this point I'm about to throw my keyboard at the wall, so I attack it with my knife (hold LEFT click), deal 0.1 damage, and it hits me and then... walks slowly away. The AI is also quite bad, in case you haven't guessed.I continue back to the NPC and they take it and say a boat crashed to the north (on land, I might add) and I need to get them a doctor. At this point I'm so fed up I start building a house out of the FIVE HUNDRED dirt that was in the emergency crate, because everyone needs dirt in emergencies. I continue building my house, place the bed, and then the firewall incident happens.Just to wrap this up, I have all of this game's pros and cons.PROS+The game is pretty, and it looks great.+Later in the game (I assume) it is much faster-paced.+The graphics and models aren't bad at all, except for the trees.CONS-The controls say there's a first-person mode, but there isn't.-On the subject of the controls, the most fun I had was noclipping around building my house in freebuild mode.-You have to cut down trees with knives, and you have to HOLD right click to do so. It says you use E but that doesn't work at all.-The player and NPC animations are horrid.-The building is tedious.-You literally CANNOT do anything BESIDES building a dirt house with a wooden bed in the tutorial if you want to get off-track. And the NPC that forces you to do it is annoying.-The story is almost non-existent.-The name doesn't actually do anything. I named my character 'Bananayuyu's Slave' and it appeared in ONE dialog, and it was pronnounced by a computer as 'Bana you e you e's Salve' and that's just SAD.-Meat is currency, and you can't get any besides the 1000 you find in a crate for some reason.-You can't mine the ship you crash-land in, which made me even angrier because at that point, I just wanted something flaming and explosive to throw at the tutorial NPC.As you can see, there are MANY more cons than pros. This game may be nice, but it has less story than the first five minutes of Terraria, plays like Minecraft in third person (near unplayable) and has graphics like Skyrim and models to match. The lighting and water are also great.I seriously hope this is improved in another update, but they'd have a 'spaceship captain' of a lot to fix.Now that I'm done, I'm going to play Super Paper Mario on my Wii. Sure, it's older, but it's better by far.

Early Access Review
								I just remembered this game while uninstalling games I've played/finished and/or will never, ever play again. Well, this is one of them. You might find this a bad review but shortly? It's the most clunky game I have ever played and that goes to everything from the UI to simple mechanics such as digging. I remember the digging so well because it was the reason I finally closed the game and never went back.But no, it wasn't all bad I recall: colorful and creative fantasy themed graphics and fun creatures to kill.But yeah I can't recommend it (unless you really, really want to support the game devs I guess). Keeping an eye on this game though, maybe one day it'll get out of being early access...
